Let's look around; maybe we'll catch a spark of inspiration to solve this riddle.
I didn't realize we'd climbed so high already.
I think I found it—the scenery is what she wanted me to see.
The first time I came here, my sister was already too busy to come home often.
But when she knew I was preparing for my exam, she still managed to make some time for me. We came here together to relieve my anxiety.
When I finally made it atop this mountain, and saw how beautiful it is here, I felt the joy of climbing for the very first time.
I thanked her for inspiring me to reach this height.
The vast expanse before my eyes helped cast away all the burdens in my heart.
Seeing such a beautiful sight, my stress lessened, and it definitely helped me passing Leyi Academy's entrance exam.
And there's another important reason.
During the final interview, someone gave up their opportunity. That's how I got off the waiting list.

Growth is perhaps like climbing a mountain, with one peak after another waiting for me to ascend. The pains of blood, sweat, and tears will ultimately transform into boundless joy upon reaching the summit.
Really? What is it?
Is that so? Sounds like my sister did say something along those lines.
These gifts were a record of my efforts, and I thought she was just trying to keep me working hard…
I didn't realize she was dissatisfied with how I viewed myself.
I remember she once said...
Luck isn't the determining factor for your success, but you are.
Back then, I didn't pay much attention to those words. I just felt I wasn't good enough.
Thank you for helping me understand my sister's thoughts.
Thanks for helping me understand my sister's thoughts. I'll take her words to heart and welcome the new chapter of my life with greater confidence!
Thanks for accompanying me all the way and helping me find these precious gifts.
By the way, Shiyu made her decision after climbing this mountain.
She climbed to the summit of West Mountain... and that was when she decided to become a soldier, and fight on the frontlines.
I've never been to the top of West Mountain. Now, I kinda want to visit the summit she once conquered.
My sister's can't stay with me now, but I can still reach the summit she conquered on my own.
No! My sister managed to conquer the West Mountain on a rainy day. I don't want to lose to her!
I'll wait until it rains. I will challenge her on equal grounds.
Do you want to join me? Only a handful of people managed to climb to the West Mountain's top.
Great! I remember it might rain tomorrow. Let's climb the mountain together!
When the time's right, I'll send you a message, and let's meet at the foot of West Mountain!
Seems we're all rested. Let's keep moving!
Look! A camp stove!
It's getting late. How about we take a rest here?
A good rest will freshen us up for the journey ahead!
Woof! Woof!
Seems like Pudding is hungry too. They've been helping me find the gift all day.
Let me whip up some Jinzhou Stew. You'll love it!
Oh, do you have a specialty?
That's great! I can't wait to taste it!
You all gathered around and enjoyed a simple yet delicious dinner.
So full... Phew... It's been a while since I've relaxed so leisurely.
It kinda takes me back to the days when I came here with my sister.
Yes, but I also worry about her a lot.
Though we're sisters, we're quite different.
I grew up studying for exams, like most Jinzhou kids.
After studying for so many years, I finally got the job I like.
A peaceful life, as calm as dead water. It seems to be my life in a nutshell.

Instead of spending time in school, she traveled around with her teacher, mastering Martial Arts and engaging in contests to hone her skills.
Eventually, she joined the Midnight Rangers, so we barely see each other—maybe a few times a year, I'd say?
Despite her busy life, I know she cares about me.
In crucial moments of my life, she's always there for me, climbing higher and higher on this mountain together.
Each height where a gift is hidden was once an obstacle for me.
I somewhat understand that she probably wants me to take a step back and reflect on how far I've gone.
So she hid the gifts in these places…
Sorry for troubling you. If only I was a Resonator too...
It's actually so beautiful up here, but few people ever come here to appreciate it.
Let's walk slowly. It's not bad to treat this climb as a sightseeing tour. I will be your guide!

I didn't get it at first. What's wrong with being an engineer? I didn't do anything to them.
All I've heard was that some Exiles hate Jinzhou government employees, but I didn't expect myself to get caught in it this time.
I've only been on the job for a few years, but I know that a colleague got hurt by some Exiles once.
Ah! Yes! I was just getting to it.
Then he was rescued by the Patroller, they caught the Exiles who kidnapped him, and after some questioning they found out that...

That the leader of the Exiles failed the exam for a position he was applying for for ten years straight, so out of fury he resorted to becoming an Exile, and gets mad at every government employee he sees.
After I was kidnapped, their leader, Haixing, told me that she wanted me to help them repair a collapsed treasure cave.
I pretended to comply at first, I even went to the cave to check on it, and then I stalled for as long as I could to wait for rescue.
Maybe I stalled for too long or it's just my bad acting, anyway, they found out what I was planning, and that's when they showed their true colors! They even threatened my life!
I'm not the kind of person you'd kidnap and still expect me to help you fix something. No way!
Didn't their mothers teach them how to say please when they were young? Those little crooks!
There was no chance in hell I'd do as they say! And then... They stopped giving me food.
Let's talk as we walk, we can't be just standing here, I don't want to get caught again.
Hello! Here you are.
My Phonotesters will continuously attract those TDs.
And these generators will generate new Explosive Spears non-stop. Just throw them at those TDs with the Levitator on your Terminal.
You're right, but we don't have time to build a launcher... Or perhaps we can say, YOU are the launcher. Does it sound cooler now? Hahaha...
We're facing a lot of Tacet Discords. Young man! Unleash the power of Explosive Spears and give us an explosive climax!
We're facing a lot of Tacet Discords. Young Lady! Unleash the power of Explosive Spears and give us an explosive climax!

Sorry. I should've arrived sooner.

Beneath the full moon, guide the returning one to confront Threnodian. From the threat itself, she shall reclaim the power to conquer it.

Are these the spectators we saw earlier?
Are these the spectators we saw earlier?

Are these fallen soldiers manifestations of memories... or the Tacet Discords' imitations?

According to what we've learned, this battle happened a decade ago. Why are they only calling out to us now?

Me? But I didn't even know them.

During that past battle in Desorock Highland, did you...

They probably didn't want it to happen again. All those deaths and losses...

Yes... I didn't attend the memorial that day, but that was when I finally realized...
Knell Square... It is the place where our career as soldiers begins and ends.

The incident dates back to when Lollo Logistics established our Jinzhou branch.
That place became infested with a large amount of Incinero Petals, which produced a great deal of toxic pollen and forced the inhabitants away.
Besides, the Center for Wutherological Climate Studies discovered dangerous Gravity Storms in that area. It was a perilous destination for anyone to approach.
Should the pollen be swept into the upper atmosphere by unexpected Gravity Storms, it would pose a danger to Jinzhou and its surrounding regions.
Absolutely. To prevent the pollen from spreading, researchers determined that the only solution was to destroy the Core Tacet Mark of those Incinero Petals.
The Huaxu Academy manufactured an Explosive Spear to disable the Tacet Mark, but the terrain was too dangerous for regular vehicles.
Most of the Tacetite vehicles were deployed at the frontlines as the Midnight Rangers fought the TD Outbreak. The researchers couldn't deliver the Spear to the center of the Sea of Flames.

So they were reduced to entrusting Lollo Logistics, with delivering the Explosive Spears to the designated spot. We were the only group with spare Tacetite vehicles. After that, Midnight Rangers would go destroy the Tacet Mark with those Spears, risking their lives in the process.
It was obvious to any sensible person how dangerous the task was, but Lollo Logistics accepted the challenge, because we wanted to stick to our motto: We Promise, We Deliver.
Yet... We couldn't make it in the end. Our couriers failed to deliver the Spear in time, despite their best efforts.
Only one Spear was successfully delivered, but the Midnight Rangers were understanding of us. They thanked us nonetheless.

The Rangers decided to escort our couriers out of the Sea of Flames with most of their people, while the couple of them left behind would take turns to charge at the Tacet Mark, at the cost of their lives.
They relayed efforts to bring the only Spear closer to the Tacet Mark. Their bodies burned, exposed to a deadly concentration of toxic pollen. They went Overclocked in the end.
...Because that Spear was damaged during transportation. It failed to explode when it pierced into the Tacet Mark, so the target wasn't effectively deactivated.
Fortunately, we managed to control the Tacet Mark and slow down the spread of Incinero Petals. We regulated the pollen concentration to prevent it from endangering the entire Jinzhou.
While nobody blamed them, but the Lollo Logistics employees who survived were still filled with remorse. They thought it was their mistakes that costed the honorable military their lives.

Yes, the one we built this statue for. The Sentinel in Jinzhou. There is one capital and six cities in Huanglong, with each city having its own Sentinel. While they share some similarities in appearance, there are also differences.

There are one capital and six cities in Huanglong, with each city having its own Sentinel. While they share some similarities in appearance, there are also differences.
Sentinels are present where civilizations thrive. Huanglong stands out with the highest number of currently coexisting Sentinels, because of its long history and vast land.
Records state the Sentinels in Huanglong were once a single entity. Now they are each responsible for a part of Huanglong.
Naturally, there are Sentinels in other regions too, but far fewer compared to Huanglong.
In Huanglong, most of the Sentinels take the shape of a Loong. In other regions, they manifest in various forms...

A soulmate? Hmm...
So Madam Magistrate left some hidden clues in her tokens. Clues that only the right person would be able to decipher...
But Rover has lost all memories, and would likely forget any kind of decryption method they agreed on. It doesn't quite make sense. Or maybe... She is trying to make Rover notice something else?
Rover, do you mind if we have a look at the tokens?
You showed Yangyang and Chixia the tokens.
So, what's so special about them?
A candy? Oh! I've had these when I was a kid. I think they were called... Sugar pearls?
But I haven't seen anything like this in a while... Went out of trend maybe?
It reminds me of my childhood. I still remember the taste. It was so sweet.
I was really scared of getting my flu shots when I was little, and sometimes the nurse lady would hand out candies like this as a prize for being good.
But... What does it mean as a token?
It seems like... a miniature sundial.
It is a horological device that tells time by using sunlight's direction.

Sundials in Huanglong usually have marked lines for the twelve Shichens in a day, and every Shichen is 2 hours long, with some showing seasons or months. The design of this sundial looks a bit unusual, though...
On this sundial... Time seems to be represented by the twelve Earthly Branches, drawn on the outer ring of its surface.

And its inner ring shows the Four Symbols, each representing one cardinal direction. These are the four famous auspicious beasts in Huanglong's folklore. They are believed to protect people from all four directions under heaven.
Generally, The Teal Loong represents the East, the White Tiger stands for the West, the Vermilion Bird stands for the South, and finally, we have the Black Tortoise for the North.
It seems this sundial is supposed to show both time and direction, but how could it work when there is not a compass attached? Not to mention the lack of sunlight basically renders it useless...
Ugh. That requires way too much brain power...
The color of this leaf seems a bit odd. Can't tell what tree it is.
I think... I can feel something from it...
Hmm... Nevermind. It's too faint. Maybe it was just my imagination...
Sorry. I can't tell what kind of tree this leaf belongs to, either.
This is... A mangosteen fruit.
Mangosteens are not native to Jinzhou. They are usually imported by boat. I think we can find more mangosteens being sold at the nearby markets.

They're not always available for purchase, though. The frequent Tacet Discord Outbreaks can disrupt transportation and cause shortages. The Midnight Rangers have greatly improved the situation in recent years, but still.
So Chixia and I share similar childhood memories of the sugar pearl... Do you remember it too, Rover?
When it comes to candies, no one knows them better than the kids of Jinzhou!
Oh right, Baizhi's still waiting for us at the Academy!
What do you mean I'm not the VIP the Magistrate's expecting. Go see for yourself, everyone's been talking about it!
Every guest is important to Jinzhou!
They didn't tell me I'm not!
Why can't you let me talk to the Magistrate?!
How far did you get? Did you manage to see the Magistrate?
I got to see... Lady Sanhua! She even looked back at me!
And I even got Lady Sanhua's verbal assurance... That I wasn't the guest the Magistrate was waiting for!
But who cares anyway.
I was able to witness Lady Sanhua in the flesh and be rejected by her in person!
Please, follow me.
Pleased to make your acquaintance. I apologize for the delay. My name is Sanhua, the bodyguard of Madam Magistrate.
I regret to inform you that Madam Magistrate is currently away. Prior to her departure, she instructed me to bring you these tokens and a welcome gift.
You heard the crisp sounds of Weiqi pieces being laid down on the board, followed by a long silence.
You heard the crisp sounds of Weiqi pieces being laid down on the board, followed by a long silence.
There was no response. Maybe those inside are too invested in their game of Weiqi.
There was no response. Maybe those inside are too invested in their game of Weiqi.
The door didn't bulge.
The door didn't bulge.
Anything I can help you with, Rover?
With pleasure. What do you wish to know about Jinzhou?
The Midnight Rangers, under General Jiyan's command, are a garrison in Jinzhou. They consist of the Vanguards for offensive operations against Tacet Discords, and the Rearguards for city defense.
Additionally, there is a detachment unit called the Outriders, mostly made up of volunteers or reservists who serve as reconnaissance agents.
Most of the servicemen of today are comprised of Resonators.
Jinzhou is not the most populated city in Huanglong. As a border city, it is the frontline in countering Tacet Discord Outbreaks.
...Jinzhou holds a special place in my heart.
...I can't say I am too familiar with my hometown, but I do feel a homely sense of attachment to Jinzhou. Maybe it's because here lives a person who changed my life.
Hmm. If I were to introduce Jinzhou in my own words, I'd say it's a city one would easily grow attached to.
Of course. Please feel free to ask me anything, and I will answer to the best of my ability.
Our Magistrate's birth name was Hsi. She took on the name Jinhsi when she became the Magistrate of Jinzhou.
Nowadays, she is usually addressed as Madam Magistrate.
She is also known as the Loong Maiden, because of her Resonance connection with our Sentinel, Jué, who manifests in the shape of a Loong.
The ways Huanglong's Magistrates interact with their corresponding Sentinels can differ. In Jinzhou, our Magistrate seems to share a familial bond with the Sentinel.
Though... This is what I understand from what she has told me. I have only seen our Sentinel a handful of times.
It depends on Madam Magistrate, and...
It depends on your decision, Rover.
Please pardon me. This is all I can say at the moment.
With pleasure. What do you wish to know about the tokens?
I suggest looking into where these tokens come from.

Examine their locations of origin, and explore the sites or past events they represent... Then you should uncover the message Madam Magistrate wanted to convey, and hopefully learn everything you want to know.
Of course. It is fully up to you.
Of course. Please feel free to ask me anything, and I will answer to the best of my ability.
I'm afraid not. I have never seen you before.
If I had, I would never forget you.
Defense at the city gate has been strengthened.
It wasn't like this when we came back...
Access Pass is required if you're heading to the Norfall Barrens. That place is now off-limits.
What is your business, young lady? It's my third shift and you're still here.
Oh, you must be the soldier on duty at noon yesterday. Nice to see you again.
I'm a Resonator and a trained martial artist. I can handle myself. Please, I need to go look for someone.
I've promised the missing man's grandfather to bring him back. Would you let me through?
Be that as it may, I cannot let you given the current circumstances. My apologies.
Well, everything seems fine in the city. Are things really that bad on the frontlines?
That's why we must stay vigilant, so people in the city can go on peacefully with their lives.
Besides, General Jiyan is currently there at the Norfall Barrens base. Dangerous as it is, he will keep an eye on every soldier, including the one you're looking for.
We have already sent a report on your case. You could just go home and wait for the good news. What's the point of staying here?
Thank you, but I have already asked the Patrol Station for help and tried every method I could think of. Please, let me through. I promised him, so I gotta give it my all.
I understand your concern.

I don't want to be a bother. Would it help if I hid my presence and stayed somewhere further away? How about five miles? Or maybe a hundred? A thousand might be too far though, I wouldn't be able to see you clearly...
Listen. Nobody knows when the soldiers will return, and even if they do, you might not find the one you seek.
It's a dangerous road ahead if you want to reach the frontlines, and you don't even have an Access Pass...
...Ahem. Your Access Pass has been verified.
Just you two?
Greetings. I'm Jianxin. Could you please do me a favor?
I want to go look for someone outside the city, but I don't have an Access Pass, so... May I tag along?
Thank you for your kindness!
I'm a jack-of-all-trades: Tai Chi, cooking, tea-making, mining, foraging, errand-running, fixing utilities, and caring for animals. Got something else in mind? I'm always up for learning new skills.
I see. I've got three Guokui Flatbreads, 34 Shell Credits, and the Mirrors of Clarity. They're all yours.
You're right. I should be open about my request. I don't want to lie and cause further trouble for the soldiers.
Thank you for your help! I really appreciate it!
I intend to leave the city with them, and they have agreed. Will it be an issue for you?
I, uh...
Well, it says you have the highest level of access, so no procedural issues here.
Honestly, he could lead an entire troop out of the city with that Access Pass and no one would question it...
Honestly, she could lead an entire troop out of the city with that Access Pass and no one would question it...
Sure!
You don't look like soldiers. Why are you here? The frontlines are right up ahead.
I am Yangyang, an Outrider of the Midnight Rangers.
Yangyang showed her Midnight Rangers badge and Jianxin asked him about Zhiyuan.
Yangyang showed her Midnight Rangers badge and Jianxin asked him about Zhiyuan.
A missing person... Zhiyuan...
The one you're looking for. Is he an average person? Not a Resonator, I suppose?
Yes, have you seen him? Is he alright?
I met him once. He's not officially enlisted, but he seemed determined to join us. He's been secretly following our troops since last year.
I think a quartermaster of the Rearguards escorted him away, so if he's not in the city...

He must be in the Rearguards camp. He can't be anywhere else; the actual frontlines are right up ahead, and we the Midnight Rangers would never allow non-servicemen to approach and risk getting killed.
Thank you!
Now if you're heading that way, I have a request for you, my Outrider comrade.
On your way there, you should run into two Detection Beacons. They just went offline. Could you go check on them?
Sure, we will.
Great. I'll send the coordinates to your Terminal.
Is that the Beacon? Why are there so many people?
They don't look like soldiers...
Greetings. What might interest you here? It's dangerous.
Oh. We, uh... Nothing, really. You see, we're just on our way south, to the city.
Excuse me, about this Detection Beacon...
Run, everyone!
I-I can't move... So hungry...
P-please don't arrest us! We really had no choice!
What happened? Do you need help?
The battles are getting real bad up north, and we couldn't live there anymore. Figured we have to go back to the city.
We ain't eaten in ages, and we're broke. Some of us can barely move 'cause we're so damn hungry.
Then we found some expensive looking stuff here. Now that the military's out there fighting and nobody's really using these thingies, we thought it might get us a few pennies.
A damaged Detection Beacon might result in a sudden TD invasion from the direction it covers.
Our frontline troops would face attacks from both sides. Have you thought about the consequences?
We ain't got the time for that! If we don't steal, we'd starve to death before the Tacet Discords kill us.
You shouldn't be stealing public property. Please return the parts.
There's still some distance from here to Jinzhou city. Here, you can have my flatbreads.
And here's some money. This should be enough for you to reach the city.
You're giving us... all of these? Thank you. Thank you!
Hey! You! Come over and say thank you before you eat!
It was nothing. Master once told me, The sage takes care of all men, and abandons none.
Watch out!
Watch out!
I-I can't move... So hungry...
P-please don't arrest us! We really had no choice!
What happened? Do you need help?
The battles are getting real bad up north, and we couldn't live there anymore. Figured we have to go back to the city.
We ain't eaten in ages, and we're broke. Some of us can barely move 'cause we're so damn hungry.
Then we found some expensive looking stuff here. Now that the military's out there fighting and nobody's really using these thingies, we thought it might get us a few pennies.
A damaged Detection Beacon might result in a sudden TD invasion from the direction it covers.
Our frontline troops would face attacks from both sides. Have you thought about the consequences?
We ain't got the time for that! If we don't steal, we'd starve to death before the Tacet Discords kill us.
You shouldn't be stealing public property. Please return the parts.
There's still some distance from here to Jinzhou city. Here, you can have my flatbreads.
And here's some money. This should be enough for you to reach the city.
You're giving us... all of these? Thank you. Thank you!
Hey! You! Come over and say thank you before you eat!
It was nothing. Master once told me, The sage takes care of all men, and abandons none.
Watch out!
Watch out!
We're beggin' ya, stop! We surrender. Take us in!
Why did you attack us when I already gave you food and funds?
Do you have other mouths to feed, aside from what we see here?
They seem trained... These are not ordinary people.
O-of course we are ordinary people! We just... we just joined the Exiles recently.

We done some wrongs. Tried to run from them Patrollers and left the city, but dang, didn't know the battles up north were so crazy. Our new boss ran outta food before we could even figure out the camp. Figured we'd be better off just go back to the city and get locked up...
Then we ran outta food and cash halfway. So we turned to thieving.
We ain't got the balls to rob the army, but with stuff just sitting around, why not?
Hey, since you're being so generous, how about you throw a little extra cash our way? There's a bunch of us, some injured too. Your first amount ain't gonna cut it for us to survive.
Wait. What I gave them was more than enough for them to make it to Jinzhou.
Wait. What I gave them was enough for them to make it to Jinzhou, even when they are so many.
I used to travel alone when I left my Master. I know how much it takes for someone to survive.
Hey! What's wrong with you, girlie? It won't hurt to give us more!
Pain comes with coveting. He who knows he has enough is rich. It was only meant to sustain you long enough for you to reach the city.
You don't understand, girl. You don't make money very easily in a time like this. If we can't find jobs in the city, we gonna starve again.
I came from a seclusive place, learning the ways of the world from scratch. It's been a hard time, but even I have managed to make a living with my own hands.
If you really can't find any job in the city, come to Liuxian Teahouse and ask for Jianxin. I'll gladly help you search for jobs and work alongside you.
Tsk... Fine! Fine! We'll go.
Hurry, move! Let's get outta here. I'm not listening to this lecture anymore.
I wasn't trying to... Wait, please put that down.
Ugh, quite the sharp eye you got. Fine! Here you go!
Is this the only Detection Beacon you messed with?
Heck yeah! Just the first one we were trying to steal and you bumped right into it.
Really? Then why does that one over there seem broken too?
That ain't got nothing to do with us! It has been that way for ages. Plus, we ain't ever reaching it with all those thorns.
I see. You may leave now.
The military's base is not far from here. Shall we fix the Beacons before going?
Is it... fixed?
Yes. Let's go and check on the next one.
Awesome, we've got the second Beacon fixed.
Master Jianxin, are you alright?
This is my first time on a battlefield. It feels so different here...
I know another shipment of supplies has just arrived. I've confirmed it, but it's not nearly enough. We must reach out to the city again and demand more supplies immediately.
But the approval process is going to...
Tell them it's an emergency. We are working around the clock here. Any delay could mean the end of our defense. Do they not comprehend? Here's the list of what we need.
I'll talk to them if you can't make them listen! Now go go go!
Move, move! What is it? Why are we still not done distributing these?
You new here? Are you backups too?
Wait, you don't look like one of us...
I am Yangyang, an Outrider of the Midnight Rangers. And they are...
Yangyang showed her Midnight Rangers badge.
Yangyang showed her Midnight Rangers badge.
Excuse me. One moment, please.
Careful! This chest holds vital medical supplies. If the wounded return and find no medicine, it's on you. Handle with care and precision!
An Outrider? So you are part of the backup force, right? Now, I've got wounded soldiers coming soon, and you're just in time to help.
Sorry. Have to answer this.
Yes. What is it?
An Overclocked Resonator? Understood. I'll be there immediately.
I'm sorry... Erm, could you do me a favor?

The wounded soldiers are being sent back from the frontlines. We need someone to escort them to the medics, but I've got to deal with the Overclocked Resonator now. Could you please take care of them?
What exactly do you need us to do?
Just make sure they are safe. The medics will take care of their wounds.
Thank you.
It's so busy here... Looks like they don't even have the time to catch their breath.
Supplies, medical care, equipment maintenance, personnel management, and logistics... They must carefully manage these matters to provide vital support for our fighters.
So this is what a real war looks like. I had no idea it could get this bad.
Most people would never have the chance to witness any of this. It's natural for you not to know.
I think this is exactly what our military strives for—to ensure peace and safety for our citizens. It's a sacrifice made so others don't have to live in fear.
Like I said, it's not a big deal! No need to fix me up! Let me go!
Please calm down. Your wound is still bleeding.
That's barely a scratch! You can't stop me!
That's not bravado! My wounds can close on their own. It's my Resonance ability. The medics should go take care of other people in need!
Stop squirming, will you? We're here because you need our help. Calm down and stay where you are!
Please hold him still for me.
Sure...
After some chaos, you helped medics in treating the wounded.
Hah... hah...
Are you alright?
I'm okay... just... a little... out of breath...
It's okay... I'm fine...
I'll go find a medic.
You brought the medic over to take care of Xinyu.
Thank you for your assistance. You must be tired. Please take some rest.
They look badly injured...
Don't worry. They've received proper treatment now. They will recover in time. Thanks to General Jiyan, we've seen a significant drop in the number of casualties.
I've heard from veterans that our soldiers used to be ordinary people, not Resonators. The battles were even brutal back then, with the stench of blood lingering through the rain.
But things have improved.
Each injury represents countless Tacet Discords eliminated by our brave soldiers.
Resonators in the Midnight Rangers are incredible warriors. Those who have to retreat from injury must have already taken out hundreds of enemies.
They are the ones keeping our people safe. What I've been doing is not worth mentioning compared to them.
Please don't put it like that. Without your help. we couldn't have helped so many wounded soldiers in such a short time.
Now that they are all safe, you should go and take care of your own issues.
Thank you. May I ask where the quartermaster is?
The quartermaster isn't here. He's on the floor above, directing munitions distribution. Just take that lift and you should find him there.
Rover, where are we going next?
Here are some recipes for dietary supplements from my sect. They might help the wounded recover sooner.
Oh? Great. You have my thanks.
Have you confirmed the inventory? What about the spare list? Sort out the consumables as soon as possible. Check our communication lines while you're at it...
Yue, deliver this list to Ase. Oh, you're not Yue. Where is she? What do you need?
Excuse me. I'm an Outrider of the Midnight Rangers. This is Rover, and this is Master Jianxin who came here to look for someone.
Jinzhou is the gateway to Huanglong, and the Desorock Highland is the gateway to Jinzhou. A single breach could have dire consequences. Our defense must hold at all costs.
The Tacet Discords are not humans. They don't do truces or ceasefires. For as long as they exist, this war will rage on endlessly.
Supply is the lifeblood of our army, and I am tasked with keeping it flowing. But now, we are facing a shortage.
I saw you help arrange the wounded there. Xiulan would need your help more than I do.
Thank you, but I must remain to oversee vital military supplies.
Jianxin asked the quartermaster about Zhiyuan's whereabouts.
Jianxin asked the quartermaster about Zhiyuan's whereabouts.
Zhiyuan...
So he never sent a letter home? Not even once?

The Midnight Rangers are no longer recruiting non-Resonators lately, but Zhiyuan was a stubborn boy. Last year when the battles hadn't gotten so intense, he would trail us Rearguards, eager to join the frontline.
We sent him back to the city, time and time again, and he just kept finding ways to come back. Eventually I caved and took him in to help us here at the base.

With the battle escalating, it's getting increasingly dangerous out here. I shouldn't keep him here any longer. I was just thinking about having the logistics team bring him back to the city when you guys showed up.
Oh, now I remember. He should be currently on the floor above.
Sure. Please excuse me. I'll join you later.
Jianxin did a brief salute and left.
Jianxin did a brief salute and left.
What... what are you doing!
Oh... Please excuse me. Thought that was a grenade... Is this... a mangosteen?
It's a type of old-fashioned explosive. The Lament caused a global technological regression and shortage of resources.
While Tacetite Weapons were being developed, most people had limited knowledge of Tacetite as an energy source. As a result, primitive products combining old and new technology emerged.
The hand grenade was one of them. With the rapid growth of Tacetite Weapons, these crude explosives were eventually phased out in favor of more advanced weaponry.

Well... it's not a local fruit, so we can only get it through imports. But, with the recent Tacet Discord outbreaks, we've had to prioritize bringing in the essentials. We'll get back to importing more of these after General Jiyan makes his triumphant return.
Currently, there's only one waterway open, from Port Gunchao in the south of the city. The Rearguards would regularly go there to escort goods.
Hmm... What more do I know... The military rarely buys this fruit for rations due to its short shelf life. Plus, it looks too much like a grenade, and that could cause some issues.
Are you also Midnight Rangers? Can you tell me about the battles on the front line?
Really? I knew it! What about the other soldiers? Have they all come back?
Why do I only see a few of you?
Are you kidding me? How is it possible that there is no movement at all? Aren't you Midnight Rangers?
...Ah? What, what did I do! I just secretly sneaked into the army, that's all?
Scary, are you guys hired by my grandpa to bring me back home!?
It's not because there is no other way. After I arrived in Jinzhou, I inquired around and heard that the front line was in a fierce battle. I thought it was a good opportunity for me to contribute...

I have always heard that everyone in Jinzhou is a soldier, and I thought that as long as I was a volunteer, I could go to the front line and contribute. Who knew that the organization of the Midnight Rangers has changed...

Since you're already here, you shouldn't just come for nothing, right? This is where my grandfather served when he was young. It would be nice to take a look, even if just for a moment! As for joining the army, let's think of a way. There are always more solutions than difficulties!
Thank you, I will continue to work hard!
Rover, now is not the time to encourage him!
Of course not... not entirely... I made up my mind to reach Jinzhou, but I didn't expect the journey to be so difficult...
Look, this monument was erected by my grandfather here back then. I never thought I would be able to see it after so many years. It's like a dream come true...
Is it true? No, please don't! My grandfather's glorious achievements will be tarnished because of me!
Rover, don't scare him...
Zhiyuan, just like you, your grandfather came to Jinzhou alone from your hometown to find your whereabouts.
What?! My grandfather is in Jinzhou now? Is he okay? Is he injured? Does my family know?
This old man, he can't take care of himself no matter what. My mom must be so worried!
Don't worry, Grandpa Zhiyuan is safe. I came down from the mountain and accompanied him all the way to Jinzhou.
Grandpa is now in the Patrol Station in Jinzhou, and he is being taken care of.
Thank you so much for your help. I really appreciate it!
I'm really sorry for the trouble. I'm so useless, I made a mess of things... I'm sorry, I just want to be alone for a while...
Rover, I'm afraid I won't be able to escort Zhiyuan back to the city.
I want to stay.
Yes.
This is part of the reason.
Actually, up to now, we have found Zhiyuan and seen that he is safe and sound, which is a good result that Mister Zongye has been concerned about.
On this journey, I have seen a world different from before.

The unity of the people of Jinzhou, the remembrance and longing on the square, the reliability of the Tian Gong defense, the strictness and responsibility of the officers, the destitution and wrong path of the wanderers...
And the busyness here, and the beliefs and courage of the people that Zhiyuan has shown me, whether in the past or now...
I haven't seen what the battlefield is like, but I seem to have some understanding of war.
At this moment, the front not far away should be much more difficult and intense than what we have seen along the way.
Countless lives have been lost in this war...
Master Rongfu once told me, The best sages gain enlightenment in the military, the mediocre sages gain enlightenment in the bustling cities, and the worst sages gain enlightenment in seclusion.
I used to practice in the city, helping the poor, helping the weak, and punishing the evil, all with my own strength, helping with the small things I saw in life.
This journey has made me start to understand the meaning of the first sentence in Master's words.
So, I want to stay. This is what I want to do for Jinzhou now, and it is also an opportunity for me to continue to pursue and gain insight.
You don't have to worry about me anymore, I have made up my mind!
I have decided to return to Jinzhou City and contribute to the war there!
Hehe, actually, the words of Master Jianxin inspired me. The things she used to help others with, I think I can do them too.
It's true! These are all my heartfelt words!
The words of Master Jianxin inspired me. The things she used to help others with, I think I can do them too.
And coming here, I have also seen the true face of the front line.
I can't compare to the Resonators, and continuing to stay here might indeed be a burden, but after returning to the city, there are many things I can do!
So why shouldn't I go back to a place that suits me better? That way, I might be able to help more people, just like Master Jianxin, and also gain more recognition.
That goes without saying, don't underestimate me.
As for you, don't worry about me anymore. I feel bad enough for making you go through all this trouble.
I'll wait here. If the rear troops return to the city, I'll go back with them. I won't cause any more trouble for the people here.
After I go back, I'll take care of Grandpa first, and then I'll go help. You can rest assured.
It seems we all have made new decisions.
I understand. Since that's the case, why don't we part ways here?
Goodbye, Rover.
Have a safe journey and hope to see you again.
Us running into Master Jianxin was a one-off incident. If the mangosteen indicates something about war, what is Madam Magistrate trying to convey?
Have you thought of something, Rover?
I think...
I think...
So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us about the TD outbreak?
If those Tacet Discords break through our defenses, it would be a disaster for not just Huanglong, but for all of humanity...
So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us something about the mangosteen's route of transportation?
That quartermaster said the mangosteens are transported by boat from the South.
So Madam Magistrate wants to tell us about General Jiyan, or about the war against Tacet Discords?
We haven't reached the frontlines yet, but I can already smell the iron in the air... I sense tension and unease. Our soldiers stationed at the borders... I hope they are okay...
Food...
What's the matter? Are you alright?
I was worried... You just stood there and gazed into the distance. You were unresponsive when I tried talking to you. What did you see?
It felt as if I was seeing through the eyes of a Tacet Discord. I think... I saw what was happening in the Norfall Barrens.
It felt as if I was seeing through the eyes of a Tacet Discord. I think... I saw what was happening in the Norfall Barrens.
An imposing warrior wielding the power of a Qingloong...  The Qingloong is the Midnight Rangers' emblem. It's also the symbol of General Jiyan, the leader of all Midnight Rangers.
The front lines are not far from here. General Jiyan must be there, fighting alongside our soldiers to keep the Tacet Discords away.
It doesn't seem like a coincidence. We arrived near the battlefield right when General Jiyan was leading an attack against the Tacet Discords...
A woman in red who can control the Tacet Discords...
Could it be... One of the Fractsidus...
Your vision... It might be what was happening on the battlefield not far away...
The battle itself is a clear sign of an anomaly.
The Streams from the Norfall Barrens feel more suffocating than ever.
Rover... something on that battlefield must be connected to you, though we have no idea what it is.
Resonate with Tacet Discords...?
But I didn't hear anything... or sense any frequencies.
Rover?
According to Baizhi, the leaf showed residual fluctuations of Tacet Discords.
According to Baizhi, the leaf showed residual fluctuations of Tacet Discords.
Those fluctuations pointed to a certain set of coordinates.
Those fluctuations pointed to a certain set of coordinates.
And that is... Qichi Village, in the Central Plains.
Do you know what guests of Jinzhou means?
It sounds a bit familiar... Anyway, since the Chief Officer has spoken, I must obey.
...You're so wishy-washy!

WhoId: 因受伤行动不便的士兵
Text: Perhaps, those sacrificed soldiers...

WhoId: 因受伤行动不便的士兵
Text: Never returned from the battlefield...
Shuning, my grandfather can sing this song too!
This monument was erected many years ago for a legion that sacrificed themselves on this land.

Over thirty years ago, this was a battlefield filled with gunpowder. It was not until that legion pushed back the Tacet Discord and gradually reclaimed the front line that they had the opportunity to erect this monument here.
The names of all of them are engraved on this stone monument.
Although I don't know any of them, my grandpa talked about them so much that my ears have calluses!
When I was little, he rarely mentioned his experiences in the war. It's only in recent years that he has become less clear-headed and started to repeatedly tell me stories of his youth.
Grandpa might be afraid of forgetting these things, so he always wants to tell them to remind himself!
Anyway, I've heard it countless times, I can't forget it even if I want to. Even if Grandpa forgets, I can remember it for decades.
Although I can't see clearly the names carved on the monument, I can recite them backwards.
Look, this is Shen Yin, his nickname is Divine Eagle because he is exceptionally good at marksmanship.

He held his gun at the front line for two days to ensure the safe retreat of others. When he went back to save him, he found that his leg had already been broken, he had lost too much blood, and he maintained the posture of shooting before he died.
This is... Xiao Douzi, she doesn't have a name, everyone calls her that.
When the Tacet Discord suddenly erupted, she was the first to rush out and sound the alarm, attracting the attention of the Tacet Discord and sacrificing herself to buy time for others to react.
Do you want to hear more?
This is Yuan Dong... and this one next to him is Bei Mo...

Yuan Dong was originally a military doctor. When the Tacet Discord erupted that night, it was too sudden and there was no room for any medical support. He died in the confrontation with the Tacet Discord.

Bei Mo was found in the collapsed area after the battle. The war lasted for seven days, and he saved more than a dozen soldiers in the sealed underground, only to find that they had died of starvation.
This is Zi Yu, and this is Xiao Hua...
Do you want to hear more?
Hmm, then I'll sit here for a while.
Perhaps, those fallen warriors...
They could one day come back to us, in another form.
Perhaps they are not buried six feet under...
Instead, they soar high up in the sky as white cranes,
high above the battlefield's smog...
Singing a mournful song, as they return home...
We too lament, our voices muted...
As we silently stare at the sky...
...Let's leave him alone.
...Let's leave him alone.
... Mommy, why are they ringing the bell?
... It's to help guide our fallen soldiers back home, sweetheart.
So, why isn't dad coming home? Did he go so far from home that he can't even hear the bell anymore?
When I'm older, can I go help dad find his way back?
Say, you youngling over there. When will the war be over?
Yes... Wars never end.
And our brave soldiers will remain with us always.
Is that so...
Should the day arrive when I am no longer here, I implore you, my child, to take my place as a witness.
Last night, I had a dream about a peaceful future with no wars.
But when I woke up, I realized I had dreamt about the past.
I'm getting up there in years. I've been on battlefields for most of my life.
Now, I'm just a flickering candle in the wind, surviving on nostalgia. Don't worry about an old-timer like me.
I'll stick around a bit more, then it's my turn to kick the bucket.
Would you please STOP coming here so often? You're making us feel super nervous!
When exactly is Heming coming back?
Ugh. Stop staring at the list of martyred soldiers all day looking for your girlfriend's name. It's super weird!
Plus they haven't updated this list since forever now... You're getting yourself nowhere!
I'm just really worried, that's all. She hasn't replied to me for over 36 hours!
She's fighting on the front lines. Not having a walk in the park!
You're right... I'll talk to Instructor Yhan for ten more rounds of extra training!
Good luck, man. Maybe you'll get chosen for the front lines like her one day.
I'm so jealous. We're not coming here with you again!
Baizhi hasn't replied to my message. She's probably busy in her lab.
Over there must be Mr. Mortefi from the Department of Safety. Baizhi once mentioned him before...
He might be able to help us get in touch with Baizhi, but, erm... it seems we've caught him at a bad time.
Anyway... Let's try asking him, shall we?
...What. You need something?
I refuse to tolerate the foolish striving of those insatiable slugs. Since it's difficult for our researchers to deal with a man like him, I'd rather handle it personally and swiftly.
...And you are?
The researcher with glasses seemed momentarily unsettled, the flames dimming as he averted his gaze. He attempted to conceal his surprise, but it was evident in his eyes.
The researcher with glasses seemed momentarily unsettled, the flames dimming as he averted his gaze. He attempted to conceal his surprise, but it was evident in his eyes.
...My apologies. Did I startle you?
Mr. Mortefi, please pardon our intrusion. We are friends of Baizhi, and we're here to look for her.
I see. I hope I didn't cause any offense earlier.
Not at all, it was us who bothered you...
Baizhi should be in the Data Analysis Room. I'll go tell her you're here.
Thank you, sir.
I have the equipment ready. I'll need to check your health status and see if there are any unusual fluctuations.
Now, let's begin if you're ready.
Do you have any questions before we begin?
Based on the samples collected, the Tacet Discord you defeated was at least an Overlord Class. After defeating it, you seemingly absorbed its frequency energy with your bare hands.

Tacet Discords are classified according to the concentration levels of their characteristic frequencies. Generally, Tacet Discords with higher concentration levels are considered to pose greater threats.
The current classification levels, from lowest to highest, are Common, Elite, Overlord, and Calamity. Additionally, there is a special type of Tacet Discord, and we call them the Threnodians.
You have absorbed a very powerful Echo with your body. You may seem fine now, but there could be internal changes that are too subtle to see or detect with my resonance ability.
Based on all the records I can find, humans need a Pangu Terminal in order to record or replicate an Echo's frequency.
That's why I am quite curious how you could do that.
When a Tacet Discord is eliminated, its frequency energy may linger in the form of an incorporeal manifestation, which is known as a Reverberation.
A Resonator's Terminal collects and records said Reverberations, turning them into Echoes that can be directed as desired.
The combat abilities of these Echos can then be replicated through the Terminal's Data Bank module, enabling Resonators to use them in battles.
Additionally, some Echoes' abilities allow Resonators to briefly transform into their shapes.
Yes, to some extent.
Apart from the ancient legend Yangyang mentioned earlier, I've never heard of anything like this...
But if we look at it another way, we might finally be able to verify said legend once we figure out what really happened with your body.
Can you try to manifest the Crownless' frequency without using your Terminal?
Hmm... I am not seeing the Crownless' data in your Terminal. So it was indeed absorbed into your body...
The Crownless' frequency energy was consumed by your body, leaving no trace behind.
But how did you manage to do that? It's as though there's another mechanism within your body capable of absorbing frequency energy...
How do you define monster? For Resonators like you, such abnormal fluctuations in frequency typically lead to Overclocking.
When a Resonator's mental capacity is overwhelmed, they may lose control of their Forte, causing an overflow of Resonance energy.
This is known as Overclocking and is categorized into three levels based on severity. The excess Resonance energy harms both the Resonator and their surroundings.
In extreme cases, the excess energy can even manifest as destructive Tacet Fields.
We have established a comprehensive Overclock diagnosis process to accurately predict potential risks of Overclocking.
Your waveform graph shows a remarkable level of stability, surpassing any Resonator I've encountered. Your risk of Overclocking should be minimal.
You don't need to worry about that for the time being.
I can't say without sufficient data.
Your test results don't indicate any trauma, so your amnesia may not be linked to traumatic events.
As for your ability to absorb Echoes, I can't make a connection between that and your amnesia based on the current data.
To put it simply, it seems there is another dimension or... a creature, hiding inside your body.
I used that as a metaphor to express my speculation. If such a thing existed within you, scientists would be eagerly seeking to understand it.
There are so many mysteries about you worth exploring.
A universe. That's a poetic and intriguing comparison.
It seems we need a simulated combat to figure out what happened in your body.
Please hold your Terminal tight and stay still.
Here's your sundial. Intact as it was.
Mr. Mortefi, can we have the test results?
Simply put, it's hollow. Here, try tapping on it. It sounds different from a solid object.
It's not just a timekeeping tool; it's an intricate mortise-and-tenon puzzle box.
This sundial is hollow with an inner compartment. We've scanned it, and there is a small paper scroll inside.
However, it's missing a crucial component.
We should be able to spin the wheels on this sundial once the right component is installed.
Automata Mechanics isn't my field of study. I specialize in developing Tacetite Weapons, but the foundational theories behind these applied technologies are quite similar.
I have some basic knowledge, but there is someone else who is more knowledgeable in Automata Mechanics than I am.
It wouldn't have taken me this long if we were dealing with Tacetite Weapons.
Install the missing part, then rotate the wheels to their correct positions, and you should be able to solve the puzzle and access the paper scroll.
However, I still have no idea what the missing component should look like.
Well that's a no-brainer indeed.
We can certainly give it a try. If you're fine with the paper scroll being destroyed by its protective mechanism, that is.
No need to ask him. I can help you with this.
I just need some time to think it over.
One moment. I have an incoming call.
What is it?
You certainly are well-informed.
It's indeed beautiful data... Good taste. Well, since you've put it that way...
Rover... Mr. Mortefi's expression seems to have softened, don't you think?
...an amiable person, isn't he?
We haven't even asked him to help us with assembling...
It looks like Mr. Mortefi needs some more time. Maybe we should give him some space to concentrate?
Rover, let's come back later, shall we?
I mentally prepared myself for the worst, but this place looks... much better than Mr. Mortefi's description, I think?
Though it is a bit hard to figure out where we should start...
Mr. Mortefi, we found the parts.
Good. Bring it to me.
The test results are in.
The mangosteen is just an ordinary fruit. It's suitable for regular consumption. We found nothing unusual about it.
From the purple leaf you presented, I detected subtle fluctuations in Tacet Discord's frequency from two distinct sources, but they were overlapping and difficult to distinguish.
This is a rare occurrence.
The scattered nature of these fluctuations rules out the possibility of them being left behind through contact.
This is not an ordinary leaf, but it doesn't seem to be a Tacet Discord, either. Based on the data we gathered, I believe it was sampled from an area struck with the Waveworn phenomena.
Yes. The anomalies that occurred after the Lament, including the formation of Tacet Fields, Etheric Sea, Retroact Rain, and gravity loss... These are collectively called the Waveworn phenomena.
And the Lament was the start of it all.
As for the sugar pearl... It has been determined to be a type of oral vaccine.
This sugar pearl expired over 20 years ago. The low-temperature storage life for this vaccine is about 2 years.
A 20-year-old vaccine...
Could it be related to the children's epidemic in Jinzhou two decades ago?
The archives in the Academy should have information on the sugar pearl.
The archives here are organized in a unique way. You can start by searching the keywords at the lobby terminal.
Mr. Mortefi?
The missing pointer has been installed, and now the sundial should be complete.
So the discs are rotatable now...
Yes. Align the correct markers with the pointer we just installed, and then you should be able to open it.
You... Ugh, hold on!
Remember when I said don't force it open?
Crank that thing another five degrees, and not even Xiangli Yao will be able to save it.
The Earthly Branches and Four Symbols...

These symbols are related to the Sexagenary Cycle. It's an intricate way of recording time in Huanglong. Nowadays it is mainly reserved for calendars, numerology, and indexing, but it's falling out of daily use.
Now what kind of information could it represent...
...It's the filing system.
Most of Huanglong's libraries and databases still use this method to organize their archives. Namely, the Grand Libraries.
Yes. The large data repositories located in Huanglong's major cities.
Exactly. Languages may evolve, names may change, but time remains constant.
It's an elegant system, indeed.
The Academy's public archives are organized in this manner, too.
The previous prototype almost met all our needs, but we're wondering if you can further optimize it.
Well... Um...
Make your feedback specific.
We find it a bit hard to use. It's heavy, and the engine doesn't work that well.
Can you reduce its weight by another ten percent and double the Tacetite Energy output?
I see, so you want a portable heavy tank. That's quite a BRILLIANT idea.
Yeah, you got me. There must be something you can do, right? Try to cut cost as much as you can, but you can invest in better materials to reduce the weight.
That's easy, but in order to cut costs, I need you to double my research budget.
What do you mean? How can we save money when the budget is doubled?
Oh? So, you do know doubling the budget won't lead to cost savings? Funny how you apply double standards when you're the one making requests.
Regarding the good material you asked for... Well, I see some right in front of me. You're the perfect material to be shipped off to the blacksmith's... for a good old-fashioned beating. Marvelous.
Trying to exhaust public research resources for personal gain at a time like this... You must think you're so smart.
You... You could just admit you can't do it! How dare you spew such insults in public?!
Oh, I apologize if you felt humiliated. I thought you must have a thick skin to present such an unreasonable request.
Besides, didn't I just tell you?
I can fulfill any request you may have, but that's gonna cost extra.
How... how dare you! We're divesting! I'm telling you! I'm leaving!
Interesting. Do you really think the meager investment you made over a decade ago is enough to make any difference? I've been paying more money every day to treat my colleagues to afternoon teas.

People in Huanglong have a good tradition of reciprocating help generously, and the Academy has been treating its investors with respect. You've already received a 120% return on your investment, haven't you?

I suggest you take what you can get. Blame your bad luck for crossing paths with me, the only foreigner here at the Academy. I don't plan to follow that good tradition. I speak up when you get on my nerves. Farewell, you're free to leave.
Why... doesn't make sense...
You seem very troubled... Are you okay?
You guys are the culprits!
It's all because you guys defeated the Crownless!
But isn't it a good thing that the Tacet Discord threatening Jinzhou has been eliminated?
Of course it's a good thing, but it happened to be the busiest time for us...
Because of the frequent Tacet Discord outbreaks, our Tacet Discord research department has been extremely busy lately, and now we have this large amount of materials to deal with.
I probably won't be able to sleep tonight...
I'm really sorry...
It's okay, I'm just venting. It's also our wish to uncover the secrets of the Crownless as soon as possible.
...You're right... Sigh, I'm just too frustrated, sorry. We need to figure out the new situation with the Tacet Discord as soon as possible, but we've been stuck for a while...
By the way, I heard that you didn't use the Terminal to access the frequency data of the Crownless, but absorbed it directly with your body?
Yes, from what we've seen, that's correct.
The process of transforming Tacet Discord into Echo is actually a process of reproducing frequency data with the Terminal.
So as long as we study the Echo obtained from the Resonators, it's basically the same as studying the original Tacet Discord.
But it's unheard of to absorb frequency data with the body like you did...
I guess you can't summon the Echo for now, what a pity!
It would have been such good research material... If it was absorbed through the Terminal, it would have reduced our workload by at least 70%, sigh.
But there's nothing we can do...
Yeah, that's why it's even more regrettable. Maybe the development of science always has to fight against these damn regrets.
Thank you for listening to my complaints... Ah, and thank you for defeating the threat to the Crownless.
The rest of this should be left to researchers like me. I'm going back to continue my work, goodbye.
Hmm... Haha, is that for real?
Oh, nothing, just checking out the Huaxu Hive. These latest posts are hilarious.
It's an internal forum of the Academy for casual chit-chatting. You can find basically anything here!
Oh no. No no no... I really should stop and focus on my assignment now! The deadline is today!
Oh wait! I know what I should do!
Here, you can borrow my account. One account can only be logged in from one place at a time, so I'll be able to concentrate on my work, and you'll get to check out the forum! It's a win-win!
Promise me you won't post anything though. My instructor knows my account name. If he catches me posting stuff on the Hive when I should be working, I'll be screwed...
Should I join Mortefi's project or not? ...Koko, will you support my decision?
Ah, you must be Rover. What can I do for you?
Koko is my little sister, and she's currently the acting manager of Shifang Pharmacy.
Yesterday, Mortefi invited me to join one of his projects.
But I'll have even less time to spend with Koko if I joined.
Yeah, I'd hate to let the opportunity go. It's more than just a project. Being able to collaborate with Mr. Mortefi is an honor in itself.
I'd say Mr. Mortefi is the most respected researcher at the Academy now, second only to our Principal Investigator, Mr. Xiangli Yao.
He consistently defends us against unreasonable client requests. I think he rejected over 40 of them during his first week alone.
Mr. Mortefi even treats us to afternoon teas. He really looks out for us.
Mr. Mortefi has always aspired to outdo him in terms of research, but it's been proven difficult. Mr. Xiangli is... built different.
They are both great researchers, and I've learned a lot from them. I'd rather not comment on their relationship lightly.
About Mr. Xiangli... You'll get it once you meet him in person.
I'm really curious...
Hello, you seemed to have been staring this way...
Sorry, sorry, it's break time now, I'm just thinking.
It's my habit, even if my body is resting, my mind can't stop.
Yes, I heard that you can absorb the Echo through your body.
I see, but you shouldn't have to worry, there haven't been any abnormalities so far.
Oh, I'm not worried, just curious about the reason.
Hmm? What's that you're holding in your hand?
Oh, this thing seems to be a children's medicine used in the past in Jinzhou to fight against infectious diseases.
It seems like the residents of Jinzhou have all taken it when they were young, and most of the older people know about it.
You don't seem to be a resident of Jinzhou, right?
It's possible that you haven't taken it, and your parents haven't taken it either...
Maybe it's because everyone took this medicine that we lost the ability to absorb the Echo through our bodies through inheritance!
Ha... I don't think it's a problem.
I see, I see...
I've been thinking that it's an external factor, but maybe it's actually genetics that plays the decisive role!
Alright, break's over! Let's start working right away, we can't let this train of thought break...
Hmm... um um um...
What's wrong, do you also want to eat skewers?
Huh? Thank you... but the Rover and I probably aren't hungry yet...
What's wrong! Mental work consumes more energy than physical work... It's not because I'm greedy!
After eating something salty, I feel like eating something sweet...
You can still eat... impressive.
Desserts are good for another stomach, and sugar is important for thinking.
Even in battle, it is dangerous if there is not enough sugar, you must remember this.
Oh? It seems like you have some candy... Why is the packaging so special?
Oh, it's that kind of candy ball... The taste is not that great, it's overly sweet with a medicinal taste.
But for children, it's at least better than just medicine.
Now, everyone can probably choose the food they like, and they may have forgotten the times when they had to fill their stomachs without caring about the taste.
But as for me, I'll pass, I just want to eat delicious food, thank you for your kindness.
I-It's okay...
Why is this gate broken again...
You see, what's wrong with this gate? I just fixed it yesterday, why is it broken again today?
Oh, you are... a Rover? The sample report is from Baizhi herself!
The Huaxu Hive is an internal forum of the Huaxu Academy, you'll see how... uh, famous you are when you go in.
This gate leads to the data room, where various research materials and data are stored.
Oh, I forgot to introduce myself, I'm Guo Wei, the administrator of the archives.
But as you can see, the gate to the data room is broken, and I can't even get to my own workplace.
If we go through the normal repair process, it will take two more days for someone to come and fix the gate.
In that case, the research materials and experimental data from various departments will not be able to be archived for the next two days.
This morning, Sqi even said that the archives can't be stored, he's worried about the security, so he refused to submit the materials.
If this continues, the Huaxu Academy will be in chaos sooner or later, and I'm sure I'll lose my job...
I found it... It's located on the Wei shelf.
Oh, wait a sec, someone's looking for me.
Yeah... What! When did he disappear? Don't worry. It's alright. I'll be right there.
Duty calls! Oops, almost forgot. Can't be late!
Sorry, Rover, Yangyang, I've gotta head off for my shift. I'll join you right after I'm done, alright?
If you need me, just shout my name, and I, the Jinzhou Speedster, will be there in a sec.
Well, you only need to send me a Terminal message as you shout! Then I'll be there in a jiffy. Hehe.
STOP! STOP! Don't call me that!
Anyway, I've gotta go. You guys okay on your own? Give me a heads-up when there's any updates!
Sure, go do your thing. Don't worry, I'm staying with him.
Sure, go do your thing. Don't worry, I'm staying with her.
Rover, let's go inside.
How did it go? Anyone hurt? Lemme check on you!
Phew! You're still in one piece.
Okay okay. Anything new about the tokens?
You told Chixia of your findings in the Desorock Highlands and Qichi Village.
So those Fractsidus goons are here in Jinzhou now. Things are more serious than I thought.
Beats me. I've only ran into some bozos before.
Those wackos are hellbent on making their own Resonators. Said there's no right or wrong when it comes to Resonance powers and everyone should have the right to them.
They use mechanical manipulation to integrate parts of Tacet Discords into human bodies.
Seeking power with such gruesome acts... I cannot bring myself to understand them.
That Scar guy you mentioned sounds like he's on a whole other level. How did the fight go?
He... It seems he didn't intend to kill us. I would say he was even pulling his punches.
I don't know what he wants from us. But Madam Magistrate may have intended to hint something by letting us run into him.
I still can't wrap my head around what happened in that village...
I went over the files. That case is ancient. It was dealt with and archived way before our current Magistrate took office.
What happened to the village in the end?
Don't worry, the crooks were brought to justice, and most of the villagers were relocated to new settlements.
But I didn't find anything in the files about that little girl you mentioned.
So Scar really took her away.
I agree.
If only we could capture him...
Ugh... I'm so lost. Why did Madam Magistrate point you to Qichi Village anyway? What did she want to tell you with that?
And then Scar went there to tamper with the site and mislead you with fake clues...
You mean...?
The Fractsidus was planning to tell you something through what had happened in that village. Then our Magistrate intercepted by leading you there before they could?
Madam Magistrate knew they were going to lure you to the village. And she knew they weren't planning to kill you.
Her token was a warning that the Fractsidus had their eyes on you...
How so?
You mean she's got someone looking out for you?
Or maybe she prepared other means of protection.
Yes, I agree. Knowing their plans, Madam Magistrate would have prepared countermeasures for the worst scenario.
What's the matter, Rover?
Uh, I don't think I follow.
The legendary figure who changed Jinzhou's history, a looming war with the resurrecting Threnodian, and the Fractsidus acting in the shadows...
If all of these have something to do with your true identity. Then... Who exactly are you?
Yes... You will always be the Rover we know, no matter what.
That same old TD eating, Echo munching Rover all right!
Come to think of it, the sundial's the last token we need to work out.
Mr. Mortefi said it's an intricate puzzle box. Madam Magistrate might have hid her real message inside.
Yes. It's the 12th Shichen of the day, represented by the symbol Wei.
Yes. It's the South, represented by the Vermillion Bird, one of the Four Symbols.
Now we have the Shichen of Wei and Vermillion Bird. We should be able to solve the puzzle.
So, Rover, you're gonna try it now?
Symbols on the larger disk represent time, and we need to align the correct symbol with this pointer. It should be...
It's not working. So we can rule out the Shichen of Yoh now... The correct time we learned at the Academy should be...
It's working. And now...
Symbols on the smaller disk represent direction, and we need to align the correct symbol with this pointer. It should be...
We have Teal Loong of the East, White Tiger of the West, Vermilion Bird of the South, and Black Tortoise of the North. According to the clues we've gathered, it should be...
It's not working. I guess it's not the White Tiger...
Wow, you really solved it!
So this is the last message the Magistrate has for me. This is... the location of Jinzhou's Grand Library.
So this is the last message the Magistrate has for me. This is... the location of Jinzhou's Grand Library.
Wait, I don't think it's something we're allowed to see.
Quick, Yangyang. We should turn around!
It's gotta be some super confidential stuff Madam Magistrate's written for Rover's eyes only!
As public servants... Well, even though we're both just reservists. We know there are rules to follow!
Chixia has a point.
Maybe you should read it first, Rover?
Come on, just go ahead and see what's written inside!

I see. The Grand Libraries in Huanglong are renowned for their vast databases, holding valuable information about the regions they represent. Their exact locations are kept confidential, but it is believed they hold answers to all questions one could ask.
The Grand Libraries are vital for Huanglong's data security, managed by the regional Sentinels, accessible only to the Magistrates. They are rarely open to the public.
Kinda like a big piggy bank inside the City Hall. Data-wise!
Yes. You will find the most comprehensive and accurate information there.
Rover, if you'll need to visit the Grand Library in Jinzhou to find out who you are, I think it suggests two things...
First, there is a strong link between your past and Jinzhou's history.
Second, you must be a really significant person.
So you're super important to Jinzhou, maybe even all of Huanglong...
Wow, I think we stumbled upon a real big shot when we didn't even know it!
What's that matter, Rover? Something wrong with the sundial?
It is Jinzhou's political center. And it's also located at the city's center, if that's what you mean.
The City Hall was built first when Jinzhou was established. It's a popular landmark for locals giving directions.
Why do you ask, Rover?
See? What did I say! Covert ops, real confidential stuff going on!
C'mon, Yangyang. It's just an one-on-one meeting with Madam Magistrate. What's the worst that could happen?
Relax, relax!
Hey! Are you really trying to stress her out?
I guess you're right... Still, please be careful.
We'll be waiting for you.
It's been three days.
We've both made it on time.
Allow me to formally introduce myself. I am Jinhsi. It brings me great joy to see you, Rover.

To show up as a projection again would be ill-mannered of me. Please rest assured, it is a real human in the flesh you're speaking to. Despite Huanglong's advanced technology, such a realistic projection is still impossible.
Or perhaps you would like to verify it?
Jinhsi smiles and reaches out a hand to Rover
Jinhsi smiles and reaches out a hand to Rover
...It is nothing to be concerned about.
An emergency forced me to leave, and I only had the time to prepare some tokens for you. Please pardon my lack of hospitality.
...Yes. The Sentinel of Jinzhou is currently absent.
Correct.
The Sentinels guide and guard humanity as a symbol of our civilization.
When a region's Sentinel goes absent, chaos is bound to ensue. As this news could lead to civil unrest, please keep it a secret.
Jinzhou's Sentinel, Jué, is being held captive by the Fractsidus. I had to postpone our meeting and put all my effort into finding its whereabouts.
Yes, our thoughts are connected to a certain degree. I can sense its memories, feelings, and surroundings, though not very clearly.
Unfortunately, I haven't. I can feel Jué is in danger. The good news is, I have figured out the culprit behind all of this.
Precisely.
The Fractsidus plans to advance another Lament and cause disasters worldwide.
Overseer Scar had several objectives upon infilrtrating Jinzhou:
To track you down, to test your strengths, and to make you join their cause; to abduct Jué; and to resurrect the Threnodian in advance.
They must have discovered your value, likely from one of Jué's prophecies. If you join them, they'll gain significant power.
Should you refuse to join, the Fractsidus will likely want to eliminate you so you don't get in their way.
I have a plan to apprehend Scar. Once we capture him, the Fractsidus won't be that much of a threat to you for the time being.
If you are willing to lend us a hand, I will ensure your safety during our cooperation.
Thank you for your trust, Rover.
Of course. Your decision is valued, Rover.
Speaking of which, you seem to have already gathered a lot from the tokens.
Impressive, Rover.
