Let's go back and show it to Mr. Mortefi.
Mao, Chen, Si... Wu, Wei. Rover, it's here.
There are two photos here...
One photo shows a group of researchers led by a woman in her thirties. Everyone looks excited and happy.
One photo shows a group of researchers led by a woman in her thirties. Everyone looks excited and happy.
The other photo shows an infant in diapers, with a slender hand holding a spoon with a sugar pearl in it, directed towards the infant.
The other photo shows an infant in diapers, with a slender hand holding a spoon with a sugar pearl in it, directed towards the infant.
If I remember correctly, Jinzhou was established during a Year of Wei, several cycles ago. The Jinzhou City Hall and Huaxu Academy were built in the same year.
The Gorges of Spirits Battle sparked Jinzhou's founding.
And the formidable Tacet Discord described here...  I believe it is the Crownless.
Erm, I... I could probably make one for you with my Resonance Ability... If you just need something that looks similar...
Come on, Verina, you can do it...
No way? That's amazing, seriously! It looks exactly like the flower in that picture!
T-thank you, it's nothing... I'm glad I could help.
It's friggin amazing! Could you do that again? Please! I love it!
Rover, perfect timing! This guy's been sniffin' around here for a while now. He keeps trying to talk to the elderly and minors! I've been keeping an eye on him!
And I saw a little girl with him! She kept turning her head and looking around, but now she's nowhere to be found. This is super fishy!
Hey, I'm Patroller Chixia. Sir, business license, please.
B-Business license? Uuuhh... Oh! I'm Aalto, just a humble information broker. I've been travelling around, helping people out in my own small way...
I see. So, no license. I bet you don't have a fixed business location either, huh?
...Business location? Why would I need that?
Hmph, now show me your Organizational Accreditation, please.
Well... I am an honest broker of information, always open to negotiations at the right price! I'm the all-time Intel champ, with more Best Seller certificates than I can count...
No license, no clear business plan... You're running an illegal business, then...
Who's your supervisor? You should at least have their ID number?
My s-supervisor? Oh right! She's, like, a super big deal!
She's an ancient being, born with this planet we're living on. She's the will of the star, the reverberation of everything in this world...
So do you even have a supervisor or not?
What? C'mon, I already told you about her! Why won't you believe me?
Yeah, yeah! I believe you! I know what's going on!
Now, sir, you're coming with me to the Patroller Station!
Oh, come on! Please, I didn't do anything illegal! I was just looking for someone!
A little girl, um, about this tall... She's the kind to stand out in any crowd!
You really think I'm gonna buy that?
Ugh, you know! You saw her earlier! It's that girl!
Yeah! Exactly! Wait, how do you know?
Cough... We can't let him get away!
I-I'll go search in the residential area!
Ugh! What is this? Is he mocking us?
I'll go down that way towards the Patrol Station! I know the streets here like the back of my hand!
Here's another split in the road...
I'll go look for him in the square. I'll leave the other side to you!
Huh? Is my TD Detector working? How come it didn't warn us of so many Tacet Discords ahead?
Cause they all just appeared outta nowhere!
That's weird... Anyway, let's deal with them.
This is the place.
Ugh, those savants really love their puzzles, don't they...
No wonder folks never managed to get inside after all these years. Their security is top-notch.
That's because Aalto set off the security alarm! And now the gate's closed, hmph!
Ahem... Anyway! We've got to figure out how to open it up again.
Never thought they could pull off something like this... Incredible...
The Retroact Rain is essentially a form of condensed Remnant Energy from the Etheric Sea.
Various events across space and time from every dimension are recorded in the form of Remnant Energy. The Retroact Rain conjures illusions of past events for those exposed to it.
That rain curtain we saw earlier was probably the results of their experiments.
Before the Retroact Rain forms, it goes through three stages. In the first stage, it looks just like any regular rain.
And what we're seeing now should be the second stage: Water droplets floating in midair, being absolutely still.
I've heard of plenty independant studies on the Retroact Rain.
Most of the researchers were driven by their obsessions. Some wanted to relive a particular experience, while others yearned to reunite with their loved ones...
But look at all these devices here... The sheer scale of this research is really something.
It really makes one wonder... What on earth were they trying to bring back with such a massive Retroact Rain?
The power system here might still work... Let's split up and find it.
Hurray! Woolies, thataway!
Now, this is the last room...
Aalto, Rover! Encore spotted something!
...It's getting closer. These will be my final words, haha... If only I had more time...
I thought my enemies were misconceptions, waning passion, and my own ignorance.
Only in the end did I realize... time is my ultimate foe.
I became blindsided by my fear of death and insatiable thirst for truth, eventually derailing our research...
It was too late when I finally came back to my senses... We... We had already walked into that false Gate...
Now, I'm leaving my last realization behind...
They are our past... but they are also our future... Had I realized it sooner, there might have been a chance to get things back on track...
The future being hailing from our past... Please save us... once again...
Please, keep pushing forward... until you reach... the real Gate that can change the world...
Wow... She's so pretty...
Rover, about this person...
Heh, knew it...
Great, now that power's been restored, that elevator should work.
The Beacon's signal is coming from below. Let's go.
But why did they keep that big guy here?
According to our findings earlier, researchers who worked here were probably only a small faction of the Court of Savantae Committee.
They were likely studying an ancient civilization they deemed to be divine beings, but later got denounced from the CSC due to their extreme methods.
Somehow, they believed this ancient civilization had once visited the Mire, which led to their attempts at recreating those past events with artificial Retroact Rain.
And when they failed to recreate the Retroact Rain, they resorted to making a replica of the lost civilization instead.
To get their desired results faster, they started feeding this replica various frequencies, datasets, and mechanical constructs...
And we've seen what that ended up with. It turned into a monster driven by the frequencies of hunger, devouring everything in its path.
It was probably the culprit behind the disappearance of those folks.
And, I suspect, the Fractsidus Overseer mentioned in that log may have something to do with it all.
Those researchers... They were too obsessed with validating the divine miracle, they eventually got lured in by that monster's frequencies of hunger and willingly walked into its maw...
The monster devoured them, but not with its teeth... Their own delusions and fear were their undoing in the end.
What a crazy bunch...
So Rover, now it's time for me to fulfill my promise.
What do you want to know about the Black Shores?
As you already know, we monitor and research the Lament, and we’ve got Resonance Beacons set up in every nation worldwide.
The island our headquarters are built on is in fact a massive piece of Tacetite ore, which powers our various energy-intensive operations.
This Blake Bloom is a product of that overflowing energy on the island.
Our island is located in the perfect spot to accurately monitor the Lament, ensuring precise predictions.
...That being said, the Lament's behavior is constantly changing and we are still studying to understand its true nature.
All we can do for now is to observe the Lament, study its patterns, and provide early warnings to countries worldwide.
Alright, alright, no more beating around the bush. Yeah, we've had our eyes on you, but please trust me, we don't mean anything bad.
We just wanted to make sure you're a dependable ally.

The Black Shores members all work together to save the world from the Lament crisis. We've got talents from all walks of life, including skilled hackers, explosive experts, and even Fengshui masters... You name it, we have it.
We like your skills and methods. So, what do you say? Ready to jump on board?
Camellya? Course we do!
Yeah, she can be kinda unhinged, but she's indeed one of ours.
Just so you know, she only took up this mission because of you! Quite the charmer, aren't you?
So you've met her already? Nice, saves me some time introducing.
I know she can be a bit too... straightforward, in how she expresses herself, but... Don't worry. She won't do anything bad to you, really.
We just received a warning from our Lament detection system. Another Threnodian is about to revive near Jinzhou city.
So we came here to inform Jinzhou's Magistrate about it.
Yes. Entire countries had been destroyed... We're not letting such tragedies happen again.
Yes. Entire countries had been destroyed... We're not letting such tragedies happen again.
I'm just an insignificant Consultant at the Black Shores, so I don't know that much about all its hidden secrets.
But I believe the piece of intel I'm about to share with you will make this trip worth your effort.
This is not the first time you've been reawakened. Last time... You woke up at the Black Shores.
Rover, we share the same goal.
We're both aiming to fight against the Threnodians and prevent the Lament crisis.
Yep! Encore can prove it! The Threnodian is a bad, bad guy, and Encore and Aalto are the heroes of justice, so we're gonna stop the bad guys!
I understand. Trust isn't something you can afford to give out that easily.
Remember the Blake Bloom I gave you earlier?
It is more than just a symbol. It also holds the key to our headquarters. I'm sure it will come in handy for you.
Phew! Anyway, mission accomplished! We've got the Resonance Beacon secured, plus a sweet bonus of Court of Savantae's big secrets!
Glad I got you on board, Rover. Looking forward to our future collaborations.
Oops, almost forgot! Gotta check that Resonance Beacon again, just in case.
Wait... This is...
No, it can't be...
Hey, Aalto! WAAITT!
I'm back. I'm back! Finally done with my patrol. How's it going, Rover? Feeling spry as ever?
Baizhi said he is in great health, no issue to report.
Baizhi said she is in great health, no issue to report.
We've made some progress in investigating the tokens, too.

Nothing special, a typical patrol. Well, Uncle Zhang's cat climbed a tree, and on its way down, it landed on Uncle Chenpi's Head, causing him to take a tumble. Some dogs kept barking and have been scaring the passers-by, so I went there to calm them down.

I received a report about someone going missing. I just logged the case and talked to the person who reported it. You're not the one they're searching for, though. Anyhow, I'll need to visit the person who reported the case tomorrow.

Oh, I also tried searchin' for Rover's terminal number, but the system came up with nothing. The latest record was from today when I took Rover for registration. That's pretty much the update for now.
It's the middle of the night. Course you're tired.
It's the middle of the night. Course you're hungry.
You betcha!
Huh? Are you not gonna investigate the tokens?
Oh right, I still owe you a meal! The night markets are closed though. Let's grab breakfast at Panhua's Restaurant tomorrow before my shift. Meet you guys there in the morning. Be there or be square!
Time to hit the hay, obviously. Don't tell me you're planning on some nightly activities?
Then you'll feel right at home with the Midnight Rangers. Or more like the Midnight Danger.
What? You're hanging out with our Magistrate already? Quit bluffing.
Stop it! We deserve 8-hour workdays!
Do you have a place to stay, Rover?
Talk about hospitality!
Talk about hospitality! Boy, I wonder what it's like to live in the City Hall.
I-I have a vacant guest room in my house, and if you don't mind coming over...
Aren't you forgetting something, Yangyang? Rover told us this morning that he has been offered a stay at the City Hall...
Aren't you forgetting something, Yangyang? Rover told us this morning that she has been offered a stay at the City Hall...
Alright, enough chatter or the sun's gonna come up. Let's get Rover back to the City Hall and we'll leave the rest to tomorrow!
Jianxin explained why she wanted to leave the city. She told you about the person she is looking for.
So you're looking for the relative of a veteran, and you believe he's in the Midnight Rangers camp in Desorock Highland?
Exactly.
His name is Zhiyuan. I don't know him in person. On my way down the mountain, I ran into his grandfather, who was looking for his grandson on his own but ended up lost.
I couldn't just leave an elderly person like him out there. So I thought I'd escort him to the nearest city and make further plans once we're safe.
You're willing to go to such lengths for someone you don't know...
You have a kind soul, Master Jianxin.
It's all thanks to many kind-hearted people. Without them, Mr. Zongye and I wouldn't have made it to Jinzhou.
Mr. Zongye seemed confused. He's gone through a lot searching for his enlisted grandson. Lending a helping hand was the least I could do.

I reported his situation to the Patrol Station, but with the chaos on the frontline, Mr. Zongye has been extremely worried about his grandson's safety... He'd sneak out to look for his grandson the moment no one was watching. I'm really worried about him.
This mangosteen?
It's got some fresh-looking leaves, soft springy skin, and eight fleshy segments fully ripened inside. It looks like a nice fruit.
Oh, one more thing I forgot to mention. There's a bruise at the bottom. If you don't eat that part soon, it'll spoil.
I grew up in my sect on a mountain. Spent most of my time training with my masters.
One day, I was told training in seclusion was not enough. I must engage with the world to further my skills.
So I started my self-cultivating journey. I've been to various cities and gained valuable lessons, but there is still so much more to learn.
...According to what I've gathered, Mr. Zongye's grandson is very likely in the Desorock Highland.
Thanks to your help, I can finally leave the city to find him.
Of course.
Hmph, a tough nut, aren't you?
I just helped you. Why did you attack us?
You're not feedin' all of us with ya bread and pennies.  Hand over your goods and grub or face the consequences.
We ain't messin' with no kids, but don't test our patience. Just do as you're told!
Don't make it tough on yourselves. Or you'll be lucky to leave in one piece.
I will not bend to injustice.
Rover, Yangyang, please step back as I handle them.
Fine! You asked for this!
Here's your meal. Enjoy!
Alright. If you need help with anything, just holler. I'm always at your service!
It's too dangerous over there. We have no weapons right now. Let's go the other way.
He's right. Let's go get our weapons first.
Gotta clean up the rubble...
The supply chest is being piled with rubble. Have to dig it out to get rid of the thorns down there.
Thank you, but we can deal with it.
What could have gone wrong with this monitoring point?
You'd better get that scanning device fixed up, and, I'm kinda hungry. Let's grab a snack first.
Hey, are you here to collect data too? Unfortunately, the device isn't functioning at the moment.
By the way, I'm Xiyue, currently an intern at the Academy. My mentor assigned me to fix the device as it plays a crucial role in gathering ecological data and restoring the environment here.
However, my scanning device appears to be malfunctioning, and I'm having difficulty repairing it.
Oh, this is Patroller Xinyi. She's assisting me in identifying the issue.
Come on! I'm not a genius to solve your tech puzzles. Just didn't want you to be stuck here alone, you know?
Okay, okay, I get it.
Well, may I ask… Is the Utility on your Terminal working properly?
If it is, could you help me figure out what's wrong with this monitoring point?
Great! Thank you!
The monitoring points in the Dim Forest are gradually starting to activate.
Once I repair the device here, this monitoring point will be ready for operation. I hope you can use the Utility to pinpoint the issue!
The circuit is connected!
Oh my goodness! You really know how to fix it! Now, the monitoring point can function normally!
Yay! Let's grab a bite to eat—we earned it!

Speaking of which, since the monitoring point was fixed much more quickly than anticipated, we won't need the backup supplies in the camp. So please take them as your payment. I really, really appreciate your help!
Please don't refuse, okay?
I'll go check on the other monitoring points. Hopefully, we'll cross paths again soon!
The cat runs away. Perhaps it is searching for the owner.
The cat runs away. Perhaps it is searching for the owner.
Follow it and find out what's going on.
Follow it and find out what's going on.
Captain...
Anything unusual?
Not really.
But those rejected by Lady Sanhua just won’t leave.
Maybe they really have important causes...
But no matter what, our first duty is to do our jobs well.
Very well, our main goal is to maintain order in City Hall, no matter the circumstances.
Please report any issues immediately.
Look at that tree over there.
Remember when it was just a sapling? Now look at it, all grown up and flourishing.
Jinzhou's farming has really taken off thanks to the hard work of the agriculture department.
I mean, back in the day, we'd hustle to plant before Spring Loong Festival and wait until the Moon-chasing Festival to reap our crops.
But now, we can harvest in summer or fall, with fields full of golden grain swaying in the breeze. Pretty awesome, right?
Do you think this is a good time?
Those cases from yesterday are almost out of time, can't be prosecuted anymore...
Hi. What can I help you with?
I'm sorry, I'm not a lawyer. Generally speaking, the Justice Commission doesn't appoint lawyers for people.
And here I am, just a clerk...
If you need help with any legal matters, we're here to assist.
What can I assist you with today?
Everything's alright? Good to hear.
For some reason, things are picking up again.
All these case files from the Midnight Rangers need prompt attention...
Dingfeng, I've got something to tell you...
What's the matter?
Lady Sanhua. Don’t you think there’s something... strange about her?
When she looks at people, it's like she's not looking at the person, but...
I can't explain it, but it just feels weird.
Where? Hahaha, don't think too much.
Shh, someone is coming.
Hello, is there anything I can help you with?
We... Well, I-I feel like Lady Sanhua is not just looking at the person when she looks at someone.
How should I put it, it's like she's looking at something deeper.
But the thought of this always makes me feel weird.
Lady Sanhua is a good person. You can trust her with anything.
Still... Please don't tell her I said this...
Hahaha, I can see that you're overthinking.
Who gets scared of someone they have no connection with? It's absurd, haha.
I'm still here!
Hahaha, I didn't say who it was.
It's fine, I've known Sanhua for a while. She might seem icy, but there's no need to worry.
Phew... Hello, is there anything I can help you with?
Huh? Nothing, really.
I don't know, man. I feel exhausted on duty these days compared to when I was in the city.
Sure, back then I dealt with all sorts of little things every day and it kept me busy.
But now? There's less to do, yet I'm mentally drained and constantly tired.
I don't know how the Jinzhou Magistrate and Jinhsi Magistrate handle so many things every day...
Finished collecting so quickly?!
Let me have a look. You haven’t got them all it seems. Keep looking!
I hope this works this time. No more casualties...
漂泊者! Umm, it’s not because I don’t believe in you that I said that. I just have to be discreet after all those things.
Please rest assured. I will be your most faithful back-up.
I was just informed that the items I captured were successfully escorted to the city. Now I only need to take care of the weapons.
It’s all thanks to you that this undercover mission can be done. We are already sharing what we know with other Public Security Bureaus.
When we finish analyzing the information, we will stop the shipment before their plan even starts, and we will capture the shipping staff.
When we have decisive evidences, we will support Patrollers of other Public Security Bureaus to sweep up the Hall of Six.
The evidences this time should allow us to get some important members of the Hall of Six. I don’t think they’ve seen this coming due to such trifles.
...If you you want to know about that.
Actually, I am the single most responsible person for Shenhai’s exposure.
At that time, he had a more comprehensive information base than I did. He was in fact more crucial to the PSB than me...
If I could just pay more attention to the daily trajectories of the camp members, he would have said the same things that I did, and Xiyun would never know his real identity.
Though this put me in the clear, it pushed him to death.
My mentor said that Shenhai’s exposure was indeed a result of some internal events of the Hall of Six and nothing to do with me, but in my opinion, my fault did unforgivable damage to him.
That’s why I was worried that you would encounter dangers if you didn’t master all the material I gave you.
My determination to arrest them and put an end to this mission is mostly due to my wish that Shenhai’s final will could be fulfilled.
Please have faith in me. We will make a success of this!
What, what should we do...
I need to double-check the props for the next scene. Can't afford to mess around with the Torch Sword...
Here... Hmm, checked.
And these supplies, all checked!
Fiamma is ready to slay today!
Hurry up! It's my turn to play the big hero!
Sister Chixia told me the same thing... Are you her friend?
I-I don't have a dad, and my mom is always late...
Mom said that she would come back as soon as the Hero Play was over every day and I'll just need to concentrate on the play. But she doesn't always keep her promise...
I remember that once, my mom didn't come to pick me up when the play was over. Sister Chixia happened to pass the theater, so she bought me a big, sweet sugar figure...
She asked me if I like watching plays. I said yes and I always want to be a big hero!
And she told me that a great hero should start from small things, like waiting patiently for mom to come home.
...I know I'm being annoying. I must apologize to you and Sister Junyan!
I won't do this again. I promise I'll wait patiently for the show to start!
Sorry, I won't do it again... I'll do what you tell me and wait patiently.
Oh, great to see you here, Xiaobao. Just behave yourself and cause less trouble to Junyan, okay?
Have you seen the new Taiping Musical by Lingyang?
Are you talking about the new recruit from the Liondance Troupe? Yes, I've seen his play.
He's got a steady step, all agile and flexible. I'm sure that he's a promising talent.
I can't believe my ears. Are you actually complimenting someone?
I'm not done yet. That kid is quick and nimble, but his grasp of the beat is still lacking. The drummers must have a hard time.
Alright, alright, you're the expert on plays. But give more compliments and less stick, will ya?
The Ushers used to be regulars at military drills, but now they're having less members.
The performances are precious. Try not to scare them away with your silver tongue, okay?
You guys just don't know what makes a good play!
Back in my day, those actors were real gluttons for hard work. And that makes them great performers.
Hey, any new arrivals? Got any recommendations?
Hmm, this one looks interesting. Alright, I'll take it!
The show's about to start. Why are there still props lying around?
We need to get these props sorted out immediately.
Qinghe's urging.  We gotta hustle with these props!
The next play's all about Fiamma. The kids are all waiting! Let's get moving!
Fiamma's facing off against a monster much larger than herself. Quite the challenge, I must say...
Qinghe's really putting in the effort wielding that hefty sword...
It's said Qinghe's taking on a role in a new play. Can't wait to watch!
Finally done with the overtime. Time to kick back and relax...
Daddy! When's the Fiamma going to fight the monster?
She'll be here soon, sweetheart. Once the curtains rise and the flames dance, the Fiamma will swoop in and chase away all those monsters!
What a dazzling performance! When those sparks flew, the whole theater lit up like gold. Kindle truly lives up to its name!
Bravo, bravo! The moment Fiamma struggled to rise, gripping that blazing blade... Her determination was as fierce as the fire itself! Bravo!
Defend the south gate! Enemy attack weakening. This wave is almost over!
Please update me on the situation in Jinzhou city.
Under Madam Magistrate's command, the barrier has been activated and citizens are being evacuated to the safe zone.

Huaxu Academy and Ministry of Development are on standby for further instructions. Bazhi is overseeing operations at the Academy while Mortefi has arrived at the Ministry. Rest assured, we are all safe in the city.
And that Rover... He is heading over to meet you. Yangyang is coming with He.
And that Rover... She is heading over to meet you. Yangyang is coming with She.
I see. We have successfully contained the Outbreak here at the base.
I will go pick them up as soon as possible.
The rain's getting heavier...
There are signs of Tacet Discords reviving. Intense frequency fluctuations detected… they’ll be passing through that area. I must create a safe passage for them.
I need to clear the way for them as quickly as possible.
Hang on! This wave of attack is almost over!
Aye, sir!
A couple more Tacet Discords here... Time to get rid of them.
Is that...
The Thundering Mephis?
The soldiers... Watch out, they're not real! And the Tacet Discords are coming at us!
The Phantoms contain a lot of Remnant Energy... These Tacet Discords might be coming after it!
The rain is spreading across Desorock Highland... I can feel chaos growing in the Streams. We must hurry.
More Tacet Discords... Be careful!
The Phantoms contain a lot of Remnant Energy... These Tacet Discords might be coming after it!
The rain is spreading across Desorock Highland... I can feel chaos growing in the Streams. We must hurry.
...Thundering Mephis.
We must bring it down to keep pushing forward.
You must be...
Yangyang, an Outrider. General Jiyan sent us here to help. How are things going?
Those monsters have occupied the emplacement with a surprise attack, but a few brave troops are still holding on.
We've blocked off access to protect our base, but I'm opening it up for you.
Please, they need your help. We’re counting on you!
The Tacet Discords are everywhere... They’ve cornered a soldier! Over there! He needs our help!
We should be safe now. I hope he's alright... Let's go check on him.
General... is that you...
Is that so... Great...
We know how important... This cannon is...
We kept it safe... Never let them have it...
Despite Yangyang's efforts to help the soldier, it seems that the soldier's condition is no longer showing any signs of improvement.
This... Reparation Key... Take it...
I may not see our victory in person...
Please... please defeat that monster... for us...
Thank... you...
...Yes, we will win. Please... rest in peace.
There's more Tacet Discords closing in...
The backup outlet's all fixed, but the Disruptor will take a while to recharge. Please help us keep those monsters away, Rover!
It's him, General Jiyan!
Well done.
...The rain has stopped.
General, the Retroact Rain's effects are subsiding. We are observing a sharp decline in the number of Tacet Discords in the Norfall Barrens.
The Disruptor is fully charged and ready to fire. But...
It takes a lot of energy to fire the Disruptor. If we missed...
...This is our only chance.
Greetings. Can you hear me?
As the Magistrate of Jinzhou, I have obtained the approval to use the Disruptor in combat.
The enormous energy consumption, the risk of a misfire, and the weight of this decision... I will bear the responsibility.
I alone will be accountable for the outcome of this battle, whatever it may be.
General, Rover, please march on.
May victory prevail the lasting night. I pray for your safe return.
...Thank you for your trust, Madam Magistrate.
No need for that, General. We've always shared the same goal, you and I.
Attention, all units. Do everything you can to assist. You are authorized to use the Disruptor!
Target, the Norfall Barrens.
Defend Jinzhou at all costs!

Is it a coincidence? Is it fate? Nah, no...
Oh oops, are you talking to me? My bad, I was lost in my thoughts.
I'm a student at Jinzhou Imperial Academy studying history, and I'm especially intrigued by everything related to the Sentinel.
The Sentinel plays a crucial role in Jinzhou's history. But here's something interesting, I'm not sure if you've noticed...
In our local folklore and tales, the Sentinel is always portrayed as an omnipotent being that transcends human understanding.
But I believe there must be a pattern in its thought process. The people chosen to become Magistrates must share some similar traits.
So, I wonder: what criteria does the Sentinel use to select future leaders?
We were all confident and determined to defeat the Threnodian before. But after that crushing defeat, everyone's confidence took a hit.
We still wanted to win, to eliminate that dreadful monster once and for all, but... we became more cautious.
Interestingly, the newly appointed General and Magistrate both seem to be the calm and cautious type.
Perhaps the Sentinel chooses our leaders based on the public consensus at the time.
But hey, that's just me thinking out loud. I'm all ears to your opinions. Your take might just open my eyes!

“All tangles untied, all glare tempered, all dust smoothed. It is like a deep pool that never dries. ” How true! I've come to understand this line more.

Indeed these words evoke a gentle and comforting imagery.
Guess we can rule out the possible connection between the phantoms and the fog out there. After all, those anomalies are nowhere near as beautiful as poetry.
Perhaps you are right. At least for now, I cannot see any connection between the phantoms and the fog through these words.
Well, at least that's what I deduced from my first encounter with it. I might be proven wrong later on, which is also natural. For now, let's focus on how to get to the center of the mist.
I've been digging through all the data on Whining Aix's Mire, and I think I found a way to make it work. We just have to find the site, reboot the device, clear the fog, and investigate the source!
Luckily, I had brought the ultrasonic pulse chips with me before setting off, so I can share them directly with you.
The actions I just mentioned involve traversing through the marshlands, but don't worry, as long as we have these chips, we don't need to fear the tornado... Wait, where's my backpack?
I'm referring to the backpack in which I keep the equipment for investigation.
Oh no, how can I lose a large backpack like that? All those things in the bag... What about the chips?
Hmm... It was when I met you—no, it was when I was chasing the... Yes, I was chasing after the phantom... I got so caught up, I probably forgot my bag somewhere!
Alright, we should make haste and return to where I was before.
*sigh* I got way over my head back there. It's good to have additional verification for my deductions, but it's not right to let it interfere with our original plan.
Now I can see why Hui never lets me go on investigations on my own...
Here! This is where I encountered the phantom!
But I don't see my backpack... Maybe we should search the surrounding area?
Let's see... Perfect, nothing seems to be missing.
Thank you, 漂泊者. I'll be sure to keep a firm eye on it from now on!
Now... About the ultrasonic pulse chips we've discussed earlier. Here, put it inside your Terminal.
Dear me. It appears you lack the necessary knowledge regarding the Mire. This calls for a science lesson!
No need to worry, this will not involve any complex principles.
This place is called the Whining Aix's Mire. Named after the bird-like Tacet Discord, Mourning Aix, that lives here. Additionally, as you can see, this place has a lot of marshes.

Because of water temperature differences, there's a large vortex deep in the marsh. It used to be considered a local spectacle, but now with the bizarre fog, it has stirred up dangerous mud and spilled it everywhere.
By installing these chips, we can utilize the resonance of ultrasonic pulses to dissolve the mud.
It's hard to explain, so let me show you. Watch that mud over there.
I'll demonstrate what I mean.
Well? Rather effective, isn't it?
As I predicted. You seemed like the adaptable type.
Good. Should we encounter more mud later on, do give it a few more runs. Practice makes perfect.
Ah, yes. I'm still optimizing its functionality and handling. But this current version is what we have that works. But do share your detailed feedback with me once we've completed the investigation.
Now, with the chips installed, our prep work is nearly complete... Now back to the detailed plan of this operation. The first question —
How do we access the center of the fog for further investigations?
Ooh. Now you're making me nervous.
Alright, Alright.
I'm not sure if the Rangers at the station told you or not. But all this fog, thunderstorms, and that huge vortex I just mentioned? They didn't just show up overnight.
The exact spot where it began is now covered in thick fog, so we do know where these odd events originated.
But we still don't know what caused them in this supposedly deepest area. The fog's thick, and wandering into it without caution could mean getting lost forever.
I read that the Court of Savantae Committee once built a dedicated facility here. They even developed suppressors to disperse the fog from the inside.

Yes. Despite of the well-intended attempts of the CSC scholars, the research facilities were eventually abandoned. Without proper maintenance, the suppressors were down soon after and couldn't be located.
With these in mind, our priority is to locate the abandoned facility in order to acquire the suppressors' position and their activation key.
We'll reactivate the suppressors and dissipate the fog as we progress. We should uncover everything once we reach the deepest place.
I agree. Should any aspect of the plan not be executed properly, the entire plan may come to a halt.
However, isn't it part of humanity to not back down when faced with the unknown?  If there is a way, we shall try it out and eliminate the uncertainty along the way.
Hmm... that's all there is to it. If it could be easily resolved, it wouldn't have been a lingering problem that has troubled everyone for so long.
But on the other hand, when you think about it, if we can solve even such a challenging problem, aren't we incredibly capable?
I have confidence, as I won't be alone this time, you will be accompanying me.
This will be my first time working together with anyone other than Hui. As my wife, she has always taken care of me, and as a researcher, she is among the most passionate and outstanding individuals.
Though she's not with me here today, I trust I can successfully complete the investigation with you, my new partner!
Hahaha. Yes! This is the spirit of science!
I'll take that as a compliment.
Well... This isn't the first time. We've been apart for a while now. Sometimes, it just can't be helped, you know?
Anyway, when the situation is against us, all we are left to do... is to put ourselves to work!
Now, without further ado, let us set out to the settlement closest to the fog.

During my previous investigation, residents of that settlement mentioned someone named Qisheng who ran into an unknown CSC building while scavenging. It's likely the facility I've read about in the logs.
I've arranged a meeting with him. We should inquire him about the facility's location.
That sound... Do you hear that, 漂泊者?
Oh my...! B-behind you...It's the phantom!
It just appeared behind you out of nowhere... I know it doesn't hurt anyone, but still...
Well, last time I was the one chasing after it, not it jump scaring me!
Huh? So you've heard about it from the station. Seems like the number of eyewitnesses are beginning to grow.
Fear not. I-if anything does happen, I'll make sure to protect you!
Besides... it only scared us because we weren't expecting it. Now, it's just hovering over there like... a harmless puppet?
But it appeared right by our side out of all the places it could be... It's almost as if it were actively seeking any person passing by.
Like the phantom I was following. It immediately stopped moving after realizing I was behind it.

Indeed. Essentially, the information entities serve as a medium for carrying information, and they are not living beings. But perhaps their impulse to convey information can be considered a kind of instinct.
They yearn to be understood, like how we yearn to understand them.
Now that it has come to us, naturally, it's time to bring out... my frequency transcription program!
Ha, beat you there! I have already initiated the frequency transcription program.
Jiuyue points his Terminal towards the phantom, committing full concentration as he reads out the results.
Jiuyue points his Terminal towards the phantom, committing full concentration as he reads out the results.
Death... I, cannot return... Resurrect... Not...
Forget me... F-farewell?
L-leave... No, wait. There's still more... And it's gone.
Death. I. Cannot return. Resurrect. Not. Forget me. Farewell... The words are making more sense this time. But it's still pretty hard to understand.
Could it be that different phantoms carry different messages? No, that'll introduce too much noise and bring down the effectiveness of communication...
It would make more sense if one message was broken up into separate parts, and delivered piece-by-piece.
Very much so. Yes.
Ahh a rather fitting and... sentimental analogy.
It is possible that the phantoms each carry different bits of the full message. We need to collect all of them to truly decipher it.
As for why and how the message is broken down: It could be purely random, or it could be constrained by the different sizes and energy capacities of the phantoms.
After all, the information can get lost as they run out of energy. Like our two encounters with the phantoms, we can only extract so much information from a single one.
Precisely. But did you notice that this phantom we encountered inside the fog seems to be able to transmit more information?
It may be just a coincidence, but I presume the less distance it travels, the less energy it consumes.
Plus, so far they've only appeared within proximity of the fog, suggesting that... the fog may be their origin?

Yes. As Hui mentioned before, Ecoacoustics and Ecology are two deeply connected disciplines of study. Through unraveling hidden secrets in the fog, we may gain a comprehensive understanding of these phantoms.
Let's press on. It's almost time for our meeting.
Owing to your assistance, perhaps, we were barely stalled or disrupted and made much more progress in decoding on this trip.
Having a partner that you can get along with really makes for an untroubled investigation.
We're here. This is the place we've agreed to meet.
But... Isn't Qisheng a retired army doctor from the Midnight Rangers? This guy looks too young. Who is he?
You must be the researcher from the Academy?
Yes. I am Jiuyue of the Huaxu Academy, and this is 漂泊者. We're here to seek information regarding the derelict Court of Savantae facility recently discovered.
Yet... If my memory serves me correctly, it was Qisheng who had made the discovery. And you are...?
Hello. You can call me Qijie. Qisheng is my father. He was on his way to meet you but ran into a few wounded residents.
Being a former army doctor, he wanted to take care of the injured before coming to see you.
You'll have to wait around for a while. My father was the one who stumbled upon the building in a detour while he was out scavenging. You'll have to ask himself for the details.
It'll be another hour at most before he's back. I'll let you know as soon as he gives me the word.
For the sake of ease, I encourage you not to wander too far during this time. You may walk around the settlement if you'd like.
This is the closest human settlement to the fog and to where the two avian TDs had nested years ago, which formed the unique landscape you see.
Thank you. It's nothing my father can't handle on his own. The problem is he needs to get more medicine ASAP to handle the sudden influx of patients.
Also... not only did we break our arrangement, it simply wouldn't be fair to just ask for your help.
It'll be another hour at most before my father is done. I'll let you know as soon as he gives me the word.
Do feel free to walk around the settlement if you're feeling bored.
This is the closest human settlement to the fog and to where the two avian TDs had nested years ago, which formed the unique landscape you see.
Yes, the Mourning Aix... Its cries are filled with mourn and shrill, randomly attacking any human that passes by. Like any other anomaly, it has caused us a great deal of trouble.
But years ago, it didn't behave like this at all. When I was five or six years old, I first saw it with my father.
It soared in the skies with another avian TD, singing to one another. Even as we stood close by, those TDs didn't pay us much attention, as if they only saw each other.
Later I heard that the other TD had died, leaving the Mourning Aix behind. Since then, it has changed, and this whole place has changed with it.
Must be in a lot of pain to be left alone.
And with so much pain, I presume it had to unleash it somehow...
Just as the name would suggest.
Oh, do I...? Well, of course! I'm a dedicated researcher in solving Mire's anomalies, of course!
Having this basic level of understanding of the issue is a basic requirement.
It sounds like you're quite interested in the creature. If you want to know more, you can ask the elders in the settlement.
For me, memories about the avian TD have become vague and hard to recall.
Are you saying the Mourning Aix may have caused this fog?
What the...? Who even are you?
Please pardon the interruption. I'm a researcher from the Huaxu Academy on a mission to investigate the fog. Please, I need to learn more about what you've just said.
Yes, I'm a researcher from the Huaxu Academy on a mission to investigate the fog. Please, I need to learn more about what you've just said.
Well... I guess there's no harm in telling you. It's not like I'm making it up.
We've seen it many times now. The Mourning Aix enters the fog and stays there for a while. But once it gets out from there, a big lightning strikes, and the fog thickens.
The Aix must have done something!
You said you're looking into all this mess, so... you got any conclusions yet? When are we getting rid of this fog?
You're our best bet now. Please make it go away already!
Rest assured, we'll get to the bottom of it!
I-I just can't do it, Grandpa. I can't even get a melody going, and my cheeks are getting sore...
That's because you're doing it wrong, kiddo!
Can we take a break for just a little... Huh? Are you here for my grandpa?
Well, I can't have you waiting on me. Ask away.
Hehe. Then that means I can take a breath for a while!
You little rascal... Ahem. What can this old man do for you, strangers?
Oh, it's nothing serious. We noticed you were teaching your grandson to play music on a leaf. Can it really make the Mourning Aix sing along with you?
Sure it can. It's something that was uniquely popular among us older generations. And all you need, get ready for it...
Is just an ordinary leaf.
See, Grandpa? They don't believe you either!
Shush! Go away, you brat.
Find a leaf and pinch it together on one side like this... hold the other side close to your lips. Now blow along the edge to make sounds. You may even change the pitch—
Indeed. You can turn anything in the world into an instrument as long as you've got the music in you. If you put your heart into it, you can even use it to express your feelings.
When we were young, we would sit on the cliff after a long day of work and play some simple tunes with the leaves.
The Mourning Aix and the other bird TD rarely attacked anyone, and we'd watch the two always flying right beside each other off in the distance, back and forth like a lovely couple.
Some random fellow then suggested that we use the leaves to say hello. So we gave it a try, and to our surprise, not only did they understand us, they even eventually joined in singing to our tunes.
Boy, those were the chill and relaxing days.
Yep. Good times never last.
Yep. All because of what happened afterwards...
There was a TD Outbreak... Every TD out there was hungry for the sounds. Human or not human, they'd tear everything to shreds.
Trying to protect its partner, one of the birds were attacked and chewed up alive by rampant TDs. The one that survived went mad later because of it, becoming the Mourning Aix we all know today.
Perhaps from its perspective, time forever froze at that moment. From then on, it lived like a zombie, denying and attacking all living things that approached it.
So... you're saying the reason why big birdie became the Mourning Aix, is because it lost its loved one?
Like Mrs. Qiu. After Mr. Qiu passed away, she no longer made delicious rice cakes like she used to. Now they taste either salty or bitter.
A bit too early to be getting into these things for your age, don't you think, my boy?
Hehe. I learned it all from Grandpa!
Why you little... You're in for it now. You'll be practicing extra hours as punishment!
In time, one must accept their losses before truly moving on. It doesn't do to dwell on it.
Yeah, it's tough. But there are things I'd always feel driven to do, no matter what.
Things like... exploring the unknown! Like this investigation!
Now, let's push on!
Thank you for your patience, Jiuyue, 漂泊者. I hope you've enjoyed your stay here so far.
Father told me the wounded have been treated, and he is on his way here. Shall we head to our meeting place from earlier?
Sorry for keeping you waiting.
As this fellow researcher had told me, you're here to ask about the Court of Savantae facility, correct?
According to the archives, the Court of Savantae once built a dedicated facility to study the origin of this fog. I guess it could be the one you've discovered.
A research facility for the fog... Hmm... That explains why the facility is equipped for observation, with environmental simulators and a central control panel in the center.
I tried using it. Was still in working condition, but it needed authorization credentials or something.

No need to worry! The Huaxu Academy has dedicated procedures set in place when it comes to matters relating to the Court of Savantae. Prior to my departure, Mr. Xiangli Yao told me everything I needed to know.
I will share with you the coordinates of the facility. But... are you really planning on going there?
I'm aware that you must've done a great deal of research regarding the fog. Yet once you've gone inside, you'll soon realize that the reality is completely different.
*sigh* With all the TDs growing ever so restless, plus those weird phantoms... and the mud, it's all over the place...
Yes. With 漂泊者 and I's unparalleled teamwork, there isn't a task we can't accomplish.
That's right, leave all the science to me. We won't set up to fail.
Hehe. I was just doing my job... After all, you are my partner in this investigation.
I understand that you have your reasons for your persistence. But still, do prioritize your safety above all else.
Let me think... Here, I'll mark all the routes and locations I used to reach the facility on the map for you. Follow them closely, and you'll be safe.
Get fully rested and take all the supplies you need from the settlement before you go.
According to Qisheng's map, we should be approaching the facility right about... There! There it is!
TDs... They seem to be covered in... Is that mud from the marsh?
And they're standing right in front of the entrance, of all places... Like last time, we should clear the mud before we deal with them!
Fantastic! Splendid work as usual, 漂泊者!
Let's go inside. If we can gain access to the control panel, we should find further information about the facility and the suppressors.
This must be the control panel Qisheng spoke of.
By the looks of it, the facility has been abandoned for quite some time, and no one's tampered with these controls since.
I... do not know. I failed to find any relevant information when I was studying the archives.
But sometimes, research gets cut short because of funding, outside pressure, or other issues. It's not always the researchers' choice.
Our predecessors were unable to find an answer, but at least they left behind these clues. It's on us to keep their legacy alive and move forward.
Hmm... It's is still in working condition, and there's enough backup power... Now, according to Mr. Xiangli Yao's instructions... Username, and then...
There, I'm in!
Err... Classified documents of team SR-461? Sounds more like some kind of “code of conduct”... Then again, it also feels strange to be one...
But on the bright side, thanks to this strange manual, I now have more information on suppressors. There are a total of three devices... Downloading keycode... Logs... Done!
漂泊者, I have the keycode. You should keep a backup in your Terminal as well.
The keycode and the suppressors share a same operating system. With this information we can pinpoint their positions neglecting any interference. Now we won’t lose our way in the fog.
The roads ahead should grow increasingly smoother if we activate the suppressors sequentially.
Visibility is lower than I anticipated, and the readings are all over the place... So this is what it’s like to be in the fog...
It’s completely coated in mud... Top to bottom.
Yes. But unlike the TDs, which covered themselves with these substances as protective cover, the suppressors’ operations are completely disrupted by it.

After we departed from the edges of the marshlands and now reaching the insides of the fog, there’s been a steady increase in our sightings of this corrosive substance. Could it be... that it also came from the depths of the fog?
Or is the source of the fog the composition of some kind of powerful energized substance?
You remind me. Normal devices do not require monthly maintenance or even frequent activation to this extent. At the end of the day, most issues can be resolved remotely.
Unless when it’s an external issue like the one we have here, where actual manpower is required to intervene.
Related or not related, we have to clean the device, or we can’t figure out where its controls are, let alone have it up and running again.
How about we make use of the vortex to give it a deep clean?
A highly compressed jet of water should clean the mud off in one go!
It’s working! Readings show a significant decrease in energy fluctuation. Our plan is a success!
But this... Is this the log mentioned in the classified manual?
The records end at the surveying of the Mourning Aix. 漂泊者, have a look at yourself...
The log states the Mourning Aix carries energy substance into the fog... In doing so the suppressors’ efficiency was reduced, but a deterioration of the Aix’s vital signs was also observed.
Could there be a connection between the Aix and the fog?
It’s the same energy substance taking the form of mud...!
Just like we’ve done it before. Clear the mud before we can activate the suppressor!
Let’s see, this one should also have a maintenance log inside... Ah, I found it!
This one has more entries than the first suppressor. And this time the contents... are a bit different?
I’d have to say, the wording in this log is rather emotionally biased, and even the conclusions are as equally far-fetched.

Which part are you referring to specifically? The likelihood that the source possesses human intelligence? Or the part regarding the avian TDs carrying human emotions?
Till this day, the Academy has yet to discover any signature of life signs from within the fog, yet I cannot use this as evidence to deny the researcher's speculations.
While hypothesis is one matter, validity is another.
Nonetheless, I'm inclined to believe his theory holds merit. As we continue to prove the feasibility of the seemingly impossible, fewer are the regrets we have to deal with.
That is the...

Perhaps they exist to complete the other.

Well, I'm indeed curious as to why it went through all this trouble getting us here.

These are videos related to the avian TDs.

In the first footage, the two can be seen flying together, circling each other as if they are in a chorus... Similar to that of what Qijié and the settlers had described. It must be when the other one was still alive.

Resurrection... it’s out of the question beyond any doubt.
The river you step into again will never be the same river you stepped into for the first time, and things that perish cannot truly be resurrected.

Yes. A love letter that has spanned across life and death.

We haven't activated all the suppressors yet, and not even reached the source of the fog, but we've already sorted out the cause of the fog.
According to the description of our tasks and mission procedures, if the source of the fog is the accumulation of the TD remains, activating the final suppressor is all there’s left to do.
According to procedure, we should report the Mourning Aix’s situation to the Midnight Rangers and have the professionals handle the remains.
Yes. For the settlers of the Whining Aix's Mire, a thorough extermination of the remains may be the most direct and efficient way, but may not be the best.
Carefully gathered remains, only to have them cleared and its final hope shattered by the humans. This might arouse the Mourning Aix's hatred towards the humans. It may go berserk.

Yes, it's as if being only one step away from the finish line. We have to do something to perfectly wrap up this investigation for the both of us.
Perhaps... only by truly accepting the loss and giving up the idea of resurrection can we prevent the Mourning Aix from trying again and causing another anomaly.

Have it let go of its persistence... It might sound a bit too optimistic and sad.
It reminded me of what was written inside the researcher's log, of the Mourning Aix's plea to humans as its companion died, and its never-ending cries of sorrow.
I honestly believe that it is capable of feeling the same emotions as humans.
With the passing of the one it holds dear, it cannot forget, and does not wish to forget. So it shackled itself in place, entrusting everything to nothingness...
If we can find a way to help them meet face-to-face for one last time, have its companion convey its feelings to the Aix directly—
“Stop, let it go, pull yourself together. Start over, and move on.”
This is something... only the other half can do.
We need to adjust our plans. Once we’ve activated the remaining suppressor, we head straight to the source, but not just to figure out the cause.
But to attempt to solve the cause from its roots.
There. That’s the final suppressor.
Considering how the fog significantly dissipated on the outer perimeter. Activating this one, at the very least, should give us a clearer view of the source.
Intensity of energy fluctuations has reached peak numbers... The source of the anomaly. The accumulation of TD remains.

Our interpretation and speculations of the “phantoms were correct. In attempting to resurrect the fallen avian TD, remains accumulated by the Mourning Aix has caused anomalies in the form of fog and corrosive mud.
The reason for the “phantoms ability to carry information owes to the scraps of consciousness of TDs inside the remains.
Due to the fragmented nature of these consciousness, they’re inadequate to be fully formed into it, nor does it possess a body that can move or speak as before.
However... there is a way in which we can bring it to see the Mourning Aix! And help them... bid each other a final and absolute farewell!

According to existing theories on Echoes, the residual consciousness can be converted into Reverberation frequencies and stored into a Terminal. Then, with some tweeking, it can be reproduced as a projection to mirrior its original appearances.
An hour at most...
Since the remains were pieced together, the consciousness will be inferior to that of a real Echo, but an hour should be more than adequate for them to confess each other’s feelings.
Now, let’s use the Terminal to absorb the Reverberations from the remains.
Ahh... And there they go, flying off into the distance. Understandable, as they should make the most out of their final goodbye before their energy is completely exhausted.
An unthinkable reunion they’ve been yearning for all this time... A reunion that not everyone has the luxury to experience.
Hmm... Seems like you caught on to it.
You’re right. Love is something that simply cannot be hidden from sight, especially since... Hui’s my most beloved sugar-plum in the whole universe.
I tried my best to maintain an objective view, but it seems I just couldn't help myself.
Aha! It was my reaction that’s led to the verification of your speculations. Very cunning, 漂泊者!
Alas, I’m sure you’d know... Love is something that simply cannot be hidden from sight, especially since... Hui’s my most beloved sugar-plum in the whole universe.
Although Hui has parted this world for ten months and thirteen days... I still miss her so much.
She was the greatest researcher of them all. She’d always venture deep into Tacet Fields to acquire the latest data on the TDs.
If only I had been at her side that one time, death wouldn’t have separated us at least. In the end, I wasn’t there for her, so she never came back, and I... am remained here.
To certain extent, what happened afterwards was comparable to that of the Mourning Aix.
I refused to accept her departure, and lived as though entirely stripped of life... I also held on to the illusion that as a researcher, I may be able to find a way to bring Hui back to my side.
Yes. As Xiangli Yao had said to me as well.
How can anyone bear to see the one you deeply love live in a daze? You’d wish them the best and move on.

Even though left alone, there’s no need to be depressed. All there is for me to do is to carry the memories we shared, our past, and continue to move forward and live a good life. This is what Hui would hope for me to do.
I’m sure its what the avian TD would tell the Mourning Aix in their goodbye.
It's hard to say, but I’m hopeful that it’ll be happy ending.
If its capable of garning the determination to ressurect the other at the cost of inflicting self-harm. Then... I’m sure it’ll find a way to move on following it’s companion’s wishes.
Naturally, the Aix will have to endure a period of pain before achieving it, and saying goodbye is the first step to a fresh new beginning.
By all means.

I was assigned to this power station to restore power of that lighthouse on the hill.
Everything else was swiftly taken care of for a genius such as myself.

This power station utilizes a pulsed power supply system. After the battery is installed, the circuit must be fully connected within a certain time frame.
In order to complete the connection, the pylons along the circuit must be activated using physical force in sequential order within the time limit.
Unfortunately, I was only bestowed with a genius brain but not strong physiques. I've always been at the bottom in terms of fitness, and I simply can't complete the route in time.

There's just no way I can activate all the pylons leading up to the lighthouse within such a short time period...
It's proving to be a bit harder than expected, huh? Want to give it another go, Rover?
Just reinstall the power unit and the electromagnetic pulse will start its count down.
Try to pick up the pace a notch this time. I'm counting on you, Rover!

I say Captain, but I'm actually the only one left on this ship. This morning, Espey, my last companion, also quietly left the Stingray unnoticed.
It was already late evening when we found this lighthouse on the mountain yesterday, so we made an approach and prepared to go on land and check the place out after dawn, as we have done in the past.
It wasn't until dawn that I found Espey had already gone missing... I'd thought that he had escaped with all the remaining supplies.
But I was quickly put to shame by my own suspicions - The supplies were untouched. Espey left them all for me.
He knew fully well that the remaining supplies weren't enough to support two people on sea, so he left the last hopes of life to me and went ashore to seek for survival.
What an idiot... Even if we both were to die at sea, I would never have the thought of abandoning my crew.
So I left some supplies at these coordinates, hoping that they would be useful to him... From here on out, this will be the final voyage for me and the Stingray.

General.

I feel much better, but the Phantoms are still coming back from time to time...
Three years... It's been three years already.
I was on the vanguard team during that battle.
Memories of my teammates lost their minds fighting those Phantoms haunts me to this day...
Those Phantoms... Illusions of both soldiers and those monsters... They were not real, but somehow they could injure and kill us.
We had to strike them down to survive.
But then… Our dead comrades were coming back to life, ready to stab us behind our backs... It was chaos. We were terrified, couldn't tell friend from foe...
The Retroact Rain contains Remnant energy that can recreate past events and project them as Phantoms.
Those Phantoms can transform into familiar people or objects by resonating with living humans in the rain, through their frequencies.
During that battle, the rain's effect was further enhanced by the Threnodian's power.
That was why the Phantoms gained physical forms, and why the rain could recreate very recent events, like bringing back soldiers dead minutes ago.
Unaware of the mechanism behind it, we tried to eliminate all the Phantoms, and it only worsened the situation.
Now we know the Phantoms are merely replicas of past events.
While not a perfect solution, the antidote for Retroact Rain can lessen its effects and help us differentiate between reality and hallucinations.
Keep your chin high. Our fallen comrades wouldn't want to see us down trodden like this.
Yes, sir. I will pull myself together!
General... You were there during the Battle Beneath the Crescent, too. Please be careful of the Phantoms in our camp.
General, we're all clear in the west!

I just heard some weird noises from the north...
Stay here and hold your post. I'll go check it out.

Can we really trust that medic?

That day... As the rain fell, we watched in uncertainty, unsure whether it was a sign of hope or disaster.
The Retroact Rain should have been a harmless Waveworn Phenomenon.

Yeah, exactly! Meet Rover, my awesome new friend! Today’s treat’s on me, so I brought him here to experience your culinary magic.
Yeah, exactly! Meet Rover, my awesome new friend! Today’s treat’s on me, so I brought her here to experience your culinary magic.
Oh dear, then I must show him something!
Oh dear, then I must show her something!
Any preferences or dislikes? Sweet, salty, sour, spicy, just let me know what you like. There’s always a Jinzhou cuisine for every taste!
Alright, something light... Find yourselves a spot inside. The dishes will be ready soon.
Before long, Panhua served up the dishes. The delicious pairing of sweet Candied Caltrops and slow-cooked Jinzhou Stew made you hungry.
Alright, something spicy... Find yourselves a spot inside. The dishes will be ready soon.

Hmm... The Candied Caltrops is fresh with just the right sweetness; the Poached Chicken sauce is Auntie Panhua’s original, unmatched anywhere else. Oh, and the Jinzhou Stew! It’s something you can only find here. I bet you’ve never tasted anything like it! Trust me, you don’t wanna miss out on this!
I’ve decided. Let’s get all of them.
We Patrollers don’t get paid a lot, but I love treating my friend to a feast once in a while. It’s just one meal, I won’t go broke!
To cater to all appetites, Auntie Panhua’s rolled out a small portion menu. Same fantastic flavors, just less food waste. So, no need to fret about over-ordering!
Alright, find yourselves a spot inside. The dishes will be ready soon.
Before long, Panhua served up the dishes. The delicious mix of Candied Caltrops, Poached Chicken in sauce, and Jinzhou Stew made your mouth water.
Rover, you enjoying the meal?
You got it! Next time, we’ll bring Yangyang and Baizhi along. Food’s always better with more pals, right? But what should we get then?
If you come next time, I’ll have to treat you to a taste of my famous Essence Medley Soup.
That’s all? Seriously? Not even Auntie Panhua’s culinary magic can shake you?
Looks like I’ll have to introduce you to the wonders of the Essence Medley Soup.
Something special? Hmm, give me some time to think.
In that case, I’ll have to introduce you to the wonders of the Essence Medley Soup.
Essence Medley Soup? What’s that?
It's brewed from the finest Jinzhou ingredients. Every essence is simmered and distilled into a single bowl. Some gourmets claim it's the epitome of Jinzhou's flavor, captured in a nutshell.
Even though I just polished off my plate, there’s always room for soup in my second stomach. Rover, fancy trying it out? Auntie Panhua, can you whip it up for us?
Whoa, did you hear that? Brewed from the finest Jinzhou ingredients! My taste buds are tingling already... Rover, fancy trying it out? Auntie Panhua, can you whip it up for us?

It's not that I'm unwilling to make it right now... In fact, it's an old wartime dish, a recipe lost to the ages. We keep it alive through word of mouth, preserving its memory. Now, about its taste, people have a lot of fun debates about it, but one thing's certain: it's like a warm, fresh hug, absolutely delightful and unforgettable.

However, while searching through old books, I stumbled upon its recipe. Though, calling it a recipe might be a stretch. See, back then, they used names for ingredients that are like riddles to us now. “Red beads,” “sweet roots,” “Monkvyrid,” “golden handle spoon”... I have no idea what they are.
Speaking of peculiar ingredients, it does remind me of someone...
Stop beating around the bush. Just tell me. I won’t take offense.
Well… it’s Uncle Mahe!
Hmph, he’s always bragging about how he can get any ingredient, but if he’s clueless about these, he’s just wasting his time in this business.
Just so we’re clear, I won’t go to him for answers, but if you want to give him a shot with this recipe, it’s your call.
Auntie Panhua! You’ve got the sweetest heart. I always knew it!
Alright, I’ll copy the recipe for you.
Don’t worry! I won’t let you do it for nothing! Auntie here will make sure you eat your fill!
No injuries. I still have my weapon and Terminal.

Ack... My hand. Age is finally catching up to me, I guess...
Thank you so much for saving me. If you wasn't here, I might have faceplanted into the ground by now.
It's okay, I'm fine. As long as my camera is okay, everything’s okay. It's still working perfectly! But my hand... *sigh* What about the photos?
It's okay, I'm fine. As long as my camera is okay, everything’s okay. It's still working perfectly! But my hand... *sigh* What about the photos?
Yeah. I'm putting together a photo collection called Old Memories of Jinzhou. Basically, it's a mix of old and new photos of the city.
I work for a magazine called Wutherium Geographic as a journalist with the Pioneer Association.
Our job is to take pictures and share the beauty of the world with people who can't travel.
I've been working hard for this goal. I may not look the part now, but when I was younger, I traveled across mountains and rivers, taking countless phots, and some of which even won awards!
But all of that is in the past. I'm getting old and close to retirement...
And now my hand is busted, which is just great. *sigh* With only three places left to go, too. I guess I won't be able to finish the last set of photos before I retire...
Really? Do you really mean it? I don’t know what to say! I-I'll credit you in the magazine and you’ll get paid for sure. Please, you're my only hope!
Ah! Take my camera. All you need to do is aim it at the scenery you want to shoot and press the shutter release, and the moment will be forever captured...
The first scenery is that high ground where I was earlier. Good luck and be careful!
The Explosive Charges I had before all got stolen by the other camps. I finally managed to collect these, and now...
My future life depended on those thirty Explosive Charges!
*sigh* Forget it, I might as well just suck it up. It's not like I spent hours collecting them or anything.
With Explosive Charges, my buddies and I can blast open that rock formation under the hill.
The minerals inside should be enough to pay for my medical bills in the city...
Ah! I've said too much... Why did I even tell you that?!
R-really? That's great! Thank you!
Here's some heads up for you.
Explosive Charges that are freshly picked tend to be very unstable. Even the slightest amount of vibration or change in temperature can cause them to explode.
Me and my buddies went through a ton of effort processing and stabilizing those we had earlier.
You definitely won't make it in time if you go pick them up now.
However, the Exile camps nearby should have plenty of charges stocked up, some of them might even be ours.
You can try out your luck around those camps.
Easy for you to say. Thirty Explosive Charges! Where in hell am I supposed to get all of ‘em...
*sigh* Forget it, I might as well just suck it up. It's not like I spent hours collecting them or anything.
You wanna help me get some Explosive Charges? Ain't much, only thirty will do.
Awesome! That's wonderful.

Another batch of recruits left today, I hope everything goes smoothly for them on the front line...
I haven't had a good rest for a while... Oh well, let's just get through this period.
You are on military premises. So make sure you follow the rules, my friend.
If there is no important matter, it is better not to stay here. If you want to visit, register with Xinle first.
Is there anything I can help with?
I see... If you're requesting a visit, please register here... and go through the security search. Hmm... You're all set. Please remember, Keep quite while you're in the military facility.
Excuse me, are you the... Rover? The one who helped Jinyue find that treasure a while ago?

Oh, allow me to apologize on his behalf. For you've helped out Jinyue, as his older brother, I should show my gratitude. Feel free to come to me if you have any difficulties in the future.

As long as I'm a Midnight Ranger, I'll guard the base with my life for it's my duty, after all. I hope you can understand.

What an ingenious way to use this thing! Those years of service in logistics certainly taught you a few things... I'd take notes.
Forty-six... Forty-eight... Fifty... What's the matter? Are you looking for me?
Yes, the inventories won't do themselves.
Phew... If only I could go to the front line like the seniors of Vanguard... All I do now is count these stupid boxes every day. There's no end to this job...
Thank you, I will try my best. But, enough with my whining. If I can't even handle these trivial matters, I won't make it to the front line.

Although the Rearguard is in charge of logistics and defense on the back, I heard many of the former Rearguard members earned honors no inferior to those of the Vanguard. Perhaps my mundane task is a form of training. I can't beat myself up anymore.
You're right, Qingxi says this to me as well. I was too being short-sighted.
Even the simplest logistic duties concern the safety of Jinzhou and the livelihood of the comrades on the frontline. There's no room for mistakes.
You there, looking to put on some training? Good training keeps you sharp. The enemies won't go easy on you out there.
Listen, the mourning of the planet before the apocalypse—
It's a broken symphony of sounds, the sighs of the tide, it's your, your...
Yes, yes! We'll cut it here. The energy is just right...
What? Oh, pfft, I couldn't be better! This is the end of my apocalypse, the beginning of a creative stretch of poems, and the embodiment of my love for literature!
Writer's block? Nonsense... Just put a period where you're stuck—
Brilliant. I'm really a genius!
