M-Moving ahead, this initiative will enhance user knowledge and align them with Lollo's business, optimizing value delivery synergies!

The magazine seems full of abstruse terms and buzzwords such as LOD, roadmapping, closing the loop, product matrix, and more.

That was me doing the entrance interview for Lollo Entrepreneur Incubator Project. Phew, thought I was getting rejected again.
Make the best of everything and everyone is one of Lollo's corporate values.
At Lollo Logistics, our team members are empowered to take initiative and bring forth innovative business ventures through the Lollo Entrepreneur Incubator Project.
It offers selected candidates access to company funds to launch pilot businesses within our facilities for a week.
This season, the focus is on couriers' entrepreneurial ideas under the theme Judging the Business Loop by User Experience.

Have you heard of the industry-famous How to Talk Like a Real Business Elite?
I asked a friend to get me this book and tried to find out what that theme really meant...
...But these jargons only feel too specious to make sense.

Now, I did have quite a few ideas... Lollo Hitman, Lollo Fixit, Lollo Petting, etc.

These specialized markets are born from the specific needs and challenges our customers face every day, namely, their pain points.
...I'm too deep into the jargon. You know what I mean.

I know you'd be the perfect candidate for this job, 漂泊者. What do you say?

They can be redeemed for cash and other rewards. Now, what do you say?

A new business that suits just your capability: Lollo Fixit.
I heard you fixed a lot of puzzles in the wild alone, including even those left by CSC. You should find no problem doing this job.

There are many animals roaming in the city. People living in other places would like you to pet and feed the animals in their place.

Your encounters yesterday inspired me. I've developed a new business overnight.
Nah! We're helping people eat stuff! And we make money from that! It's called Lollo Eater!
Jewel Boba has launched a collab event with the popular game, Second Coming of Solaris.
Players can buy collab drink at Jewel Boba for a chance to get limited edition redemption codes. The hype is crazy!
They get the codes, we get to drink boba and make money. It's a win-win!
Let me see... One cup for one pull....

...Starting from the 50th cup, the probability of winning increases, and the guaranteed drop appears by the 60th cup.

Ding!...
Ding! You have...

I will name it Lollo Take-in. I was inspired by a post on Lollo's internal forum.

A non-native customer placed a Lollo cold-chain order, wanting a Pulled Chicken from Panhua's Restaurant...
But I only found that I forgot to take the food when I arrived at the customer's location. Careless of me...
To make up for my slip, I rode the customer to Panhua's Restaurant, so he could order the chicken himself and have a fresh taste!
Now, I contacted this courier and got his authorization...
The traditional food delivery takes the food to the customer's home. In that case, it might be difficult to balance time-efficiency and the condition of the dish.
And that's why our Lollo Take-in will go the other way: we deliver our customers to the food!
I already came up with a slogan: Eat wherever you want with Lollo Take-in!
Ding! You have a new take-in order. Please pick up the customer on time.
An order! That looks like a faraway location, though... I don't think I've ever seen any people living there?

Then I'll drive there to pick up the customer.
Impact detected, impact detected. Ejecting copilot in 3141.5926 seconds...
Traveling to... Rinascita.
Repaired, the courier truck shakily makes its way to Port Gunchao.

Meow meow meow...
Let me try the cat language translation module!
Wangcai is said: Numb. Something's zapping me inside the light box. My tummy feels numb. Please get me out quickly.
Quick. Turn off the circuit module, and I'll go save Wangcai.

You and Xuanyin join forces to save Wangcai, prompting cheers from the crowd. After thanking you, Xuanyin takes Wangcai to the Academy's medical department. It seems you'll have to wait until next time to feed Wangcai.
Welcome to the Second Coming of Solaris: Jewel Station. How many cups would you like?
Present endless treasures to the Second Coming of Solaris! I'll have 100 cups of boba!
And make half of them large, no ice, and less sugar please!

Order #1: 5 cups, 0 code.Order #2: 30 cups, 1 code.Order #3: 22 cups, 1 code.Order #4: 1 cup, 1 code.Order #5: 10 cups, 2 codes...With 68 cups of boba in your stomach, you and Maji call it quits earlier than you expected.
It's just a bunch of Exiles. We don't need be afraid of them!
We're asked to investigate. Don't rush.
I say let's just storm inside and beat them all.
H-Have you lost your mind? I'm not going with you!
The honorable Madam Jinhsi, our great magistrate of Jinzhou, was handpicked by Sentinel Jué. Her status as the Sentinel's Appointed Resonator is rare among all past magistrates.
Our Jinzhou was leaderless for years until Jué finally chose her to be the next Magistrate, and she answered the call.
To further elaborate, we must start with the Battle Beneath the Crescent...
The Norfall Barrens, scarred by countless wars... Discarded weapons scattered like bones.
Our soldiers had fought to reclaim the land for years, to no avail.
Ovathrax, the dreadful Threnodian monster, fed on the frequencies of weapons turning our fallen soldiers into deadly Tacet Discords...
General of the Midnight Rangers, Geshu Lin, bravely rose to confront the threat.
As twin moons aligned, General Geshu Lin vowed to vanquish evil, raising his blade against the blood-red crescent that foretold destruction.
His sword blazed with black flames, laying waste to all who dared stand in his way. Victory seemed certain...
...Until the Retroact Rain began to fall.
Raindrops fell upwards as in the past. Monsters raged, loyal souls fell to blood-soaked sands... Infernal carnage!
Issuing his last command, Geshu Lin demanded all soldiers stand firm, no matter what happened.
Sacrificing his body to the black flames for power, Geshu Lin charged at the Ovathrax with all his might... And he was never seen again.
After the fall of their leader, the remaining soldiers despaired... Until a deafening roar of the Qingloong struck like lightning. A lone youth bravely stood up to lead. A hard-won retreat!
After the battle, that young man who tamed the wind ascended to fame, becoming the new General of Midnight Rangers, selected by Sentinel Jué.
On the other hand, General Geshu was blamed for the massive losses that occurred under his command, earning him a notorious reputation in Huanglong...
That battle struck us hard, but our Sentinel rose from its long slumber to select a new Magistrate who guide us into the future.
Despite the previous disaster, Jinzhou was off to a promising start under our Sentinel and the new Magistrate's guidance. The people held hope for a better tomorrow...

Come on, you two. Say “Thank you!”
Meow!
Meow, meow!
…Granny told me some bad uncles and aunties are doing bad things in the town recently.
Tabbie and Patchie like to sleep in the box. Maybe those bad guys thought there was a “treasure” inside, like others said, so they grabbed the box and took Tabbie and Patchie with them.
I've been looking for them for quite a long time... Thank you for bringing them home safely.
Wow! You are so cool! I need to be stronger and protect Tabbie and Patchie.
And I made a new home for them using a beautiful new box! I put it in my home, so it's safe there.
You are welcomed to come and play with us at any time!
—Rover, it's been some time.
I have a request to make... Hongzhen is in danger. I need your assistance.
Let's discuss in person. The coordinates have been sent to your Terminal. I'll wait for you there.
It's been some time, Rover.
There is still much to be done, but things are finally looking up for Hongzhen. We've weathered the storm, and the darkest times are behind us.
The Sentinel's barrier is gone, and Mt. Firmament can be seen once more. Now, Hongzhen and other parts of Huanglong are reconnected.
At such a pivotal moment, it is even more essential to document our recent events in detail for future generations.
To that end, the Magistrate and I have gathered a team of scholars from Jinzhou to revise the Hongzhen Chronicle.
A scholar named Qianyue is cataloging recent tales around Hongzhen.
However, she mentioned certain... strange phenomena in her reports.
Indeed. I agree with you.
There's surely someone or something with wicked intentions at play here.
I fear some exploit this chaos to spread discord. A thorough investigation will expose these troublemakers.
Rover, I ask for your help. Assist Qianyue in uncovering the truth so peace may be restored to our town!
Hello.
Yes? You are…? Oh, I see. You folks are here for the snow monster too?
Imagine a tank-sized ape, with the power to freeze everything around it into ice sculptures.
I saw it once as a kid, just a glimpse of its back while tagging along with my dad in the mountains.
Sounds like a Tacet Discord with freezing abilities.
So, how do you intend to find the snow monster this time?
This time? I never actually encountered it. If I had, I wouldn't have lived to tell the tale!
But, I did come across… evidence of its hunting.
Evidence of its hunting?
Okay, long story short.  I went hunting in the mountains and found some strange contraptions at the base of Loong’s Ridge.
I thought they were left by the Court of Savantae. No idea what they were for. You know, I haven't found anything related to the Court of Savantae there before.
Maybe they have a secret vault nearby?
That's what I thought. So I followed the contraptions trying to find it.
Did you find it?
Of course not. This is a tale about running into a snow monster,  not about a thief hitting the jackpot with a vault!
I trekked up the mountain and saw some... animals. Oh, not just any animals, there were Tacet Discords too.
Tacet Discords? They didn't attack you?
Nope. When I found them, they were all frozen solid.
Birds, deer, even the Tacet Discords—every one of them frozen stiff. You could see every hair crystal clear.
Can you believe it? Even the snowflakes around them were frozen. Gave me the creeps, I tell you.
So you think the snow monster did all this?
Who else would it be? What else could turn living creatures into those… terrifying ice sculptures?
I totally forgot about the vault and ran like the wind, terrified the snow monster would jump out from nowhere and turn me into a popsicle like the rest of them.
Yes, why didn't I think of it sooner... The Court of Savantae must've sealed that monster with one of their contraptions, and someone let it out by mistake!
That explains everything! No wonder it's been centuries since the last time people saw the snow monster…
Hold up, didn't you say you saw it as a kid?
Did I? Ha… Hahaha, well, yes, besides ME, it's been centuries since anyone saw the snow monster!
Uh, wait! And my father! He saw it too.
Qianyue doesn't ask more questions, but the skeptical look on her face suffices to show her opinion.
Qianyue doesn't ask more questions, but the skeptical look on her face suffices to show her opinion.
By the way, if you're planning to hunt the snow monster, why not grab some of my poison arrows? They're made to take down wild beasts quickly.
Think about it. You'll be out there, staring down that snow monster, wishing you had something to defend yourself with. Trust me, you'll regret not taking these.
Smart move. Here. It took me years to craft these beauties.
But… they look just like regular arrows?
Hey, open your eyes! These are no ordinary arrows. The tips are poisoned. The one I used is colorless, odorless, safe for humans, but deadly to beasts!
…Well, maybe keep them to yourself for now.
Fine, your call. Just don’t say I didn’t warn you when the time comes.
Anyway, you're not the only ones curious about that snow monster. Excuse me, got another customer… adventurer to attend to.
The hunter leaves in a hurry, taking his deadly, invisible, and odorless poison arrows with him.
Well, I've got all that recorded. I'll sort through it later.
I can't help but feel… these two incidents aren't quite what I had pictured.
The herb collector didn't even get a clear look. From his description, sounds more like a rare Tacet Discord than a monster.
But the whimpering or howling he mentioned does pique my interest. If it was a Tacet Discord or a monster… why didn't it attack him?
That makes sense. Maybe a Tacet Discord got stuck in a trap or wedged in a crevice?
That makes sense. I've heard some Tacet Discords are friendly towards humans.
Hmm, now that could be the real story behind this evil ghost.
As for the hunter, he gave a really detailed account.
If he were making it up, he wouldn't have included verifiable details like the creations of the Court of Savantae.
Which means the frozen animals are real. The Court of Savantae creations are real, but…
That's right! No snow monster, just a ruse to sell those poison arrows.
He did see the frozen animals, but he didn't know who did it and how.
Spreading rumors about the snow monster was just a way to lure in hunters.
Yeah, who froze those animals? Tacet Discords? Doesn't quite add up.
Something's off about these two sightings. Maybe we need to visit the locations for answers.
Hello? Excuse me.
Yes…? You are…
Story…? It's not a story! It really happened to me!
I was almost killed on that mountain! Just the thought of it sends shivers down my spine, like it's still lurking out there, watching...
Look behind me, you don't see anything, do ya?
No…?
That's a relief. With so many people in Hongzhen, I bet that thing wouldn't dare show its face. But that place… I wouldn't set foot there again.
What do you mean by that place? Where is it?
Curiosity killed the cat, they say. Getting mixed up with that monster will only spell disaster. I must've lost my mind insisting on checking it out…
Madam Xinyi…? So, she heard the rumor too? Not surprising, she always takes everything here seriously.
Gathering tales…? I've heard those pages are filled with countless regional folktales, so it’s only natural you’d want to add this.
Alright, if you're here to listen, I'll tell you exactly what happened.
Hold on! Let me start the recording first… Alright, please go on.
It all began three days ago. I was deep in the mountains hunting for a rare herb and lost track of time.
By the time I stumbled upon the herb, night had fallen. Fearful of beasts prowling after dark, I decided to take a shortcut back to Hongzhen.
When I reached Loong's Crest, I heard some... strange noises coming from the darkness. They sounded like metal clashing and scraping, mixed with eerie cries.
I thought it was just a poor Scarefrost Deer caught in a trap, so I pressed on. But the deeper I went, the creepier it go.
What kind of noises?
Hard to describe. Whimpers? Howls? Whatever it was, it wasn't human, and it sure as hell wasn't any beast I'd ever crossed paths with.
More like a twisted combination of both.
The noises gave me goosebumps. Then I remembered the story my grandmother once told me.
Long ago, the Sentinel and the Court of Savantae worked together, using their bizzare creations to seal some real vicious monsters.
Their bodies crumbled to dust over the years, but their evil souls hung around, craving revenge on the Sentinel.
Revenge on the Sentinel? That's wild!
Ahem, I'm talking here, young lady. Interrupt again and I won't say another word.
Oh, I'm so sorry…
Where was I? Ah, yes, the evil souls. I was in a dilemma, you know. Terrified as I was, curiosity gnawed at me, urging me forward…
Suddenly, out of nowhere, two lanterns appeared in front of me. It happened so fast, I didn't even realize it was impossible to have lanterns out in the wilderness like that.
The lanterns seemed to float, barely visible. They flickered once, then a few seconds later, flickered again.
It wasn't until then that I realized they weren't lanterns at all, but eyes! Eyes as big as lanterns. How big would its head be?
I turned and ran, and that monster kept howling behind me. Believe me, I've never heard anything so bone-chilling.
I didn't dare look back, just ran for my life. I lost track of time, but eventually, I saw the lights of Hongzhen and knew I was safe.
I heard you passed out at Hongzhen's entrance, right? Thank goodness the night patrol found you. Otherwise…
Non-nonsense! I didn't pass out! Just… a bit tired from the running! Yeah, I was tired!
Anyway, whatever was chasing me must be the souls of those monsters! One wrong step, and I'd have been its next meal!
Alright, that's all been recorded. What's your take, Rover?
Yes, I agree. I've heard nerves can make you see things that aren't real. Maybe it was just a Scarefrost Deer... or a passing Tacet Discord?
If you're really curious, go see the monster for yourself. I spotted it near Loong's Crest. Just remember, I did warn you.
H-here we are... This should be the location mentioned by the herb collector.
Let's investigate the surroundings. Look, I've got a camera. I'll make sure to take pictures of anything unusual!
What are these boxes for?
Looks like they were used to store equipment.
This cage must be for the really big one.
But it looks brand new. I don't think it's been used.
What's this doing here?
There's a memo attached to it, but it seems to be stained with ink.
So, someone was experimenting on animals and Tacet Discords here…?
But something went wrong, so they had to bail.
Fantastic! I think we captured everything noteworthy around here.
Rover, could you scan the area again? I want to make sure we haven't missed anything.
Is that… a claw mark?
It's long and deep… What could've left this?
It's gotta be a big one. Seen any beasts around here that could've done this?
Hey, you two! This stuff is ours! Hands off!
It's… it's the Fractsidus!
Didn't you hear me? Drop it! Leave now and maybe I'll spare you. Otherwise…
Have you lost your mind? It's that Rover! Even Mr. Scar is no match for him!
Have you lost your mind? It's that Rover! Even Mr. Scar is no match for her!
Rover…? So what?
We endured so much, paid such a high price… No, with this new power nothing will stand in our way!
Our mission isn't to cause a scene! We're here to assess the camp's condition. We should try talking, not wrecking everything in sight—
This opportunity is being handed to us! With our numbers, we can easily deal with them.
Don't you want to prove your worth? Then join me against the Fractsidus's enemies!
I-I don't want to do crazy stuff like this!
Hey, get back here, you idiot!
Coward! I'll definitely report him to the boss.
No biggie, we still have the upper hand. Let's go. Take them down!
O-okay. Take care, Rover!
That was… AWESOME! Like, bam, pow, and they were down!
Me? I'm totally fine. They didn't get within a mile of me!
Scared? Why? They're no Tacet Discord, and not even close to a real monster.
The Fractsidus caused Jinzhou and Hongzhen so much misery. Honestly, seeing them get beaten up... Oops, I mean punished, is kinda satisfying, not gonna lie.
Jinzhou's been my home since I can remember.
These guys have robbed and killed. If I were a Midnight Ranger or even a Patroller, I'd have taught them a lesson!
Together, we stand strong! Even an ordinary person like me, with the right tools, can fight! Can defend MY home!
Hmph, I should've joined the Midnight Rangers instead of the Imperial Academy. Spending all day writing dull editorials... Too late now.
Oh, almost forgot our mission. We've got all the clues, so the truth must be…
Right! The Fractsidus caught some animals and Tacet Discords… all for some kind of experiment.
They must've stumbled on that big one, the same one the herb collector saw. Luckily it must be harmless, so the collector got lucky.
The Fractsidus set a trap but ended up provoking it. They had to bail when it fought back.
But I wonder if that snow monster was their doing too?
The Fractsidus… items left by the Court of Savantae… frozen animals… experiments using Tacet Discords...
There's gotta be a link, but what?
Anyway, let's go to Loong's Ridge first. Maybe we'll find answers there.
We made it! I don't think I walked this much all of last year...
Look! Items left by the Court of Savantae. This should be the place. Rover, let's search around.
The box… It's empty.
Must be used to store a certain device. Whatever was inside, the Fractsidus must have taken.
But they left all their supplies at Loong's Crest. Hmm… maybe whatever was inside is important to them?
Rover, this must be the Fractsidus's experiment log.
If what's written here is true, it's awful…
These devices look like what those Court of Savantae guys make. Their designs clearly aren't based on modern Automata Mechanics.
It's the Time Stasifier, able to halt time within a certain range.
It's the Time Stasifier, able to halt time within a certain range.
So you mean those animals were… Yeah, that should be it.
Alright, I think I've probably got things figured out.
The Fractsidus calls this place Site 2 and ran experiments with the Time Stasifier created by the Court of Savantae.
Those frozen animals? They must be the device's test subjects caught in time.
And the monsters at Loong's Crest must've been captured with it, too.
But what's their plan? The memo from Site 1 mentioned a frequency suppressor… What’s that for?
Yes… So they can control them, like in the diary.
This is absurd...
Are they all mad? Why would they do this?
For power? Is it really worth all this?
For dreams? I doubt these killers know anything about dreams.
But cities like Jinzhou or Hongzhen offer protection. Folks can go about their daily lives, so why go looking for this kind of trouble?
I just... can't wrap my head around it. There's no excuse for this.
You're right. We have to stop the Fractsidus. We can't let them get away with this.
We've arrived, Rover, it's right over there!
Hold on. It looks like…
Don't bother going over. It's too late…
Don't bother going over. It's too late…
Boss, all systems are go. We’re ready to roll with the next experiment whenever you say.
Hey, Ogo, it’s showtime!
Me… showtime?
Who else? You want to live, right? You want power, don’t you? That’s exactly what the Fractsidus is all about.
We turn the weak into the mighty, the nobodies into somebodies, and mere mortals into… gods.
Relax, it’s just another tweak. Like the upgrade you had before—only this makes you stronger and less constrained.
Look at this beast—gorgeous, isn’t it? Strong, too. Those sharp claws, that glossy fur, those bulging muscles…
Listen, Tacet Discords are not curses, they’re miracles. And now, you get the honor of harnessing that miracle. Don’t let me down.
Can I… really make it?
Of course, Ogo. The Fractsidus isn’t pouring money into this just for kicks.
Just fire up that machine over there, and you’ll be... transformed. No one will be able to touch you, much less take you down
I'll take it upstairs. Once you get stronger, you'll move up the ladder too. Say goodbye to grunt work.
I… Fine, I'll do it.
Ogo trembles as he approaches the machine. With no other option, he entrusts his fate to this experiment he neither understands nor cares about.
Initiating frequency suppressor injection… triple unit. Ogo's frequency detected, causing effective interference with the Tacet Discord's frequency. Synchronization rate: 95.27%.
HAHAHA! We did it! Such a genius move, using human frequencies to take down Tacet Discord’s!
As long as Tacet Discords understand our language, we can boss them around however we want!
Shut down the Time Stasifier and release our new friend… I mean, old friend! Even that Rover won't stand a chance!
The Artificers turn off the Time Stasifier.
Ogo? Can you hear me? How’s your new body feeling? I get it, four legs might be a challenge at first. Take your time.
Hold on, boss. Ogo's frequencies… they're gone.
What? Don’t be stupid. We combined his with the Tacet Discord’s frequencies. Of course you can’t see his, moron!
No… the Tacet Discord’s frequencies are unchanged. His were completely devoured.
This isn’t funny! Ogo, wake up! Now isn’t the time for a nap… No, no… Stay back! STAY BACK!
In those final moments, Ogo's response was neither what he hoped for nor expected.
Is it… is it over? Is Ogo…
I see… That's okay. We did… we did everything we could.
I read his diary. All he wanted to do was survive, but… he's not as lucky as we are.
He didn't have a safe place to call home or the means to protect himself.
I used to think justice was everywhere in Huanglong, just like in Jinzhou.
We have the Midnight Rangers guarding us and the Patrollers keeping order. Everyone lives in peace.
To me, Tacet Discords and Tacet Fields were just distant stories, less real than the monsters in fairytales.
But today, I realized that… they're right here.
Ha… I’m not blaming myself. I just feel… like I’ve been slacking off all this time.
…No, I did nothing.
I'm still the little girl who once looked at the Midnight Rangers believing they could solve every single problem…
I never thought about who needed help, let alone took action. Looking back, I feel ashamed…
But first, I gotta figure out what my heart wants.
Anyway, I have all the details recorded. When I get back to Hongzhen, I'll write them in the Chronicle.
Next up... I might just join the Pioneer Association and travel the world. I want to see what lies beyond Jinzhou's walls with my own eyes.
You're right. I've got to take that first step.
Thank you, Rover. Let's head back to Hongzhen.
Your efforts seem to have borne fruit. What conclusions have you drawn about the incidents, Rover?
You tell Xinyi about what happened.
So, it was the Fractsidus behind these disturbances, all to push their disgraceful goal. How despicable.
Thank you for bringing this vital information to light. I shall ensure that patrols around Mt. Firmament are intensified to prevent any further attempts by these miscreants.
Oh yes, and Qianyue seems to have found her footing since she returned.
There is no better teacher than experience itself. I hold high hopes for her future contributions.
Once again, Rover, I'm grateful for your assistance in this matter.
Umm... Who are you?
My stomach hurts... I got food poisoning from accidentally eating the wrong herb to be more precise.
No need, I'm a doctor myself. I've checked my pulse and it's nothing too serious.
I just didn't expect this herb to be poisonous. It was supposed to be safe. I should've been more careful.
According to the Supplement to Great Pharmacopoeia, it's a herb called the Loong's Pearl.
The pharmacopoeia says that it isn't poisonous—on the contrary, it can dissolve toxins from plants, wood, metal, and stones.
I suspect there might be some errors in the pharmacopoeia, or maybe I mixed up two similar herbs.
Uh... sure. I've got it with me. Here.
What is it? Did you find anything?

Really? Let me see... The Loong's Pearl is a fine medicine, but where fine medicine grows, poison also flourishes. Neighboring the Loong's Pearl there usually grows a poisonous herb known as the Yunjiao Gall, which causes unending stomach pain when consumed.
It resembles the Loong's Pearl, so be careful not to mix them up.
I see... Sorry, I should have read more carefully.
Wait, there's more. It also mentions an antidote: Loong's Pearl can counteract the poison. The most potent ones thrive under waterfalls and have a strong fragrance.
An antidote growing near poisonous herbs... It aligns with the pharmacological theories. Looks like this isn't a mistake.
Could you help me find a Loong's Pearl beneath the waterfall? I'd go myself, but I really can't walk now.
Thank you, friend.
You... you're back... Did you find the herb?
Hmm... the slight blue hue, the faint glow, and the aromatic scent. Yes, it matches the description in the pharmacopoeia.
According to the records, it can be consumed directly if in an emergency, although it might be more effective after processed.
Shinong puts the Loong's Pearl in his mouth begins chewing. His pain visibly eases.
Shinong puts the Loong's Pearl in his mouth begins chewing. His pain visibly eases.
Phew... Much better. It looks like the pharmacopoeia's description of the Loong's Pearl was accurate. Thank you.
Ah, that's a long story. Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Shinong, a doctor from Jinzhou.
I've been studying ancient pharmacopoeias and medical books from all over Huanglong.
While the medical practices of Huanglong share the same roots, many ancient texts have been lost over time.
Luckily, Hongzhen has managed to preserve some texts that may have been lost elsewhere.
But over the years, as supplements are made, all pharmacopoeias and medical books inevitably suffer from confusions and omissions.
They even include some superstitions that are completely unrelated to medicine.

For example, there's a remedy that involves holding a rooster at exactly noon, jumping three times under the eaves, and then spinning around three times. It's said that if the rooster crows at that moment, it will drive away any plague.
While it might be a fun folklore activity, in practice it doesn't do anything to treat any illnesses.
That's why I wanted to revise these pharmacopoeias—to remove the unnecessary parts and correct the errors.
And the best way to do this is to try each herb personally and observe any reactions.
This way, I can determine their effects and uncover any side effects not mentioned in the texts.
Don't worry. After generations of supplements and revisions, I'm certain any herb that poses significant health risks are all highlighted in these pages.
Worst-case scenario, it would just be minor mishaps, like what happened earlier. Such risks are predictable and entirely manageable.
Oh, as a token of gratitude, here's some tonic that I brewed.
Don't worry. I brewed it using my proven recipe.
Until we meet again, friend. I wish you good health.
Hey, 漂泊者! Fancy seeing you here!
Of course not—well, not yet.
I read an anecdote in Hongzhen Chronicles about a young man from a few hundred years ago who discovered that Pavo Plums has temporary memory-enhance effects.
He memorized all the texts of Hongzhen with the help of Pavo Plum's incredible effects, earning him the nickname the Walking Bookshelf.
So... you know. I want to try it.
I agree that the story might be fictional. But there might be some truth behind it.
I've always been gathering Pavo Plums from around this area. But according to Hongzhen Chronicles, only those found near the hot spring and that can slightly heat up has medical effects.
But I've searched everywhere near the hot spring and haven't found any Pavo Plums like the ones described.
R-really? That would be great!
漂泊者, did you find any heated Pavo Plums?
Exactly as the chronicles described... I didn't expect it to exist. Interesting... But it could be a mutation.
H-haha. Don't be upset. Presumption is the first step toward truth.
I suspect that the surrounding heat might have induced some changes in these Pavo Plums... potentially altering their medicinal effects.
Now, 漂泊者, could you please say something after I eat the Pavo Plum?
Anything will do, preferably something long and complicated. I want to test if it truly helps improve memory.
As soon as Shinong finishes the Pavo Plum, his face twists into a peculiar expression.
As soon as Shinong finishes the Pavo Plum, his face twists into a peculiar expression.
It's... it's... it's...
It's so SPICY! I've tasted countless herbs, but I've never tasted anything this SPICY before!
Wait, I think it's working... Say something, Rover. Anything!
You effortlessly recite a passage from a tongue twister.
You effortlessly recite a passage from a tongue twister.
You passionately perform a monologue from a movie film.
You passionately perform a monologue from a movie film.
Hm... Hm...
...None, actually.
After all, it's just a fictional anecdote that can't be taken too seriously. But you never know unless you give it a try.
Perhaps. If I've learned anything from revising these pharmacopoeias, it's never to underestimate the wisdom of those who came before us.
Anyway, these Pavo Plums don't show any special effects, even though they can absorbe heat... and are extremely spicy. Well, that's a small discovery, at least.
Thank you, 漂泊者. There are still quite a few herbs from the pharmacopoeia that I haven't tried yet. I'll go and search for them now.
Um... It's you, 漂泊者.
I fell off the hill by accident. Luckily I got away with only a swollen leg.
According to the pharmacopoeia, a herb called Elderflower grows on the hilltop, which is far more effective for treating external injuries than other herbs.
However, it appears I overestimated my athletic abilities.
Anyway... Ahem, I'll need your help again, 漂泊者. Could you go to the hilltop and pick some Elderflowers for me?
Elderflowers grow at the top of that hill, so please be careful. But given your abilities, I'm sure it will be a piece of cake.
Yes, those are the Elderflowers!
According to the pharmacopoeia, simply grind them into paste and apply it to the injury. It takes effect almost immediately.
Shinong applies the paste to his leg, wincing at the sharp sting it causes.
Shinong applies the paste to his leg, wincing at the sharp sting it causes.
Ah... All right, this should do it now.
Much better... I should be back on my feet after a bit of rest.
You must find it strange, 漂泊者. Why am I out here risking my life instead of treating others back at the clinic in Jinzhou?
Many believe that I'm doing this for fame and attention.
For minor ailments that could easily be treated with injections or pills, using herbs involves a lot of effort, including collecting, concocting, and refining the herbs.
...They think it's meaningless, just a form of performative art and self-satisfaction. What do you think, 漂泊者?
Exactly. These pharmacopoeias are the legacy of our ancestors' wisdom. Yet, nowadays, few are willing to put in the time to revise them.

As a result, the errors in these pharmacopoeias keep piling up, making them less and less trustworthy. Many people who could have been cured end up having their conditions worsen or prolonged due to incorrect treatments.
I'm not doing this for fame. I just want to preserve our ancestors' tradition and help more people avoid suffering.
...No, it's just a simple wish. The wish of a doctor.
Maybe I'm just a humble doctor, but at least I have the courage to see it through.
Thank you for your help, 漂泊者. Don't worry, I'll get back in town soon.
Hello there, can you hear me? Hello?
Um… I feel terrible...
...Yes, I believe it's a type of migraine.
You're just in time, 漂泊者.
Based on my observation, he has a rare disease that is only documented in a pharmacopoeia.
...It's tough. The disease can't be completely cured, and can only be alleviated with medication. However...
I found a prescription in a medicinal book... The note says it has little effect on this kind of migraine, but I think there is a flaw to it.
The prescription uses Silver Lotuses as the main ingredient, but it's not effective for the symptoms.
I recall from the Complete Interpretation of Lost Prescriptions that regular Silver Lotuses and those that are over ten years old have opposite effects.
After observing the migraine's symptoms and checking his pulse, I believe Silver Lotuses which have bloomed for over ten years should be the correct remedy.
It's possible. There's a chance that a minor omission occurred during the transcription. Unfortunately, this small mistake was enough to render the disease untreatable.
I've administered some relieving medicine to the patient. 漂泊者, could you go to the nearby hill and collect some Silver Lotuses that are over ten years old? I'll wait here for you.
Thanks, 漂泊者.
This is it! It fits perfectly with the description in the pharmacopoeia. Well done, Rover!
I'll start concocting the medicine now... Please wait.
After a while, the patient takes the medicine and quickly regains consciousness.
...Um. Wh-what happened? Did I... Oh right, I passed out again.
It's because of your migraine.
Did you help me? It's an old ailment. I've been managing it with medication, but I often...
...Huh? But I feel so much better than before. How is that possible?!
I'll write you a prescription. Take the medicine as directed for a week and you should fully recover. If you still feel unwell, feel free to contact me anytime.
Fully recover? But my doctor said my condition is incurable. Are you... some kind of miracle workers?
...I'm just a regular doctor.
Where is your clinic? I'll make a banner for you and send it over as soon as I get home!
No, no, there's no need for that. 漂泊者 is the one who gathered the herb. I just...
...I just did what any doctor would do.
Nevertheless, please accept my deepest gratitude and respect for both of you.
I've made a lot of progress recently and have finished revising the  pharmacopoeias in Hongzhen.
I'll send them to the clinics. Hopefully, what I'm doing can benefit more people.
Next? There's a long journey ahead. The world is vast, and there are countless pharmacopoeias to rectify. I'm not sure how many I can complete.
But I will do my best.
May our paths cross again, 漂泊者.
Please, everyone... at least look at what I'm selling.
Isn't it obvious?
...Not hardly any. Make that none.
Oh... Are you a customer? Sorry, I thought everybody left.
So, are you interested in our stones?
Sigh. I know, right? I honestly don't know what the boss was thinking...
I mean, who would buy this kind of stuff around here? See, all the houses here are built out of either wood or bricks.
Not to mention most of the locals don't even have a Terminal.
A lot. Before I got into sales, I worked in customer service.
I just needed to type in some words online and everything's done.
As for in person sales... I've never done that. And, uh, I get the jitters when I talk to people face-to-face.
Plus... people on the street aren't interested in stones at all. I wouldn't know who to sell them to even if I wanted to...
Fixing houses, generally, but hardly anyone does that even in Jinzhou nowadays.
Or maybe paving roads? But that's not something anybody can just get up and do...
Well, let me think... Oh, right, making statues!
Thanks! I know who would want the stones now!
Oh, would you... mind coming with me? There's no way I'll be able to get a deal on my own.
Wow, thank you so much! I'll get stuff ready and meet you at the souvenir store in town!
Welcome, sir!
Are you... talking to me?
Yes! Is this your first time in Hongzhen and looking to buy something? Well, you've come to the right place!
What would you like? We have Mt. Firmament oolong tea, made from tea leaves freshly picked this year using ancient techniques. It's only ten Shell Credits an ounce, with a money-back guarantee!
Ah, it's you, 漂泊者. Do you know this gentleman?
Well, since it's your friend, I can give him 20% off all items in the store!
He's so much more professional in sales than I am...
Ahem. No, actually, we're here... to sell.
Sell? You mean like the herbs you found and gathered on your trip?
Yes... yes, and quality stones for sculpting at that! We offer all kinds of them! Here's a sample... for you to... take a look.
It does look nice, both the texture and color... But this is not from Mt. Firmament, is it?
No, it isn't. I brought it with me from Jinzhou!
Wait, is there something wrong with it?
Not in the slightest! Our company has been in the stone business for over 10 years in Jinzhou. And we... we've always offered the best there is at affordable prices...
Sounds a bit suspicious. If the rocks are fine, why are you so nervous?
I see. That explains a lot. When I first worked here, I couldn't even get a whole sentence out. It's okay, you just need more practice.
All right, then let's get down to business. What's the price?
Yongxin gives an irresistible quote.
Yongxin gives an irresistible quote.
That really is pretty cheap... I've heard that they have to rely on heavy-duty machinery to mine rocks out there, but this...
Sorry, I can't do it.
Is the price too high for you? That's fine, I'm sure we can work something out...
It's not about the price. These statues were carved out of Mt. Firmament rocks.
Mt. Firmament rocks...? Are they different from the ones in Jinzhou?
Of course. Every rock in Mt. Firmament had been blessed by our great Sentinel.
Well, I'm not joking with you. Don't believe me? Just take a look at that!
Out the window? Is that... the Loong's Crest? Wait, the shape... Don't tell me...
That's right. Not just Loong's Crest, the appearance of the entire Mt. Firmament was hand-chiseled by the ancestors of Hongzhen to resemble our Sentinel!
It's okay, you're not the first to be blown away by this marvel. Like I've always said, the story of Mt. Firmament's Sentinel statue really should be included in the tourism pamphlet...
All right, I got to get back to work. Hongzhen's been bustling with visitors lately. Catch you later, 漂泊者.
I guess I still got a lot to learn about Hongzhen... I'll hang around and see if I can get new clients. If I work hard... I can definitely...
My mind just... goes blank and I don't know what to say.
That's it...? That does make sense... Let me dwell on it. Thank you, 漂泊者.
How is it?
Is it a go?
*sigh* Let's call it a day. I need time to think.
Thanks for the help, 漂泊者. Here's your reward.
I'll try to come up with something else.
Ah, 漂泊者! Are you busy? I'm over by Spring's Taste right now.
Spring's Taste? Are you taking a dip in the hot spring?
Spring's Taste? Are you taking a dip in the hot spring?
No, no, I'm here for business. I've found another buyer, but I still get pretty nervous... Mind helping me out again?
See you in Spring's Taste if you can make it.
There you are, 漂泊者.
It... it's too hot here for sure. That's hot springs for you. Even the air feels hot...
Hello... I am...
Here you are, finally. Tongchuan Pharmacy sent you, right? Do you have any idea how busy I am today, and you just got here? Where's my shipment?
Shipment...?
The medicine I ordered for spa therapy. Wait, why are you empty-handed?
And 漂泊者... when did you start working for Tongchuan Pharmacy?
Yongxin quickly explains his intent.
Yongxin quickly explains his intent.
Oops, my mistake. He didn't look familiar to me so I thought he was from Tongchuan Pharmacy.
But I don't have time for that right now. As you can see, I'm swamped here... And the fact that the medicine from Tongchuan Pharmacy still hasn't arrived yet makes it even worse.
Oh, right! Can you check on the delivery for me, 漂泊者? If I don't have the spa ready soon, I'll get complaints.
Yes! I knew I could count on you!
You're a rare sight, 漂泊者.
Here for some herbs? I just got a fine batch in from Jinzhou. They work wonders for both internal and external use.
Oh my, can't believe that slipped my mind.
I was going to send someone over this morning, but the guy called in sick. Xinyang must be getting impatient by now...
Let me see... Yeah, should be these. Thanks for delivering them, 漂泊者.
You're back, 漂泊者?
Yes, this is it. I spent a lot of money on this new recipe. Now, all I have to do is put it in the hot spring.
Dip in the hot spring just for fun, twice to dodge the flu and run, thrice for muscles feeling fine, four times to make sickness decline!
Oh, the fellow over there... What did you want to see me for again?
Excuse me, but... do you need stones for your hot spring?
Stones? You mean for renovating the pool? No, because we're in peak season so it will cost me a lot of money to renovate now.
How about rockery, got any of that?
Yes, yes! We... do...

...Well, our rockery comes in a variety of styles, such as the Jinzhou border style, the Mengzhou garden style, and the newest luxury style from Huanglong capital. We also offer customization based on your own design, dear customer!
Dear customer, you can order now for free shipping to Hongzhen, plus a three-year warranty! If you have any questions or need more information, please leave a message and I will...
...Is this how people from Jinzhou sell stuff nowadays? Sounds a bit weird... but it's actually kind of appealing?
Hm... Indeed, I do think the spring is missing something, so if I added this...
Phew, I guess that's one deal closed. Now I can face the boss.
Well, my boss was never optimistic about Hongzhen, or he would've never sent a low-man-on-the-totem-pole like me here.
But I did it... I've taken the first step, and that's because I have your encouragement and help...
Didn't you want me to say what I say best? That's all I know...
I still came off a little nervous, but much better than before.
Then I'll have to keep working at it. Thank you, 漂泊者.
漂泊者, I think... I think I just got an incredible deal!
I heard the temporary research institute wants a batch of stones from Jinzhou. I don't know what they plan to do with them...
But it sounds like a great opportunity. I'm going to the institute and see what's going on. Catch you later!
It's simple, really. If we create a macroscopic node with Resonator A, we can use that as the coordinate to perform a three-dimensional expansion through inverse anisotropic frequency...
So you want us to build a three-meter-tall marble control station from your model?
No, no, I said three-dimensional expansion. It means, uh, taking apart the model's original four-dimensional structure...
You need a four-legged stand, too? No problem. It can all be done as long as we have the blueprint.
漂泊者! I was just telling this gentleman here about our latest project, but he... seems to be proposing a bolder, more profound approach.
To be honest, some of the suggestions are quite inspirational, like the four-directional magnetic restraint he mentioned, despite the lack of practical proof...
Thank heavens you're here, 漂泊者...
Frankly, it's like a foreign language to me, except he's not a foreigner.
Do you know each other, 漂泊者?
Oh, right, I remember now. Pardon me. I've been knee-deep in the new project...
Phew... Thanks, 漂泊者. Now we can finally get back to business.
You must be the hunter we hired to collect Scarefrost Deer samples, right?
Huh?
Ha.. haha... Oh, is that so? Oh right... I think I did mention something like that.
Actually, we've been working on a new project that mainly focuses the impact of the Sentinel's time barrier on Mt. Firmament's ecology.
As you can tell, even though the time barrier is gone, the residual effect caused the snow to be permanent, leading to the unique ecology you have now.
The environment may appear stable now, but who can guarantee it won't collapse or become disastrous for Mt. Firmament in a few years or decades?
The people of Hongzhen believe that Sentinel's power has seeped into the rocks of Mt. Firmament.
Therefore, by comparing the frequencies of the rocks of Mt. Firmament to those from other areas could give us a clue to what's really going on.
Ahem... but there's a... big hurdle.
We're running out of budget. It's the director's fault. No matter how miraculous Mt. Firmament is, we just can't afford all these projects at once...
So... can you give me a discount? Please, the future of Mt. Firmament is at stake.
But what I'm offering is already really low... We still have to haul the stones all the way from Jinzhou, and we might even run into Tacet Fields on the way...
This is a very crucial study, so please...
What, me...?
But I... I can't make the call. I'm a nobody... I'm not even a professional salesman.
*sigh* I must be out of my mind... Fine, I'll sell them to you at cost price.
Really? That's wonderful! I'll put in a budget request right now!
This probably isn't going to work out for me... The boss might fire me on the spot when I get back.
I don't know. But they seemed so passionate... and committed.
I looked into the research station before I came. They declined generous offers in Jinzhou and other places to work in these makeshift conditions.
I don't understand exactly what they're studying, but I know it's important.
Thank you, 漂泊者. I feel much better now.
I'm still a little bummed-out about it, though... It took me so long to get to this point.
Hope so.
Hey, it's you, 漂泊者. Come, grab a drink.
I totally screwed everything up. These past few days have been a complete waste of time. I barely made any money, and I haven't been able to get a foothold in the market at all.
My transfer order should come through any day now. After that I'll be back in Jinzhou explaining to my boss how I messed everything up.
Brrring brrring...
Brrring brrring...
Excuse me, 漂泊者, I have to take this.
Yongxin has a brief exchange with a client through his Terminal. Though a bit nervous, you can see a true salesman emerging right before you.
Yeah... I really didn't expect that.
He said he's a merchant from Mengzhou looking to invest in tourism around Mt. Firmament.
The mountain passes around Hongzhen have long fallen into disrepair and are no longer suitable for travel, so he plans to buy some stones and pave them up.
He actually did not consider buying from us at first, but he happened to meet that researcher in Hongzhen on a business trip.
After learning we supplied a batch of stones at a low price to support the scientific effort in Hongzhen, he seemed to think that demonstrated... a certain quality of our company.
True. Good things tend to happen to good people, perhaps?
I'm glad I made the right call that day, all thanks to you, Rover.
For as long as I can remember, whether it was my family, teachers or colleagues, no one believed I could achieve anything.
They would leave the most menial, insignificant jobs to me and never ask for my opinions.
If it weren't for you, who were willing to put faith in me and believe that even someone like me could do it...
I don't think... I would have never had the courage to make a decision.
I'm probably just too excited because I finally got a big deal.
But I meant everything I just said.
Okay, things are going to get busy from now. Thanks for helping me out, 漂泊者.
I learned a lot over the past few days. I feel like I'm ready to handle any sales opportunity that comes my way.
That's right. But once you succeed, it's much easier the second time around...
Oh, I gotta run back to Jinzhou. There's this big deal waiting for me to take care of.
Thank you, Rover. I'll definitely be the greatest stone salesman in all of Jinzhou when we meet again!
Hey, it's you, 漂泊者. Come, grab a drink.
Compared to mere firewood, we need brave pioneers to ignite the flames of change.
Reveal your soul. Let me see If you're the one we seek...
Don't look back. Join them on this right path, and I've got a scorchingly delightful welcome for you up ahead!
Kneel before these brave pioneers who paved the way for our enlightenment.
You've tainted your blade with their blood... Join us, and together we'll forge a path to a new world. Let go of your stubborness already.
...The Weiqi pieces were scattered, but the guru remained calm. It's getting late, he said gently to the woodcutter. Shouldn't you be heading down the mountain?

As he glanced at the sky, the woodcutter was shocked to see how much time had passed. It couldn't have been more than two hours, he thought in disbelief. Feeling apologetic, he prepared to leave, worried that the guru would be annoyed with him.

But when the woodcutter turned around, he nearly jumped out of his skin. The hermit guru, who had been playing Weiqi and drinking wine, was now gone. In his place lay a shattered Weiqi board and a heap of decaying bones.
The woodcutter was so scared that he dropped his bamboo basket and ran down the mountain without even looking back.

As he reached the mountain's base, he was hit with a stark realization. The quaint village he remembered had bloomed into a bustling town, with sturdy brick houses replacing the humble thatched cottages. And where his home once stood, only an empty wasteland remained.
He noticed a date on the calendar that he had never seen before. In shock, he grabbed a passerby and urgently asked, Excuse me, can you tell me the current date and time?
As he heard the answer, his legs went weak. Everything had changed—time had passed and his loved ones were gone. No one remembered him anymore.
So the woodcutter left Mt. Firmament, but how was he still alive and kicking? With a hundred year's worth of time inside him, shouldn't he...
Your story... It's a bit far-fetched, don't you think? I mean, if I wasn't from Hongzhen, I might have fallen for it.
...Well! That's the whole point. The truth is stranger than fiction, my friend. Every detail in that story is based on real events.
Let me share with you the other legend of Mt. Firmament, for deep within its sacred peaks lies a powerful secret... the “Secret of Immortality”!

We all know that Mt. Firmament is the abode of the Sentinel, gathering spiritual energies from both heaven and earth for countless eons. Over time, even the mountain itself has taken on the form of our majestic Sentinel!
Living in the mountains for long stretches of time, surrounded by fresh air and drinking from nature's own bounty, can add years to one's life span!
It all starts with that game of Weiqi, one that the woodcutter stumbled upon. Too bad those secrets have been long forgotten...
Gather around now, people. You're in for the story of a lifetime...
Shh...
...I'll see you there.
*yawn* What's with the ruckus... Huh, what’s that in your hands?
Hmm... Behold Hongzhen in its entirety, next to a ring and hanging eaves. When eternal snow thaw into flowing streams, let us reconvene.”
Ooh... I see, I see...
I see I've got no clue at all!
I get the very last part, at least! She’s asking you out! Well that's a fancy way to write stuff...
And now... this next sentence, eternal snow thaw into streams... What is that supposed to mean?
How did you manage to get all that hidden meaning?
But the buildings in Hongzhen all look pretty much the same. Which one exactly was she talking about?
Makes sense. Lead the way!
What can I help you with?
When snow thaw into streams? Ah, you’re not from around here, I bet? When we say that in Hongzhen, we mean the Shichen of Wei. Early afternoon, the warmest hours of a day.

Legend tells of a visitor who ventured here some centuries ago. Back then, local villagers were struggling with no firewood due to heavy snow. This visitor opened up a path with their Forte and diverted a hot spring to provide warmth and aid.

People say it was once a stunning sight, with mist and ice flowing westward down the streams, as if many celestial beings were returning to the sea. Now the sight has unfortunately disappeared, but the saying sticks. We use it to describe time in local speech.
Well, it's what Grandpa Zou tells everyone. I haven't seen it with my own eyes, but when it comes to stories like this one... They're usually made-up.
Oh please, I'm only repeating what I've heard from him. He's been on a roll with his stories lately. But let's not take them too seriously, they're just for entertainment.
Hmm... Not that I don't want to believe them, but... Oh, you were listening to one of his stories earlier too, right? What did you think?
Really? So you're into stories and anecdotes too?
Looks like we have that in common.
Haha... Maybe Grandpa Zou can learn a thing or two from you in terms of humor.

Grandpa Zou's great-grandfather was a descendant of the first inhabitants of Hongzhen. He grew up hearing stories about Mt. Firmament. Recently he heard Madam Magistrate had resolved the crisis, so he decided to visit and learn more about his roots.

People in town are curious about the outside world and how they are perceived. Grandpa Zou is happy to answer their questions and has unknowingly become popular among them. Before he knew it, everyone was coming to talk to him...
It's funny to hear outsiders describe my hometown, Hongzhen, as mysterious. We're just a normal place with our own quirks...

Especially lately, with so many people from Jinzhou coming on some kind of expedition. They're obsessed with us, like we're some kind of ancient relics. Can you believe they actually asked if our Pavo Plums have magical powers?
Time truly is a formidable force...
What do you want? I've done nothing wrong!
Huh? Uh... You're just asking for directions...? Sorry, I'm not a local, can't help you there.
Wait, you... you were the one talking to Lady Changli earlier, weren't you?
The young man begins looking around warily, as if in fear of something terrible hidden in the shadows.
The young man begins looking around warily, as if in fear of something terrible hidden in the shadows.
If I were you, I'd steer clear of her. She's a deceitful woman who enjoys toying with people's hearts. A cunning villain who will manipulate you without you even knowing it.
Haven't you heard? She left her government job to come here, to this small town. There's gotta be a reason behind it.
I heard she chose to quit her job, but I bet she messed up back in the capital and got demoted here as punishment.

Then I guess you've also been fooled by her looks. That woman will stop at nothing to get what she wants, while you remain oblivious to her true intentions. And by the time you catch on, you'll already be caught in her trap.
Wait a minute, has she actually achieved anything substantial during her time in Jinzhou? Or did Madam Magistrate just fall for her clever words and let her slack off?
Hmph... I say you're underestimating Changli's trickery.
I... I have my reasons to believe so!
I heard she tricked that VIP guest of Jinzhou into going to Mt. Firmament. Just think about how dangerous that place was!

She must have been afraid of him getting too close to Madam Magistrate and ruining her plans... What a sinister woman! Fortunately, that guest was a skilled fighter, and him managed to escape unharmed.

She must have been afraid of her getting too close to Madam Magistrate and ruining her plans... What a sinister woman! Fortunately, that guest was a skilled fighter, and her managed to escape unharmed.
I hope you don't mind my frankness. Just giving some advice, 'cause you look pretty innocent and gullible... Not from Jinzhou judging by your outfit, right?
Oh shoot, I completely forgot about something I need to do. Sorry, gotta run...
Uhh... How did she disappear like that? Wait, are you that legendary Rover who saved Jinzhou?!
Ahem... what can I do for you?
Well, you've come to the right person! I'm here to compile a new travel guide for Hongzhen!
Next to a ring and hanging eaves... Oh! I know where that is. You'll need to stand on the tallest building in Hongzhen to see what you're looking for.
It's on the northeast side of the town, can't miss it. You'll see it once you get there.
Say, that person earlier... that was Lady Changli, right?! I saw you talking to her!
I can't help but feel envious. I wish I could speak to her like you did, but she refuses to do interviews with the Pioneer Association. Plus, I doubt we have anything in common to talk about anyway.
Of course! Everyone in Jinzhou knows about Lady Changli, even though she rarely appears in public.

As Master Xuanmiao's disciple, she excels in the arts of politics and diplomacy. Her travels have taken her across the four seas, and as Secretary-General, she has commanded respect from all who cross her path!
Yeah! And she came all the way to Jinzhou to help out Magistrate Jinhsi for the sake of peace in Huanglong. She's been working tirelessly behind the scenes since then, fully dedicated to her task...
How could anyone not revere such a selfless act?
*sigh* I could've sworn I just saw her. Where did she go? I wish I could take one more look...
Ahaha...
Hmm. Why are the people here so divided about Changli?
Hmm... You humans make everything so complicated.
Well, at least now we know what she wanted to say.
Now that’s much easier to understand. Why did she have to make it a whole riddle? *yawn*... I’m getting sleepy again.
Rover?
Nice to see you again. How are you liking Hongzhen so far?

The crisis at Mt. Firmament has been resolved, and the waterway between Jinzhou and Hongzhen is open once again. As a result, there has been an increase in visitors from Jinzhou, making the town more lively than before.
With the chaos subsiding, our town and city are now reconnected, allowing residents to live and work in peace.
We owe you a debt of gratitude, Rover, for your efforts in clearing the remaining effects of Temporal Disruptions in Mt. Firmament over the past few days.
*chuckle* Of course.
We're all indebted to you, Hongzhen and its people alike. If there's anything you need, don't hesitate to ask.
I couldn't help but notice you've been asking around. Is there something you need assistance with?
Xinyi and Changli have a mutual trust as acquaintances. It should be fine to ask Xinyi instead...
Xinyi and Changli have a mutual trust as acquaintances. It should be fine to ask Xinyi instead...
You tell Xinyi about your encounter with Changli and what the passersby said about her.
Hmm... I see. That sounds like something Changli would do.
Even though we're not that close, I know a bit about her personality. She wouldn't just hand over something that symbolizes her identity to anyone, especially when...
I think it would be better for her to tell you personally.
The Magistrate's Counselor is shrouded in mystery, and her motives are often hard to decipher...
When she wants something done, it's never as straightforward as it seems, and few can grasp the true meaning behind her plans.
The rumors and controversies surrounding her never cease, but she seems unfazed.
However... I believe one has to get involved personally to truly understand Changli's intentions, regardless of public opinion.
About the riddle... it seems you have already figured it out by yourself.
But remember, it's not just about the answer, but also what she wants you to understand.
*chuckle* Then... If you'll excuse me.
If there's anything else you need here in Hongzhen, please do not hesitate to let me know.
A ring, she wrote... Should be this ring-shaped ancient structure, I guess?
A ring, she wrote... Should be this ring-shaped ancient structure, I guess?
Wow, it’s really huge now that we look at it.
Next, hanging eaves... If we look from here... Is it that pavilion?
Next, hanging eaves... If we look from here... Is it that pavilion?
It does look quiet. Should be a nice place for meetings... *yawn* Ugh, getting 'eepy again…
That must be the place, then.
That must be the place, then.
I’ll get going.
I’ll get going.
Apologies for my delay.
Thank you for accepting my invitation.
You looked adorable, focusing on the Weiqi board. I didn't want to interrupt you.
Thank you for accepting my invitation.
Oh? And what makes you think so?
Those tokens from Jinhsi... It was your idea, was it not?
Those tokens from Jinhsi... It was your idea, was it not?
*chuckle*...So you've guessed it.
Sorry, 漂泊者. Jinzhou faced multiple threats back then, and we had to be cautious. We did not intend to inconvenience you. I regret our lack of hospitality.
Still, I owe you an apology in person.
This time... *chuckle* I just wanted to see you. The brilliant mind that always understood my unspoken words.
...I am very grateful you decided to come.
Apologies for giving you that impression, Rover. That’s not how we treat our savior.
Apologies for giving you that impression, Rover. That’s not how we treat our savior.
I merely have a few questions, and I was wondering if you may have the answers.
Does this game of Weiqi look familiar to you, Rover?
...I see.
...Apologies. I heard about your memory loss. Please pardon me.
There is a local tale about the Secret of Immortality being hidden on Mt. Firmament. Have you heard about it?
Yes. I have a slightly different version of this tale to share.
Centuries ago, a Taoist cultivator met an enigmatic visitor on Mt. Firmament. Despite their age difference, they soon became friends and often played Weiqi together.

One day, a woodcutter stumbled upon them, having lost his way home. Their game mesmerized him so much that he didn't notice the red tie on his basket rotting away… Panicked, he bumped into the Weiqi board.

Despite the interruption, the visitor remained unfazed. They offered the woodcutter some tea, then guided him down the mountain, shielding him from dangerous Temporal Disruptions. After that, the visitor disappeared.
Many years later, the Taoist cultivator became a legendary hermit guru. Upon returning to Mt. Firmament in his final years, he reunited with that elusive visitor.
The two resumed their unfinished game. People believe the visitor shared their Secret of Immortality through cleverly-placed Weiqi pieces, as a final parting gift.
Yes... and no. This game is missing the final twenty moves. It is unfinished.
That was a bit different from what you heard before, I guess? The story changed over time, infused with fantasy in each retelling.
But that's how old tales go, slowly losing their truth as they're passed down.
Precisely.
The legend may be shrouded in myth, but the game of Weiqi was real. Embedded within its records lies a cryptic message: This game has the power to bring order to chaotic time flow.

From what I know, only the Sentinel in its prime has the power to manipulate time through its possession of a complete Temporal Mandate. For us mere mortals, controlling time is indeed similar to gaining immortality.
As the records state, it only reveals itself when Mt. Firmament emerges. But how it ties to the Temporal Mandate remains an enigma... at least for now.
Yes. We may find a way to heal them.
If that is the case, we’ll be able to heal the Sentinel's wounds.
But... our chances are looking slim. That game record could just hold my teacher's memories, not any real value.
So I am presenting this as merely a personal request.
I am planning to go find that record. Could you please join me?
Thank you for lending me a hand. I promise it will be worth your while.
As we have been to Mt. Firmament before, I imagined it would pique your interest, as the tale concerns our Sentinel.
And, moreover... You are special to me, and… to Mt. Firmament. I hope I have provided enough reasons to clear your doubts.
I asked you about the unfinished Weiqi game, because I believe it may have something to do with your past.
Yes… After all, it takes two to play Weiqi, right?
If my speculation is correct… That game of Weiqi may hold clues to your lost memories.
In addition… I promise to do anything you ask of me after we return with the record. How does that sound?
Splendid.
Very well. Let's meet on the gallery road outside Hongzhen.
I still have some preparations to do. Please go ahead, I'll join you later.
Rover, you're here.
Well... As the Wayfinder, I do know a couple shortcuts.
The notes only provided a vague idea of where the game record is. I've determined the most likely location on my last visit.
We’ll be heading there. See if we can find anything new.
After dealing with those Artificers, I ruled out the other locations on my way to join you.
But one can only do so much alone. This is why I need your help.
How reliable.
Then let's get going.
Changli? What is it?
Changli? What is it?
Nothing, 漂泊者. I just thought... the snow is beautiful today.
You seem curious about that ancient structure.
It looks familiar... Like the abandoned Court of Savantae facility I saw, but bigger in scale.
It looks familiar... Like the abandoned Court of Savantae facility I saw, but bigger in scale.
I heard it first appeared along with our Sentinel. Later, the Court of Savantae based their Chronosorters on its design.
Every winter, my hometown buzzed as people left their mark in the fresh snow, hoping for dreams to come true when it melted.
Did you try it too, Changli?
Did you try it too, Changli?
No, I only watched from afar... My Forte always melted the snow faster than I liked.
We can see the whole of Hongzhen from here.
I never noticed how beautiful it looked during my previous visits.
It's the same place as always. I suppose it's my state of mind that has changed.
I don't know. Maybe it's because... Your presence makes me feel at ease.
Wait... I smell Tacet Discords in that cave!
No... There's more... Tacet Discords, humans, and...
Smells like a whole bunch of messed up frequencies... It's so... familiar...
C’mon, after all we've been through, you still don't trust my sniffer? Be grateful, I'm giving you a warning!
Rover? Did something happen?
It's in the same direction we’re going. Could it be...
Signs of climbing... Someone may have been here before us.
Get away... from me! Ugh... I can't hold up much longer...
Help, help! Oh, thank goodness...
Please stand back. We'll take it from here.
I-I can fight! Let me help!
T-Thanks for your help...
I... I'm okay. Wait, you... Are you THE Rover...?
You're that hero who fought against the Threnodian, and you also resolved the time crisis here with Madam Magistrate. Everyone's been talking about you...
And Lady Changli... I-I never thought I'd have the chance to see you in person...
...Without your help, I would've been a goner for sure...
I can't die here. Not when I've got someone waiting for me...
I've finally, finally found it... After all this time... Ugh...

While we've solved the crisis in Mt. Firmament for the time being... Public access to the mountain is still restricted. Before entering the mountain, any explorer must submit a request and can only do so while accompanied by the Midnight Rangers.
Sir, could you please share your reasons for traveling here alone?
I, I heard about Mt. Firmament's legend... So I came to find its secret...
I've only been in the mountain for half a day, everything was going smoothly before those monsters pounced on me on my way back... *cough*...
I must get back... Fuling... She's still waiting for me...
It seems he is still hiding something from us.
Some of those injuries are older than half a day
He needs to go back to Hongzhen for proper medical attention... Time is against us.
Agreed.
The appearance of Tacet Discords is indeed unusual… We can ask him later when he's recovered a bit more.
Indeed. Tacet Discords appearing in such numbers on Mt. Firmament, of all places… This is unusual, to say the least.
We can continue our conversation later, after getting him to safety.
On that note, we still don't know his identity... Judging from this uniform, he might be affiliated with the Pioneer Association.
Then perhaps that someone is in Hongzhen. Could be his friend or an acquaintance.
Good point, Rover. Let's head back.
You take the adventurer in coma and return to Hongzhen with Changli
Isn't that Wuli? What happened to him?
Not really... He showed up in town and started asking weird questions to all the older folks. They've been avoiding him ever since.
The Secret of Immortality... I've found it...
*sigh* He really went up the mountain, didn't he? Oh my... Quick, get him to a doctor!
No... I'm fine... Go find Fuling...
Sir, do you know where his companions might be?
I'm not sure. There are lots of other people in town who are dressed just like him. Why don't you try asking them?
His companions? Hmm... Sorry, I just joined the Association not long ago. I don't really know them.
His gears though, these are last year's designs... Perhaps you should go ask Youning? She's been a member for quite some time. She might know him.
Youning's just up ahead.
Woah...! G-Greetings, Lady Changli!
H-How may I help you today, Lady Changli? Oh and, hello 漂泊者! The person on your back... Is he okay?
We found him on Mt. Firmament. Do you know where his companions might be?
Isn't this Wuli? What happened to him?
He's one of the Pioneer Association's explorers, but we don't see him around Jinzhou too often.
I remember he went on sabbatical months ago, and he left with Fuling...
Yes, Fuling, his girlfriend. I think they're visiting Hongzhen together. They're staying at the inn over there.
Oh, Fuling asked us about his whereabouts not long ago. She seemed quite worried.
Speaking of... Is he really okay? Perhaps we should get him to a hospital first...
No, I'm not going... Fuling... She's waiting for me...
Don't worry. We'll help you find Fuling.
W-Wuli! I.. *cough*...
Breathe. Take it easy.
*cough*... Thank you. I'm okay now. Who are you? ... And Wuli, is he...
Yes, I am... Can you please tell me what happened?
Fuling...!
Wuli... You're hurt?! I've been looking for you... You didn't pick up my calls...
Great news, Fuling! ...I found it! Finally!
I've found a way to slow down your illness. No more pain, my love... We can finally be together, forever!
You mean... that legend? It's real?
Fuling... Are you... Are you not happy?
No... I am... I'm so glad to hear it.
Haha... Yes...
...Wuli!
You carry an exhausted and unconscious Wuli to a doctor to treat his injuries.
Thank you, 漂泊者, Lady Changli. You saved his life...
May I please ask... what on earth happened? I've never seen Wuli like that...
So... He said he only spent half a day in the mountains?
Was that not the case?
No... I've been... I've been waiting for almost a week.

It's not unusual for Wuli to be out of touch for a few days when he goes on long trips. This time, however, seemed longer than usual. If it weren't for you two showing up, I would have asked the Midnight Rangers to help me search for him in the mountains.
Wuli, he... He did it for me.
I used to work as a landscape painter. Wuli and I met through work, and we traveled to many places together.

A few months ago, I got really sick. It affected my ability to walk, which got worse over time. We couldn't go on our adventures like we used to. Wuli stopped taking on work and traveled all over the world to find a cure for me.
Despite his efforts, we couldn't find any cures... Until two weeks ago, when he brought me to Hongzhen. Said he had a surprise for me.
I thought it was just going to be a relaxing trip, but he disappeared for seven days. Now he's back, rambling about having found a way to stop my condition from progressing...
Mt. Firmament's Secret of Immortality, I presume?
Yes... Wuli told me that he's researched and found an untouched paradise on Mt. Firmament. A place where time stands still. He said if I lived there, my condition would never worsen...
...It cannot fully cure me, but at least we can spend eternity together.
At first, I thought it was just a myth... But then you brought up how he only spent half a day in the mountains...
Those were my thoughts as well, but Wuli seemed very certain.
Mt. Firmament used to have Temporal Disruptions caused by its tumultuous history. However, thanks to Magistrate Jinhsi and Rover, these disruptions have been dealt with. Or so we had hoped.
So there are still unaddressed Temporal Disruptions in the mountains. And unfortunately, Wuli has stumbled upon one, mistaking it for the legendary cure he was searching for.
But little did he know, it would only put him in more danger.
I see...
...So that's why there were rumors of Rangers being here to take care of the leftover Tacet Discords, and block off access to the mountain...
Then... if this Temporal Disruption you speak of is truly so dangerous...
漂泊者, Lady Changli, please help us get rid of it. For the sake of everyone here.
He truly thinks it's the only way to save you. He's willing to take a slim chance, just for you.
Freezing my own time... I don't think I should do that. It's not my best option. I appreciate your concerns, but I'll be fine.
Dreams always come to an end. Eventually we have to wake up, and keep moving forward.
*cough* I... I'm okay. I haven't talked this much in a long time.
...I'm just a little tired. I'll be fine after some rest.
Once Wuli wakes up, I'll explain everything to him.
If you have any other ideas, just tell him.
But if you keep it all to yourself... No one, even those closest to you, will know how you really feel.
...Yes. I understand.
漂泊者, things are taking a turn. We should probably tell Lady Xinyi first.
What brings you here at this time of the day?
You explain the events that has transpired.
I see. Strange appearances of Tacet Discords in the mountains, and undiscovered Temporal Disruptions...
There are several questionable details according to 漂泊者's description.
What do you make of Fuling's words from earlier, Rover?

He claimed to have spent only half a day in the mountains, but it's been seven days since he returned to Hongzhen... That does sound like some kind of Temporal Disruption, one that wasn't strong enough to affect Hongzhen.
After Jinhsi's battle with the Sentinel, she ordered Midnight Rangers to patrol Hongzhen and inspect Mt. Firmament for any lingering Temporal Disruptions before reopening it to the public.
漂泊者, you've been exploring the mountains lately, so I'm sure you have a good grasp on Mt. Firmament. But if there are any hidden disruptions we missed...
Precisely. Yet... Why did it reappear at this point?
Fuling's legend differs from the situation at Mt. Firmament we're familiar with. In that tale, mortals were spared the cost of losing years from their lives.
He was utterly convinced of his discovery, and he somehow managed to run into Temporal Disruptions in half a day’s time. Also… when I questioned him, he evaded my inquiries.
Lies that are most challenging to detect aren't usually outright falsehoods, rather they hide parts of the truth.
The explorer wanted to save his friend indeed, but he was also hiding something.
...I've become rather curious about the truth behind this Temporal Disruption.
Did you notice something, 漂泊者?
For someone with a terminal illness, they should hold onto any chance of survival—no matter how slim... Is that what you think?
Maybe she's come to terms with her destiny, or maybe... she never planned on continuing to live like that forever.
Changli...
...Well, please pardon my baseless speculations.
I knew you'd notice too.
The frequency disturbance here is weak. It's similar to past Temporal Disruptions at Mt. Firmament, but not exactly the same.
Master Xuanmiao's records show that this is where the game record last appeared. This is also where we found that explorer.
... As Changli mentioned, this anomaly may indeed have something to do with that legendary game record.
Exactly... If this were to be the case, then we are not the only ones searching for its whereabouts.
The explorer did not tell us about his source of information.
But his knowledge of Mt. Firmament far exceeds that of a first-time visitor.
You mean...
Got it. The Midnight Rangers will block all entrances to the mountain for now. And Changli, you still have the power to send in garrison troops as needed.
We left Mt. Firmament in a hurry. I need to go back up the mountain and investigate further... I have some theories that could use confirmation.
We're still unsure about the exact location and range of the Temporal Disruption. Regardless, its reappearance is a pressing issue that needs our attention.
It may get dangerous.
Well then... Thank you, 漂泊者.
Thank you again for your help. You were supposed to be here for a relaxing time... but it seems another crisis has popped up.
Do take extra caution.
Now it has become quite clear what the two were thinking.
I had my speculation.

Fuling has come to terms with her impending death. She doesn't buy into the legends of immortality. Instead, she simply wants to make the most of the time she has left and fulfill her and Wuli's dreams together.
If Wuli wants to reach that so-called paradise, he'll be trapped inside forever. It also means he'll have to give up his entire future as an explorer.
That is not what she wants for him.
Her ultimate desire is for her lover to embrace her inevitable passing, and to realize the joint aspirations they hold in her place.
She hasn't given up, but rather clings to hope for their future, even if she won't be there to see it unfold.
Hmm...? Why the sudden question?
