Is that how you see me? Hmm... Perhaps for some, death is just a destination. There are more significant things to focus on.
I'm just making an educated guess from what we've collected. And honestly, Fuling isn't exactly good at keeping things to herself.
Let's stay focused on the issue. While the diary is cryptic, it still exposes the true intentions of whoever misled Wuli.
It's no coincidence. All the clues point to a correlation between the Temporal Disruption and the legends of the Weiqi game. Or maybe... someone's trying to make us connect the dots.
Yes. Information on the actual powers of Jué... This isn't the kind of information an ordinary explorer can obtain.
I guess our old friends have still not given up.
They went to great lengths just to lead us here. It would be rather rude of us to not respond in some way.
According to the information in my master's notes, and Wuli's map...
...The place we're looking for should be just ahead.
Is that...
The chaotic Temporal Disruptions are even clearer to see.
The chaotic Temporal Disruptions are even clearer to see.
Traces of excavation on the ground... Looks like someone was trying to dig a hole with their bare hands. Could it be Wuli?
Traces of excavation on the ground... Looks like someone was trying to dig a hole with their bare hands. Could it be Wuli?
This is... a Weiqi board.
The abnormal time flow here is most likely caused by the Chronosorters. Perhaps there is a way to fix it.
Marvelous play, truly remarkable. Occupying both solid territory and influence. An extraordinary move.
Never have I imagined I'd experience such a great game of Weiqi on Mt. Firmament. You may look young, my friend, but there's so much more to you than meets the eye.
Please, no need to be so modest. I can tell the difference between our skill levels.
...This is my master's voice. The voice of the other person seems deliberately erased.
Who do you think the other person looks like?
Changli seems to be in deep thought and does not answer.
Changli seems to be in deep thought and does not answer.
It has been decades since we last met, but you, my friend, still look the same.
Turns out I had already met you all those years ago, my life saver… and you're older than me. I should have been more respectful back then.
So you remember our promise. I am overjoyed...
A new city is about to be established. Having accomplished so much, why do you choose to retire now?
...I may have spoken out of turn. If you're not in a rush to depart Jinzhou, how about another round of Weiqi with me?
*cough*... Well played. Even after twenty years, I still have no chance of winning against you.
Haha... I barely noticed how so much time has passed.
Every move in Weiqi is fluid and unpredictable. Even if we start with the same opening, the outcome can never be predetermined... We see this in our game, and it's true for all the lives out there.
My clan are a group of hermits. We view the world as a game of strategy, manipulating the ebb and flow behind the scenes...
But you, my friend, chose to enter the game yourself. It's a dangerous path with no end in sight. I want to help, but my time is running out. I won't be there when you finally succeed...
Please don't feel sad for me. If I die, it would be an honor to rest at the Sentinel's feet.
When the time comes... the one who shall finish this game of Weiqi with you will not be me, but rather my apprentice.
Do my plans seem too risky to you?
No need for concern. With her intelligence and quick thinking, she'll surely be able to solve this puzzle.
The result of this game will decide the fate of Jinzhou, and even the entire world.
The road ahead is long and treacherous... Our final game, let's make it...
You've come this far and followed us here, yet you hesitate to reveal yourselves. Guess I'll have to take the lead and extend an invitation.
...Don't assume you'll always be in control, Changli.
Our friendly chat is over. It's time to say goodbye.
The Sonoro Sphere is open. Go!
Sorry, but you're not getting past me.
Jué's formidable time-bending abilities, at their peak... All trapped within this Sonoro Sphere, as I'm sure you are well aware.
Do you really want to chase after this legend when you don't even know if it's real?
So what? Wouldn't it be a sight to behold as this Sonoro Sphere consumes everything in its path, while the Temporal Disruptions bring death?
Anyway... 漂泊者, thank you for letting us into this Sonoro Sphere.
You are indeed very special, as the Excellency foretold.
Still not giving up yet, Changli?
We know more than just that unfinished game, we are well aware of the price you have paid... You're dangling at the end of your rope.
Your unwitting trail has led us straight to our target.
Oh? Is that so?
It's so beautiful...
Wuli, this is the miracle we've been waiting to see! It's hope reborn after destruction...
Fuling...
It's over.
Did you find what you were looking for?
Thank you for your help. The Midnight Rangers have successfully apprehended all remaining Fractsidus members in the mountains, and the effects of the Temporal Disruption have now vanished.
I lost all contact with you during this whole time. Did you run into any trouble?
Temporal Disruption hidden inside a Sonoro Sphere... It makes sense now why it stayed hidden for so long.
I never thought the solution would be to burn down the entire Sonoro Sphere from the inside...
You went too far back there, Changli.
I know my limits.
Rover, Lady Changli...
Wuli is fine now, thanks to his doctor's help. As for me... Well, at least I can still walk a bit.
After all, it's been almost five days...
I never properly thanked you for bringing me back to Hongzhen. I heard about the attack by the Fractsidus in the mountains. I... I'm so sorry...
*chuckle* No need for that. I understand.
The Fractsidus had their eyes on the same thing as we did. They've been planning an ambush on us for a long time. Why would we blame it on you?
We will never forget how you saved us. You gave us the opportunity to witness such a breathtaking sight. Thanks to your help, this journey holds no regrets for me.
As for the truth behind the so-called Secret of Immortality... Fuling has told me everything.
I had a gut feeling it would turn out to be a disappointment, but I couldn't give up. And in the end, I lost sight of why I even started this journey...
...But this isn't the first time this has happened. Let's just call it another adventure coming to an end.
I've talked about it with Fuling. From now on, I'll take her on more trips to see more new places together.
Until...
Until the day... when I can no longer hold a pen. I've already talked to the folks at the publishing house, and they're happy to let me continue painting for them.
My eventual departure may be unavoidable, but I want to give it my all until the very end.
I know you have already looked past death, but remember... There are people who care about you. They want you to live on and be happy.
I know you have already looked past death, but remember... There are people who care about you. They want you to live on and be happy.
Yes, I understand. Sometimes, I wish...
...we could stay together a little longer, if only for a while...
Of course, Fuling, I... We've always been...
It's not time to be sad yet, is it?
I've compiled a list of renowned doctors in Huanglong. They're highly skilled and may offer assistance for your medical condition, which is challenging but not impossible to cure.
Lady Changli, I truly can't thank you enough...
No need for thanks.
Hmm... If you're feeling generous and want to repay me, I hope to see Fuling's work in the next issue of Artists of Huanglong.
Everyone's been missing seeing their favorite landscape artist's work lately.
Are you surprised? Well, now I'm curious. What kind of a person do you see me as?
Now that the situation has been resolved, you should return to Hongzhen. You deserve some good rest.
After going through so much, you must be exhausted, 漂泊者.
Me? Well, I think Lady Xinyi could use the extra help with dealing with the aftermath.
Well, It wouldn't hurt to have a little more faith in me, 漂泊者.
Splendid.
It's getting late. Maybe we should wait until we get back to discuss anything else.
Two days have passed since Changli told me that she and Xinyi would handle the aftermath. I wonder how she's doing...
Two days have passed since Changli told me that she and Xinyi would handle the aftermath. I wonder how she's doing...
Are you worried? Let's just go ask her then.
Might as well. Changli can be difficult to find. Let's go ask Xinyi first.
Might as well. Changli can be difficult to find. Let's go ask Xinyi first.
漂泊者, greetings.
We're almost done dealing with the aftermath of the previous incident. We're currently questioning the remaining Fractsidus members we caught at Mt. Firmament.

They wanted to get their hands on the Temporal Program from the legend of the Weiqi game, with the intention of unleashing chaos in Mt. Firmament once again. But thanks to you and Changli, their plans were foiled.
Changli recounted to us that a Fractsidus Overseer had entered the Sonoro Sphere and was injured by her fire. They were lucky to escape, but have not been seen since.
I've put together a thorough report for City Hall. We will strengthen our defenses to make sure this doesn't happen again.
We parted two days ago on the coast, and then she returned to Jinzhou.
Perhaps she's just taking some time to rest and recover... It must have taken a lot out of her to summon that much fire at once.
Changli knew you’d be worried, and she wanted me to relay this message to you...
Meet her at the pavilion on Mt. Firmament. She'll be waiting for you there.
She also said... No more riddles this time.
How are you feeling, 漂泊者? Well-rested, I hope.
Aww. Can't you see I'm perfectly fine, sitting right in front of you?
Don't worry, 漂泊者. We are only having a casual conversation today. Nothing taxing.
Besides, you only agreed to join me here for more questions, right?
Oh, is that so? I'm curious then.
Sure, ask away. I'm happy to answer them to the best of my ability.
It all started a century ago, when my mentor, Master Xuanmiao, had a brief encounter with a certain peculiar visitor.

During a TD Outbreak, my master was rescued by a peculiar individual. He exuded a unique energy and was always elusive. My master dug through ancient texts and unearthed He presence in long-forgotten history.

During a TD Outbreak, my master was rescued by a peculiar individual. She exuded a unique energy and was always elusive. My master dug through ancient texts and unearthed She presence in long-forgotten history.
After searching for several years, he finally met that person on Mt. Firmament again. They played a game of Weiqi together, and that was how the legendary game record came into being.
At first, I thought my master meant the game record held actual information about the time crisis. But it was just a clue. The real key was finding you, the person behind it all.
And lastly, the Secret of Immortality... It's most likely just the woodcutter's own spin on the tale.

My master and the mysterious visitor had set a trap with the Sonoro Sphere, using the Weiqi game as a guise. They hid it with the Court of Savantae's Chronosorters, and it would only activate once the time flow on Mt. Firmament was restored to its normal state.

Despite the Sentinel and Mt. Firmament being saved, the Fractsidus would not go down without a fight. They were convinced that the Temporal Mandate was hidden within the game of Weiqi, but little did they know, they had already fallen into a trap.
Pure coincidence or the calculated workings of the Fractsidus, the explorer stumbled upon the Weiqi board, setting off its defense mechanisms.
The Sentinel was already damaged when it arrived here. My master had foreseen the disasters that would befall Mt. Firmament, so he created this mechanism as a precautionary measure.
The Sonoro Sphere would devour all who attempted to enter, unless they knew the solution to that puzzle.
Precisely.
The only way to escape was by burning the Sonoro Sphere without hurting anyone inside. It required masterful control of Forte. Thinking back, it was probably his ultimate test for me.
That was his first goal with this Sonoro Sphere.
Before leaving, Master entrusted me with a mission: To find that individual... The one who played Weiqi with him. The one who left behind that game record.
After my master's passing, he would be the only one who could control the Sonoro Sphere. By now, you should know who he is.
After my master's passing, she would be the only one who could control the Sonoro Sphere. By now, you should know who she is.
Yes.
That's why you needed me as your Wayfinder.
My master often mentioned you before his passing.
And from the moment you arrived in Jinzhou, I had my suspicions about your true identity. Our journey to Mt. Firmament solidified my beliefs.
And finally, the Weiqi board in that Sonoro Sphere sealed the truth for me.
Indeed... Those memories... They were all real.
Yes... That's all in the past, just a little homeless girl with no name.
I never thought we could make new memories in the Sonoro Sphere, where only the past repeats itself.
A moment of companionship and protection meant everything to me.
I can sense your unspoken question. Did I sacrifice my life when I burned down the Sonoro Sphere, like when I was a child?
What I told you there was true. But I've grown and gained control over my powers. Using my Forte now won't harm me in any way. Of that you can rest assured.
Also... If you really are the legendary person who changed the course of history, then you are perhaps the closest to immortality aside from our Sentinel.
We mortals come and go, our lives are full of meetings and goodbyes. Our time on this earth is fleeting compared to yours. So don't let it bother you.
I see. Perhaps this is why... It's so hard to leave this beautiful world behind.
Then... Would you be willing to finish that game of Weiqi with me instead?
A compass buried in the ground. It resembles those commonly used by the Pioneer Association.
A compass buried in the ground. It resembles those commonly used by the Pioneer Association.
Multiple footprints with varying levels of depth. They suggest a person was hastily running away from something.
Multiple footprints with varying levels of depth. They suggest a person was hastily running away from something.
Over here! Been waiting for ya!
I thought Yangyang said you had a super cool lil' buddy to show us. Where is it?
Uh, I don't know...
Uh, I don't know...
Did it just... pop out of your Tacet Mark...?
Mmm... smells good!
So... Is this how it first showed up when you guys were in the Norfall Barrens?
Yes, back then, we...
As I fought off those Tacet Discords, a burst of energy erupted from that statue...
Two forces clashed and collided, and later one of them emerged victorious, vanquishing the other in a violent clash.
General Jiyan and Rover later told me it was this little thing coming out of Rover's body... It was blocking, or even “consuming” the overflow of Threnodian power.
It reminded me of how Rover once absorbed frequency energy with his body in a similar fashion... So we took his to the Academy for another check-up with Baizhi.
It reminded me of how Rover once absorbed frequency energy with her body in a similar fashion... So we took her to the Academy for another check-up with Baizhi.
Apparently...this little one is what we had detected before. It’s the speculated Space or Organism hidden inside your body. Now we finally know.
It shares similar frequencies with Tacet Discords' Reverberations. It resembles an Echo processed by the Data Bank, stored inside your body instead of a Terminal.
In other words, it's your own Echo, captured or absorbed at some point. Without you, it can't manifest.
That's why Baizhi couldn't confirm just how you absorbed that Echo back then. Was it you? Was it the little one? Or maybe... The two of you together?
And Baizhi discovered more after analyzing your spectrums.
She found a new power source within you, similar to the Crownless but even stronger. This power comes from the Tacet Discord you defeated in Norfall Barrens.

So, the excess energy this little thing had consumed somehow ended up in your body, available at your disposal... In other words, there's a deeper connection between the two of you... Or, according to Baizhi, it’s a Convergent Codependancy.
Uh, to put it simply... You are connected. While you are two separate individuals, your energies and vitals can affect each other, for better or for worse. You may even feel each other's emotions.
The bond between you and this creature is symbiotic. As it strengthens, so do you. However, if one is harmed, the other suffers.
Fortunately, since it can't ever leave your side, it's not an easy target for attackers. And if they do strike, it can seek shelter inside your body for safety.
Okay, now that's... pretty much it. Baizhi was going to explain it to you herself, but she has to go check on a newly appeared Sonoro Sphere in Zhaozhou...
Wait, wait! This is too much information for me to process! Let me get this straight. So... It helped Rover fight off the Threnodian?
Seriously? This teeny tiny thing could do that? Hmm... Seems unlikely...
Hmph! Don't look down on me.
You'll regret it when you learn what I'm capable of!
That poker-faced researcher was absolutely shocked when she examined me! Said I'm not just any Echo, I'm a super duper cool one. Rarest of them all! Heh heh!
Yeah, no way Baizhi talks like that. She's more of a data dump kind of person. Super duper cool? Nah, too extra for her.
Hmm, seems like you're trying to boost your ego a bit.
Oh, actually... While those aren't Baizhi's exact words, that is what she meant.
She mentioned highly intelligent Echoes that can act on their own in other countries. Said they are involved in every aspect of human life, with unique abilities beyond our imagination.
Those Echoes are rare though. Neither I nor Baizhi, an Ecoacoustics expert, have ever seen one in person. But this little thing here… It could be one of those foreign Echoes.
Yeah, makes sense! Now we just gotta figure out where it came from. Who knows, we may find other cool Echoes in that place!
Well, both General Jiyan and Baizhi have confirmed it. No way they're lying.
I'll admit, the thought of someone else having an Echo inside them sounds pretty crazy to me. But with you, anything's possible.
You can absorb Reverberations with just your hands, like the legend says. So maybe one day you just stumbled upon this little thing and soaked it up like a sponge. Sounds feasible, I guess?
Sooo...
Do you know where exactly he absorbed you?
Do you know where exactly she absorbed you?
Huh? How am I supposed to know... Why don't you just ask him?
Huh? How am I supposed to know... Why don't you just ask her?
Yeah. It happened before he lost all memories, soo.... we have to ask you.
Yeah. It happened before she lost all memories, soo.... we have to ask you.
Tsk tsk... Don't take that tone with me.
But... even if Echoes can have memories, they probably wouldn’t remember things earlier than their first manifestation. I wonder if that's the case with this little one, too?
Aha, finally someone with common sense.
That green-haired serious guy asked me a similar question. Sorry to disappoint, but I really don't remember anything before I showed up.
Hmm... Maybe... maybe I was just sleeping inside him this whole time, so of course I don't remember!
Hmm... Maybe... maybe I was just sleeping inside her this whole time, so of course I don't remember!
Sleeping? Seriously? It's been so long! All those happenings, all that fighting, and you didn't hear anything? Well that's... Your sleeping quality is really something.
Oh, so you've got privacy to be respected.
Don't worry! Your body's sound insulation is amazing. Dive into it and everything goes quiet.
The only problem is, I never know when I'll wake up again. And when I do wake up, I get tired, hungry fast, so I have to crawl back in for more rest.
Hmm... I know! It's all because I'm not eating enough!
That's why you kept disappearing... You went back to sleep from lack of energy. Makes sense. Regular Echoes need to be powered by the Terminal too.
Hmm, I thought you'd be really different from the usual ones we see. Turns out you share a lot in common.
So you probably don't know your denomination, or a nick name? No wonder everyone's been calling you the little one...
Denomination? What's that?
The universally agreed terms for special Echoes, like names for humans. They are named based on their characteristics, abilities, and places of origin.
My denomination... It's... It's... I don't know. Do I not have a name at all?
No way! Nooo way! That's not fair! If all the special Echos have names, how can I not have one?
I don't wanna be called the little one all the time. It doesn't sound cool at all!
How about this: you help me come up with a name, and I will let you have some of the food...
There's nothing left...
Erm... Next time! Next time I'll definitely save some for you! Just... give me a name! Please!
A name? Now?
Yes, I want it now! Look, your name's Chixia, your name's Yangyang, and you... Uhhh, your name is...
漂泊者? ...That sounds interesting. Wait, didn't you forget everything? How do you still remember...
With your old name and memories all gone, it's a good idea to go with a new one. It makes everything more convenient and represents a fresh start.
Yeah, exactly like she said! Every one of you has a name, and I want one for myself too! Really not asking much.
I just want a name that sounds a little cool, a little special and epic and super smokin'!
Names are a big deal, you know? Like, once you have one, it's stuck with you for life. Gotta make sure it's a good one!
Can't have people not scared of me when they hear it. No time for regrets here!
That's true.
Let's see... You want a cool one... What about “Echo the Invincible”? What do you say?
Nah, nuh-uh, absolutely no! That’s too straightforward. It's no better than calling me the little one!
Hey, it makes every difference in the world! “I am Echo the Invincible!” That's what a Hero Play character would say as their transformation call!
Or maybe... Since you can fly and you've got those long ears... why don’t you call yourself... “Righteous Raptor”? Or “Valor Hawk”? “Flying Fury”?
No, absolutely no. Why do they all sound so... cringy...
Why? I love it when people call me the Jinzhou Speedster. Doesn't that sound awesome?
Uh... Haha, sure, if you say so... Anyway, they all sound like anything but my name. ABSOLUTELY NO!
Aha! I knew 漂泊者 would come up with a good... Wait. Why does it sound so random?
You didn't just pick two random syllables, did you?

I mean... Yeah, it's simple, easy to remember. l can imagine myself yelling it out loud, and at least it sounds better than Chixia’s cringy titles... But you know, it doesn’t feel quite majestic enough...
So... Is it because I've been saying Absolutely no a lot...?
Hmm... Why is it suddenly so quiet? Is it not happy with the name? Why though... Can't think of anything better that's catchy, impactful, and clever all at once.
Hmm... Why is it suddenly so quiet? Is it not happy with the name? Why though... Can't think of anything better that's catchy, impactful, and clever all at once.
Uh, I meant to tease it as a joke, but I can tell it's upset now. On second thought, a name is indeed very important. Maybe I'll have to come up with a different one...
Uh, I meant to tease it as a joke, but I can tell it's upset now. On second thought, a name is indeed very important. Maybe I'll have to come up with a different one...
Abby... Abra... Abraxas?
What's wrong? What are you muttering about? Abra... what? Sounds like you're reading a spell.
...Erm, I don't know, but... I just have this feeling that... this is what my name should be. Okay, ready?
Abby! I like the sound of that. That's my name!
Of course I like it! You came up with it for me! I was just... trying to get used to it, that's all! Besides, I feel attached to this name now.
My name is Abby. You will NOT call me the little one again!
Sure, we won't. Got it.
Well, that didn't work out. I was hoping we could get some answers from the little... I mean, from Abby, but now we're back at square one.

I really thought we could figure out where Abby came from. It might not lead us to other special Echoes, but it's at least a starting point to uncover 漂泊者's past. Then we'll have something to do before asking Madam Magistrate and our Sentinel about it again.
Maybe we can start with Abby's special abilities instead?

Each special Echo has a unique ability. We can compare what Abby does with our records of other Echoes to see where they came from. Besides… It was Abby’s power that helped Rover defeat the Threnodian, I suppose?
Why do you sound so unsure? Didn't you see it all with your own eyes?
Hmm… Abby, can you show us again? I'm super curious how you did that. Who knows, we might learn something.
Well, since you asked, I'll show you how it's done! But... this place is too crowded. Let's move to that open spot over there.
Alright. Ahem! All eyes on me!
W-what's going on? I... I'll try again! Just you see!
Uh... What? Did something happen?
J-Just a little slip, that's all! I can do it! You gotta trust me!
Back then, I just stood in front of him, and that big bad Threnodian monster thing just... just... left.
Back then, I just stood in front of her, and that big bad Threnodian monster thing just... just... left.
So... you didn't really do anything?
Huh? No, I... I definitely did something!
Like I said, I was asleep, and then all of a sudden, I smelled something really yummy coming closer and closer… It was like nothing I ever smelled before!
I didn't have time to think. I just had to show up and reach out for it.
So... maybe Abby's power activates automatically under certain circumstances? Perhaps Abby can’t control it yet.
Yeah, it looks that way. You can't even hold your shape for very long yet...
Stop looking down on me! Like I said, it was just a little slip, really!
But think about it! I just stood there and did nothing and ended up beating a THRENODIAN! Imagine what I could do if I actually tried!
Hey, 漂泊者! Get behind me next time we run into anything, 'K? I'll keep you safe, promise!
You're so real for that, Abby.
You bet! I said I'm super strong. I'll protect him!
You bet! I said I'm super strong. I'll protect her!
That's very reassuring to hear. But... it seems we're stuck again. I can't think of anything else to check out.

Sigh, knew it. Nothing about 漂泊者's ever gonna be easy to figure out... Hmm. Maybe we should bring Baizhi, Mr. Xiangli Yao, and all the researchers in Jinzhou... No, in the entire Huanglong together. They'll do a nice and thorough examination on Abby, and then...
ABSOLUTELY NO!
I said NO! Told that poker-face researcher already!
I'll make it clear. I am to stay with 漂泊者.
I agree. Abby cannot leave 漂泊者's side, but we can't just trap him here for research.
I agree. Abby cannot leave 漂泊者's side, but we can't just trap her here for research.
Where did you absorb Abby, what are Abby's powers, and what exactly happened between you two... There are so many questions we can't figure out yet.
Our Sentinel Jué can look into the future. Nothing ever deviates from its predictions. It has already sort of guided you to the Norfall Barrens through Madam Magistrate's messages, right?
Now that the Threnodian crisis is over, perhaps you can consult our Magistrate and our Sentinel again. I’m sure they can offer you some more useful guidance.
Relax, relax! You have me now, remember? Meeting up with that Jinhsi person? Getting your memories back? I've got you!
Speaking of that... So this Sentinel can predict the future? That sounds cool. The name Jué sounds pretty cool too. It's almost as cool as mine!
What does it look like? Where is it? Since we're paying it a visit, this Sentinel should treat us with food, right? I wonder how the food's gonna taste...
Our Sentinel protects every one of us. Of course it's cool!
But... Why are you talking about food again. Didn't you just stuff your face? What? Is your stomach a blackhole?
I can't help it. I'm always starving…
After parting ways with Yangyang and Chixia, you travel around Jinzhou with Abby while waiting for replies from Jinhsi, trying to look for more clues about your past.
Several days later...
Help me, help me!
Thank you for saving me...
I heard that this wondrous scenery of circles have something to do with the Sentinel.
So I wanted to come up close and have a good look. Didn't see these Tacet Discords coming...
I wonder how long has it been since our ancestors planted these red maples?
Though the maples could fly backward, I cannot go back in time...

Ah, getting sleepy...
Look there. Is the sun setting?
Oh, I mistook it again. That's the entrance of the mirage... Sigh, seems like I cannot go back home for sleep.

Hello, good sir! Would you be so kind as to lend me a few minutes? Sorry to bother you, but have you ever seen a bell-like object encircled by muscial notes in the mountains?
Hello, good lady! Would you be so kind as to lend me a few minutes? Sorry to bother you, but have you ever seen a bell-like object encircled by muscial notes in the mountains?
Does it look similar to this bell adorned on my clothes?
Here, let me show you. It looks like this bell adorned on my clothes.

It is called Windchimer, which can capture and preserve a variety of sounds, converting them into usable energy. Perhaps you can think of it as a sophisticated recorder to help you better understand how it works.
There are many Windchimers scattered in the mountains. If you happen to find one, you may ring it to release the sounds within.
And with the Terminal, you can absorb the converted energy.
I've been collecting these gadgets to amass the energy, which can be used to repair this Guqin. Please, have a look at it.
What keen observation you have! If I manage to repair it, its melody will surely resonate across the mountain! No, even beyond!
Indeed, but if I manage to repair it, its melody will surely resonate across the mountain!
You got me wrong. I wasn't planning to sell it.
However broken it is, I can still feel the myriad of stories it carries, which is precisely why repairing it is worthwhile.
To make sure the Guqin is well-tuned, I need the energy from the Windchimer.
Therefore, I would appreciate it if you could collect the Winchimers and send them back to me.
And your efforts won't go unpaid. Don't worry, I know the rules. Payment for services rendered—that's what we'd call an equal exchange.
It's you! Good to meet you again. Did you collect any Windchimers recently? If so, I'd be happy to take them.
Hello again. I wonder what sounds you would bring me today.
Thank you very much! It should speed up the repairing.
It's you! Good to meet you again. Did you collect any Windchimers recently? If so, I'd be happy to take them.
Here, see this bell adorned on my clothes? This is the Windchimer.
It captures and preserves sounds before converting them into usable energy, which is the best repair material for my broken Guqin.
However broken it is, I can still feel the myriad of stories it carries.
After it's repaired, I'll share these stories with you. But until then, I'm relying on you to bring me the Windchimers.
The broken Guqin is finally repaired! Thank you for your help!
Can you feel the stories now? They are all woven into the melody it plays.
I'll transcibe them to text later. Feel free to read them if you like.
I'll stay here, playing the Guqin from now on. If you revisit, you'll always be greeted with my music.
Please take good care of yourself, my friend. Until next time.

Rover, have you got a moment?
Would you like to participate in our latest research project?
Great. Allow me to introduce our research.
Please, give us a chance. I can explain what the project is about first.
Have you been to Instructor Yhan's simulated training grounds?
Instructor Yhan would arrange simulations for his men to train against enemy holograms and improve their combat skills.
Recently, we have developed an improved projection technology to simulate even stronger enemies.
With this technology, we can provide more comprehensive training for our soldiers. This means better results for their overall needs.
We're still in the early stages of development, so there are some technical details we need to work out.
Would you be willing to test it out for us and help with our research?
I knew you were the right person to talk to. I've sent you the coordinates. Thank you for your help!
You'll know once you get there. Trust me, it's gonna be worth your time.
Temperature favorable. Humidity is...
Oh, it's you. Have you tried testing our latest technology?
With your assistance, I have faith that our technology will soon reach its full potential for our soldiers to utilize.
Remember to go check it out at some point, then! I've already signed up for you.
The look on your face tells me you've got something to ask.
You have keen eyes. As I expected.
I'm sorry, but I can't tell you now. Not yet.
That is something I can't tell you now.
You have keen eyes. As I expected.
I'm sorry, but I can't tell you now. Not yet.
By the way, I have a small favor to ask. Can you keep quiet about my involvement with the Academy?
Thank you, Rover.
Ah, you must be the Rover!
Let me introduce myself. I'm Xunjing, an editor for Wutherium Geographic.
Word travels fast at the Pioneer Association. I heard you're the hero of Jinzhou and Hongzhen. If I wasn't working for a geography magazine, I'd snatch the chance to feature you in a heartbeat...
Haha... Sorry, occupational habit. Ahem, speaking of which, I'm in the middle of a career crisis.
Well, um... our magazine's cooking up something special about Hongzhen's cultural scene.
Unfortunately, we're staring down the barrel of the deadline, and we're missing a few crucial snaps in our stack...
If I mess this up, the editor-in-chief will have my head!
I hate to admit it, but I'm not exactly a pro with a camera, despite running the photography column.
And it's too late to call in a photographer from Jinzhou now. Say, you've got a knack for photography too, don't you?
Ha! You're just as modest as they say you are.
Ha! That is reassuring.
In that case, if you have time... Could you take a few photos for me? Just three, four shots.
Thank you! You'll be doing me a great service.
Oh, right, mind if I accompany you? I could use a bit of a wander myself, you know, just in case a bolt of inspiration decides to pay me a visit!
Hongzhen is famous for its Sagaci Springs. Let's go take some photos of the hot springs.
Oh, perfect! That's the angle we want! This shot will be a winner.
Stand over here to take it!
Hmm... Can we get a panoramic view of the whole of Hongzhen from here?
Right! Let's snap an overhead shot of Hongzhen. Our special edition still needs a cover photo, and this will give readers a wonderful perspective of the town.
Because you know, to most folks, Hongzhen is still an enigmatic, secluded place.
Here we are! Let's look for the perfect spot...
Oh, look at that ancient tree! Such a picturesque sight! Come, let's capture it!
A quaint hot spring, nestled under the shade of an ancient tree... The setting is perfect!
While the world changes around us, Hongzhen's timeless traditions live on.
Here, people soak in the same springs their ancestors did, washing away their worries with the same clear waters.
It is... quite special.
Now, back to business... I spotted some peculiar rings on the mountains across the gate. Let's capture them.
Wow... quite the spectacle. I wonder what these massive rings are for. Could they be... ancient ceremonial sites of Hongzhen's forebears?
No... they might be relics from the Pre-Lament era. Hmm... Perhaps colossal colliders or planetary engines? Anyway, let's snap a picture.
Let me have a look... Hm, this turned out pretty good. Maybe we'll feature it in an Explore Hongzhen column. Already got the headline: The Mountain Town's Unsolved Riddle.
But let's include the peaks flanking the rings in our shot. That'll give a sense of how enormous and awe-inspiring they are.
See any good spots nearby?
That about does it. I can't thank you enough for these wonderful pictures!
Yes, yes, I will arrange payment as soon as I can!
But I practically dragged you all over Hongzhen for these photos, didn't I?
Just gotta deliver these photos before the deadline. Then it's onto the nitty gritty—editing, typesetting, and printing...
...Just thinking about all that work makes me depressed.
The folks in Hongzhen seem to have it easy. No tyrannical editors breathing down their necks with deadlines every day. They can just relax and enjoy that gorgeous mountain view every day.
I'm tempted to quit and move to Hongzhen myself...
Ha! Just kidding. Our editor-in-chief is scarier than a TD Outbreak. If anyone even thinks about quitting, they'd be torn apart.
You're right. Grass isn't always greener on the other side, huh? Sigh...
Okay, thanks for everything. I better get back to the office. Until next time, Rover.

Mommy, these grown-ups... I've never seen the outfits they're wearing before...
Well, Zhichun, that's because they come from outside Mt. Firmament.
What... What's it like outside Mt. Firmament? Is it scary? Grandpa said it's full of monsters...
Grandpa was talking about a long time ago. It's similar to our town now, with lots of people living there.
Oh, it's you. I remember you!
It was you and the Magistrate who saved us all!
Several researchers from Jinzhou happen to pass by. Zhichun clings to you, nervous and curious.
That's because... because a lot of grown-ups have come here lately.
Maybe not that many, but I've never seen so many strangers in my life.
I-I'm just a little scared. But they seem quite interesting.
And Mom said I can say hi to them when I'm with trustworthy grown-ups.
But... But...
Really?
Hua... Huashi Academy... That's such a difficult name to pronounce.
But I now know everyone in a white gown is very impressive, very smart!
Logistics person of Lollo Logistics... Hehe, that sounds like one of Grandma's tongue-twisters.
I know the people wearing bamboo hats deliver stuff to people now.
Midnight Rangers... I like that! Easy to remember and has a nice ring to it!
So the people in neat blue uniforms are here to protect us!
Thank you. I'm trying my best to remember them!
Mmm... after hearing you tell me all that, I'm suddenly not scared anymore...
Mom, that lady in the blue, uh, uniform is a Midnight Ranger.
And that man in the long white gown is a Hua... Hua...
Hehe, Huaxu—
Yeah, a researcher from Huaxu Academy.
Oh, oh, and I know him too! He's a logistics person of Lollo Logistics!
Hey, we got a big crowd today. This is great.
Any more than this and my eyes won't be able to keep up.
It's those brats again... I told them not to mess with the guests' stuff. What's so interesting about those walking suitcases, anyway?
This won't do, I need to go over and have a word with them.
Nothing suspicious happened last night, right?
Everything's fine...
You?
Same old, same old for the both of us.
Say, since the Midnight Rangers are here, shouldn't we retire?
Look at you with that stubborn temper of yours. I was just spewing random thoughts. Why are you taking it so seriously?
Sigh. You know, the future of Hongzhen is in young people's hands. It's time we let go.
You're... What is it again... 漂泊者! Right?
Hehe, you're the savior of Mt. Firmament, 漂泊者. The people of Hongzhen are forever in your and the Magistrate's debt.
You kids sure love to joke around. I may be old, but my eyes are still sharp.
You're the savior of Mt. Firmament, 漂泊者. The people of Hongzhen are forever in your and the Magistrate's debt.
Hehehe, there's nothing in town I don't know about, much less you and the Magistrate. You're the saviors of Mt. Firmament.
Hongzhen suffered the TD Outbreak generations back. It was Sentinel who preserved the town.
But the joy we're relishing now is all thanks to you kids.
Out with the old, in with the new. The younger generation is pushing forward. Times sure are changing.
Three new faces... Yup, got it.
The old man seems to be napping. Best not to disturb him.
The old man seems to be napping. Best not to disturb him.
The old man is watching every passerby with sharp eyes.
The old man is watching every passerby with sharp eyes.
Um, sorry...
Oh, I thought you were asking for directions...
Somewhat... We have a lot of tourists in Mt. Firmament now. They don't know their way around, and I want to help them in my spare time.
Normally, I don't have problems speaking, but when it comes to pointing the way or talking about Hongzhen, I stutter and freeze up...
I'm afraid I'd give the wrong information. I have no confidence at all.
Yes, I'm from Hongzhen, but most of my knowledge about the town comes from my family. I'm no expert.
I haven't even been to many of the places in Mt. Firmament.
I see... Thanks for the suggestion. I'll work on that.
The stone wall before you is called the Water Shadow Screen. It is naturally formed by years of continuous erosion from the waters of Sagaci Springs.
What's notable is that it inspired the ancestors of Hongzhen to invent a delightful form of entertainment—the Water Shadow Play.

All you need to do is gather some maple leaves that are scattered throughout the mountains and cut them into various shapes. Then, by using small twigs to manipulate them, the shadows of the leaves will dance in the water, bringing fascinating stories to life.
And that's why brewing and sipping tea while watching a Water Shadow Play became the favorite pastime for the folks of Mt. Firmament.
Oh, it's you.
I appreciate what you did last time. I think I got a lot better since then.
Now everyone loves to hear my Mt. Firmament stories, and quite a few want me to be their guide.
Well, I couldn't have done it without your suggestions and encouragement.
Of course, I can't be complacent. I learned much of Mt. Firmament's history from these documents.
The more I learn, though, the more I realize how little I knew before.
Hongzhen was founded very early. It was thriving when Jinzhou was just an idea.
Back then, Hongzhen rivaled Jinzhou now.
That's also the reason many scholars believe Hongzhen is not only the ancestral land of the early settlers of Jinzhou, but also the predecessor of Jinzhou itself.
As you can see, the houses that have been preserved in town share many similarities with Jinzhou architecture.
Judging from the size of Hongzhen, everyone probably knows each other. It's only a few steps to drop something off, so why would they need Lollo Logistics?
What about places farther away, like Loong's Ridge or Loong's Crest?
I don't think anyone lives there. Even if there were people, I never learned any skills to survive in outdoor snow, so it would actually be faster for the locals to deliver for themselves.
Forgive me. I was too occupied to notice you were here!
Are you receiving or sending a package? Oops, never mind. I forgot we just opened in Mt. Firmament and haven't received anything from the outside yet...
No problem. Let me know if I can help.
I must thank you.
I saw how much the local girl you helped has blossomed. You know, the one named Yinyu. She's now a famous guide in Hongzhen.
Her story doesn't have much to do with me, but I'm truly motivated by her growth.
When Lollo Logistics decided to expand into Mt. Firmament, I volunteered for the job, only to run headlong into a bunch of messy problems.
I even considered transferring back to Jinzhou or quitting altogether.
But then I saw Yinyu making us locals proud and building herself quite a name as a guide.
And it made me think, maybe I could ship Mt. Firmament's specialties to Jinzhou using Lollo Logistics and help local sellers reach new markets.
I don't know if it will work, but Mt. Firmament is a different animal. Instead of sticking to traditional logistics services, it might be better to incorporate some local flavor.
I won't be quitting anytime soon, at least.
Excuse me, but did you just get back from the mountain? Did you see Xunwei and Lili?
They are both researchers from Huaxu Academy, wearing uniforms, and are about my age.
I see, so they did go into the mountain for research.
It's okay. I'm guessing they're still in the mountain doing their research.
It's okay. I'm guessing they're still in the mountain doing their research.
I'd really like to see Xunwei and Lili's work routine. I think I can learn a lot even just by watching them work.
There was a blizzard a few days ago. They and Wei took shelter in my house. We chatted and got to know each other.
From then on, they come to see me whenever they're free and share all kinds of interesting things.
Like why Scarefrost Deer have heart-shaped fur and how Airsailers feed themselves...
I never thought I could see the world through such a perspective. Things I thought couldn't be any more ordinary turned out to be so interesting and... valuable.
Maybe I'm daydreaming here, but I thought perhaps I could become a Huaxu researcher, too, like Xunwei, Lili, and Wei.
At least I'm working toward that goal.
Lili told me that, too, but I'm determined.
I think there are very few things in this world that are easy... If they all take an effort anyway, might as well do what you like.
I plan to head to Jinzhou to study.
I must take my first step. More doing, less talking. That's what I learned from Xunwei.
But before I do that, I want to say goodbye to Yi'an.
Yi'an is my best friend. We grew up together. I don't want him to be troubled by my decision.
You're not a Hongzhen local, are you? Where are you from? Jinzhou?
I could say that?
No idea?
Well, still an outsider, no matter how you slice it.
Can you tell me what's cool or interesting out there, then?
I got a friend... who's been talking about leaving Mt. Firmament to see the outside.
But I just don't get it. What's so special out there that it's worth giving up this comfortable life for?
Uh, if I may... I've noticed that a lot of people from outside are always so busy, rushing around as if they've got something urgent to attend to, and they never seem to stop.
I... I don't want my best friend to end up like that too...
But Mt. Firmament has its appeals, too. There are lots of things I haven't done yet.
Ahem, just to be clear, I'm not lazy or anything. I still take care of my responsibilities and do what needs to be done.
But the lifestyle outside Mt. Firmament has to be different, right? I just don't see her living the same carefree life out there.
Let me put it this way... I grew up with Yuanzhi, so I know full well what she likes.

I think staying at home and sticking around Mt. Firmament is pretty great.
Well, I'm not trying to say who's right or wrong. Everybody has their own perspective.

We've been friends for years, so I can understand her...
But I've realized that I just don't know Yuanzhi as well as I used to.
You're probably right all along...
I've realized that I just don't know Yuanzhi as well as I used to.
The gap between me and her seems to grow wider and wider...
Regardless, I still respect her decision to become a researcher. After all, it's the path she's chosen for herself.
I wouldn't like it either if she were telling me how to live my life.
She's my friend, so the least I can do is wish her happiness.
Come, try my freshly dried fruit.
Come on, don't be shy. Take it!
Mrs. Qiu stuffs a handful of dried fruit in your hand.
Mrs. Qiu stuffs a handful of dried fruit in your hand.
Give it a try. How is it? Do you like it?
Grab more if you like it. I was worried it wouldn't suit your foreign taste buds!
That's easy. Let me show you.
You get some berries in advance and wash them in cold mountain spring water.
Then you cut them up, marinate them in a jar of sugar overnight, sun-dry them on a warm day, and they're guaranteed to be a treat.
It does sound simple, but my child still can't manage it for the sake of his life. Sometimes he tries to help me, but usually, he just ends up causing more trouble than it's worth.
Hehe, you are just like my child. He thought it was hard, too. Though he still tries to help me sometimes, usually he just ends up causing more trouble than it's worth.
Sigh. He's no longer in town now. I have no clue how he's doing outside Mt. Firmament...
Not your taste, huh? Well, I have no clue what you foreign kids like or dislike. Guess I'll try something else when I return home.
Here's the dried fruit you wanted, Danhua.
Where do you want them? I'll put them up for you.
No worries, Mrs. Qiu. You just take it easy and leave the heavy lifting to me.
Oh, I have something I would like to talk to you about.
The dried fruit you made is wonderful, but there just isn't enough of it. Even we Mt. Firmament locals have a hard time getting them, let alone folks from other places.
So, is it possible for you to make a couple more baskets at a time?
Well, I still have a jar at home. Just tell anyone who wants it to come to me.
But a couple more baskets... That's going to be tough.
As you know, my son left Mt. Firmament some time ago, leaving me all alone in the house. I just don't have the energy to do it all by myself...
It's all right. I was just wondering. The decision is all yours, naturally.
...Sigh, sorry about that.
That's the case for everybody. I used to complain about him causing trouble when he was home. Now that he's gone, I have no one to help me and I miss him so terribly.
It's you, 漂泊者. It's been a while.
How's your trip so far? Hongzhen has changed a lot, hasn't it?
Well, Hongzhen is what it is now, all thanks to you and the Magistrate.
Yeah, thanks to you and our Madam Magistrate, the old Hongzhen is back.
Haha, that is true. Hongzhen was a peaceful, happy town before the Temporal Disruption.
Yeah, thanks to you and our Madam Magistrate, the old Hongzhen is back.
Oh, you should stick around longer this time. Try the Sagaci Springs, or check out the Water Plums.

Sure! Anytime you need something, just hit me up. Happy to help, always!

Well, I'm a local, after all, so of course I know more than the rangers. Lady Xinyi sent me and Bingge to assist them probably for the same reason.
But I'm not the talker Bingge is. The rangers are all right, but we just can't seem to find any common interest.
That should be the case, but I'm not the talker Bingge is. The rangers are all right, but we just can't seem to find any common interest.
In Bingge's words, it's a style clash... and that frustrates me.
You're right. I'm a country bumpkin and don't know much, but I know the ancestors came here from all over because of the due to TD Outbreak, yet they all got along in the end.
Maybe Bingge did hit it on the nail. You can't rush friendship.
Hey... Wait, haven't we met before?

Left quite an impression on me.
Trinkets and knickknacks. I'm just a small merchant trying to make a living.

You're not from around here, are you?

We're all outsiders. Why don't we get acquainted, so we can help each other out in town?

According to my family history, he's my grandfather's grandfather.
But given how unstable time moved in Mt. Firmament before, it could be off.
Nevertheless, Great-Great-Grandpa Sihong is our patriarch. That's for sure. He could recognize all the stuff our family brought with them when they moved from Mt. Firmament to Jinzhou.
The reason I came to Mt. Firmament is to trace my roots. The older folks in my family always wanted nothing more than to return to their hometown and reunite with long-lost relatives.
But they passed away before making it happen...
So you could say I've come with all their wishes and dreams on my shoulder. I feel grateful and blessed to have met Great-Great-Grandpa Sihong.
He's treating me just fine, especially given the generation gap between us. Then, you add Mt. Firmament's isolation on top—of course, there are communication issues.
Well, one step at a time.
Yes, it's nice to have someone to chat with. This is relaxing for me.
To be honest, I still feel a lingering fear whenever I think about the Temporal Disruption in Mt. Firmament. Even though it's in the past now, I'm still tense as a tightrope.
It's just that I'm worried I won't be able to manage everything or that the supplies in my shop might run short.
Things were dire at the time. It was inevitable that people would get hurt even with the Magistrate and Lady Xinyi holding down the fort.
That's why I've seen a lot of patients lately. Some have injuries that could cause complications later if not treated correctly.
I can't deny it's hard work, but it's also my duty as a healer to treat patients. I chose to do it, so no complaints.
Sigh, I just hope everyone will get well soon.
Interesting... I wouldn't believe it if I didn't see it for myself.
I wonder what makes Sagaci Springs so special...
Maybe I should try it myself sometime?

I won't. You keep the rest safe for now.
Mt. Firmament is rich in geothermal resources thanks to its unique geological and soil composition.
The water supply is also a factor as well, of course.
I had read about similar cases in research files before, but seeing the plumes of steam rising in the frigid wind in person is still quite marvelous.
The scenery here is gorgeous. Make sure to get a full-body shot of me!
Three, two, one... Done.
Wait, let me switch up my pose. Snap a few more pics of me.
Why do we need so many photos? We're not here to sight-see.

That is true...
You'll miss Yuanzhi too, right, Xunwei? Why don't I take a photo of you, too?
No thanks, I really don't look good in photos. I'm better off leaving it to Yuanzhi's memory.
Color, transparent, slightly blue.
Temperature... 41.
Characteristics...
The sample vials and containers are ready. As for specific traits, that's for lab analysis to determine.
Take a break while I sort out the data from today.
Sure. I'll text Wei. I wonder how he's doing over there.
Hey, the scenery is pretty over here, too...
Snowflakes dance among the silver trees... Can't believe I'm seeing what I read in books in real life.
I'll send the samples to the lab later. We should get a report back in two days.
Also, I checked out the test results. We're still missing several key data for building the spatiotemporal variation model...
Okay, I'll sort that out, too, when I get back. Wei can handle the survey as normal on his end. We'll focus on the missing data tomorrow. That's more efficient this way.
You did well today.
Just doing my job.
Oh, when the survey is done tomorrow, let's grab Wei and visit Yuanzhi.
Sure. Let me leave Wei a message.
Let's agree we want safety over adventure on this trip.
I have too little information on Mt. Firmament, so let's focus on scouting this time.
You're the expert, so of course I'll follow you.
But, I'm not going to skip any nice scenery we come across, either.
The two of us are among the first to sign up for a visit to Mt. Firmament. I've worked hard for a long time to get us this opportunity.
The magazine has saved a spot for us, so we've got to offer something unique.
Worry not, I'll make decisions accordingly.
Since we're traveling together, I'm responsible for your safety.
Anyone who has signed up can get a pamphlet about Mt. Firmament here. It contains detailed information on lodging and travel.
If you haven't signed up but are interested, please come and sign up here.
The Pioneer Association is an open organization. We welcome everyone with an adventurous spirit.
The last we left off, the TD Outbreak had just hit and ravaged the land. Our Hongzhen ancestors staunchly defended the mountain but were on their last legs...
In the bleakest moment, however, a powerful figure came riding in from the East!
The figure's eyes shined like stars under the dark clouds. He merely pointed a finger for the Mianloong Chamber to open and the Sentinel to pierce through the sky.
The figure's eyes shined like stars under the dark clouds. She merely pointed a finger for the Mianloong Chamber to open and the Sentinel to pierce through the sky.
In the Sentinel's glory, the Tacet Discord could not move another inch or cause any harm.

Say, would you be interested in checking out Mt. Firmament's famed Sagaci Springs?
Other than the Sagaci Springs, we also offer medicinal, floral, and alcohol baths.
Need a place to rest? We have accommodations too.

Another peaceful day.
Uneventful is the best event we can hope for.

Yinyu suggested that I should add some details to attract younger audiences, and I think that's a good idea.

Equipment? No, no, no, we don't bother with that sort of thing here. Here in Hongzhen, we rely on the Pavo Plums by the hot springs to check the water, just as our ancestors did.

Basically, I just give the Pavo Plum a good whiff, check its hue, and give it a quick lick. That’ll tell me all I need to know about the water's quality.

Corn!
Egg!

Boss...

Hm?

Rover?

Yes! They were with that little monk outside Jinzhou! How did she manage to follow us here... Oh no, did they find out what we did in Jinzhou...

No, no! That’s not it, you see, what I meant was... We couldn't pay the admission! Yes, we couldn't pay the admission fee to the hot spring!

You got it. From here on out, we'll be model citizens, contributing positively to society.

Good, I've gathered all the Pavo Plums Bing'ge requested.
Good, I've gathered all the Pavo Plums Bing'ge requested.
I'll head back to town now to deliver them.
I'll head back to town now to deliver them.

Time for a little inspection... Hmm, color checks out. And the smell... all good.
Now, onto the taste... Mmm... Yup, spot on.
The zesty bitterness hits the spot. Seems like these hot springs are clean. Whew, I can finally breathe easy.

What in the world... Ha, that's got to be one heck of a story!

Something delicious, warm, and easy to the stomach!
Abby's stomach growls…

It smells delicious! Let's feed her, quick! And hey, don't forget to save some for me!

I really thought I was going to die here…
Had we not ran into you, you'd be Tacet Discord poop by now.
Eek…

No, I can't go back yet. I still have unfinished business here.

We honor the Sentinel with a special ritual. Uncle Fu used to organize it for us, but he's been unwell in recent years. No one has taken over.
So this year, I volunteered to be the Flamebearer for the Rite of Offering.
I know I'm just an ordinary person, and there's probably not much I can do to help...
But at least I can convey our well-wishes through this ritual. Who knows? It might help the Sentinel recover.

Uh… I've been stuck at the very first step…

Yes. Speaking of which, Hongzhen has been through some really tough times. Ever since the TD Outbreak, the elders established a tradition of having guardians.

Hehe, let me toot my own horn for a moment—Jiye and I were the first ones to sense the Temporal Disruption and notify everyone.
But the disruption was just an accident. Hongzhen hasn't had major problems for years under the Sentinel's blessings.
So we are the only guardians left in Hongzhen from our generation.

Well, I can't blame him, really. He's been at it for most of his life and just can't let go.
Uncle Fu gazes into the horizon, too lost in his thoughts to notice anyone around him.
Uncle Fu gazes into the horizon, too lost in his thoughts to notice anyone around him.

Mt. Firmament is still a mystery to outsiders, after all.

Naturally, business has picked up as a result.

I dreamed of something cool. I was planning to share it with you!
I dreamed of...
I dreamed of a new world rising from the ashes of the old.
Escape? There's no escaping the rolling wheels of history.
And you're about to witness my small contribution to the fire that will soon consume all...
You're here just in time. The cargo truck made it to Port Gunchao in one piece, but it broke down completely shortly afterwards.

You don't recognize me just because I changed the outfit?
Maggie! It's me, Maji!
I still feel nostalgic about this outfit. It fits me well.

After dispersing the group of Hoochiefs, you and Maji bring the frightened freshman courier back to Jinzhou.
Grandpa Zou seems to be telling another story…
Grandpa Zou seems to be telling another story…

… With a wave of her hand, Mianloong Chamber bursted open! The Sentinel awoke from its deep slumber, breaking through the clouds with unstoppable force!
The Tacet Discords froze under its intimidating aura, unable to cause further harm.

Hmm… so, which version is the real one?
Haha, who cares? Today's story sounds more entertaining than yesterday's. That's all I care about!

I… I understand what you're trying to tell me.
Wuli is an experienced adventurer, always wary of hidden dangers. He's highly cautious and never lets his communication get cut off.
We have explored countless places together, even the most perilous ones. The world has been ravaged by the Lament, but amidst all the destruction, new life emerges, captivating us both.
However, since I became unable to accompany him on his journeys, Wuli has given up chasing his dreams.
I don't want my absence to taint his joy. I refuse to be the one who holds him back from pursuing his passions.
I really don't want to be the one who stops him from pursuing his dreams, so I…
I will… Thank you, 漂泊者.
Thank you, I will.
By the way, Lady Changli... Did she...
...Nothing. Please forget about it. Thank you, 漂泊者.
Please inform us immediately if anything occurs. The Midnight Rangers are ready to aid you at any time.
Take care.
Don't worry. Since Changli extended an invitation to you, she should be in good health now.
On that note... I'm surprised our usually strategic Counselor made such a spontaneous decision.
What else can I do for you?
Grandpa Zou seems to have boundless energy, doesn't he? He arrived with an old, tattered book and told us he wanted to reconnect with his family. None of us knew him though.
I gave him a tour around Hongzhen, and then we became quite close. As it turns out, we're actually related.
However... I'm still unsure about how to address him as a family member.... Regardless, it's a pleasant discovery to make.
Sigh... Looks like I've lost track of her again. Fine, I'll go back to work...
Hmm? Where did our photographer go this time?
Oh my goodness! I can't believe I just had a conversation with Lady Changli! I'm so pumped up!
Alright! Time to get back to work! Let me see… The next location is…
Thank you for fulfilling my wish, 漂泊者.
I am done with my work in Jinzhou. Now I should be able to stay in Hongzhen for a bit longer.
I've heard the springs here work wonders for relieving fatigue. Hmm… perhaps I'll indulge myself a little.
Hehe... If you have a moment to spare, I suggest staying here a bit longer.
Hongzhen is quite the pleasant place to relax.
...And then that monster popped up right in front of my friend! Its eyes were as big as lanterns, and its teeth as long as rolling pins!
Oh, interesting... Please, continue.
My friend knew enough not to turn his back on the monster—he'd be an easy meal!
So he backed away slowly and stepped on a rock. He bent down and used everything he had to pick it up and... guess what?
He drove the monster away with the rock?
No, the monster just vanished into thin air! Not even a footprint in the snow!
I'm telling you, it's no ordinary monster! It's a ghost, the vengeful spirit of a slain beast...
You don't believe me, do you? I'm not making this up! My friend told me himself!
Yeah? If not, where could this story have come from? My friend who got eaten?
Fine, believe what you want. My throat's parched from all this yapping. I'm off to grab a cup of tea.
Oh, by the way, he lives just around the corner. Go ask him yourself if you think I'm pulling your leg.
With that, the resident shrugs and strolls off.
Well, it's good to have a witness at least.
Yes, that's me. And you must be the Rover, the hero Madam Xinyi spoke of from Jinzhou and Hongzhen?
Don't be modest. Your heroic deeds are already recorded in the Hongzhen Chronicle.
I'm just a newbie intern, so I don't get to write those epic tales... yet.
But that's fine, I have my own mission. I'm investigating the two Mt. Firmament incidents. Once I piece it all together, it'll go into the Hongzhen Chronicle.
Yes, one is the sighting of a huge monster, as the gentleman mentioned.
The other comes from a hunter who found animals and Tacet Discords frozen solid in a valley.
Indeed. I've read through the Hongzhen Chronicle, and it says the Sentinel's barrier keeps out Tacet Discords, even Elite Class ones.
The rare Elite Class Tacet Discords are only spotted in far-off places. In the Chronicle, they're dubbed beasts, scourges, or even blessings.
Yeah, probably because Elite Class Tacet Discords are super rare, they're almost mythical, seen as omens of good or bad luck.
Anyway, based on these witness accounts, I think there's a link between this monster and the beast in the Chronicle.
Rumors have been flying around, getting all exaggerated, but I’m still unclear on where these incidents actually happened.
But here's the kicker—I've tracked down the rumor spreaders.
Yep, one's a herb collector from Hongzhen, and the other's a hunter. Makes sense, given their line of work.
But…
Well, I do think Tacet Discords are behind all this, but still I can't help but wonder... do ghosts really exist?
I-I suspected as much. I've studied Remnant Ecoacoustics, so I know it's just a natural phenomenon caused by Reverberations!
For real? Have you seen a ghost before, Rover?
Y-yeah, just a natural phenomenon. Nothing to be scared of!
This is excitement, not fear! Exploring the unknown is my jam!
Let's go, Rover! It's time to uncover the truth!
Are those… cages? Who would put cages out here?!
Seems like they were used to lock something up. Good news is, it wasn't a person, judging from these claw marks.
Let's take some pictures, just in case.
Oh my… this is... gosh...
This is… a pretty steep hill…
Are you alright? Do you want to take a break?
Are you alright? Do you want to take a break?
I'm beat. Never hiked anything like this... Guess I'm not cut out for the Midnight Rangers.
It's okay. We're almost there. I can hang on a bit longer...
A data tablet?
Looks like it's just a diary. I guess a Fractsidus member accidentally left it behind.
They must've left in a hurry, leaving personal items behind like that.
What did the Fractsidus do…? He was one of their own…
Take cover somewhere safe. I'll handle this.
Take cover somewhere safe. I'll handle this.
You're finally awake.
In the Somnoire, you're safe.
You seemed to have passed out. I brought you to this safe Memory Zone.
I saw you confronting that creepy Fractsidus person before.
Looks like Somnoire not only revived his abilities but also strengthened them.
Determination is good, but don't overextend yourself.
Make sure you're fully prepared before facing him again.
If you need help, talk to me any time. I'll be in the Somnoire.
Good. Well then, until our paths cross.
For unknown reasons, you cannot bring yourself to say those words.
For unknown reasons, you cannot bring yourself to say those words.
A faint voice whispers to you, Don't mention me to him.
A faint voice whispers to you, Don't mention me to him.
Vague memories seem to resurface... Instead of saying anything, you remain silent.
Vague memories seem to resurface... Instead of saying anything, you remain silent.

Well then, until our paths cross.
Scar's flame consumes you. You drift into unconsciousness. Time passes...
Bad news, boss! Ain't that the Lollo Hitman?!
Dang, no way! Who the heck called Lollo Hitman?
But, but we already apologized! Hmph, we won't be beaten for the same matter twice. Let's kick his arse!
But, but we already apologized! Hmph, we won't be beaten for the same matter twice. Let's kick her arse!
Hello, 漂泊者.
Haha, what a polite young lad.
Haha, what a polite young lass.
I'm the one who had witnessed Hongzhen grow into what it is today before I handed it over to Xinyi.
Alas, let the past stay in the past… Just call me Uncle Fu.
So, what do you think about Hongzhen nowadays?
Ah, you're quite optimistic, young one.
You've seen the crisis at Mt. Firmament, yet you're not scared, are you?
You remind me of Xinyi the first time I saw her.
You are both someone who lived through turbulent times and stood tall against all odds.
Forgive me, I've lost myself. I wanted to see you because I have something to give you.
Uncle Fu takes out a scale-like object and hands it over to you solemnly.
Here you are.
When I first became the Mayor of Hongzhen, I came across this thing on one of my walks in the mountains.
At first, I was intrigued by its peculiar shape, so I brought it back to town with me. But afterward, it revealed some truly amazing power.
Well, no... Listen, I might be old, but I've always let nature take its course.
People age and die, even in Hongzhen. The Sentinel's power could only slow down time but not reverse it.
This scale—It seems like it has captured Hongzhen in a frozen slice of time.
A few nights after I found it, I dreamed of the moment I picked it up.
The dream felt as real as life. I could even see the falling snow clearly—as if time had frozen.
Yeah, I was elated by the surprise like you did.
I kept going back to it for the better half of a month until I finally realized I wasn't dreaming that night.
Though small, this scale contains unimaginable power. When I carry it, it records my experiences and lets me relive them later.
I call this ability Chrono Tracing. With it, I can see and hear everything I've experienced before and even talk to those people in the Chrono Trace…
I used this ability to record every detail in Hongzhen. It certainly made the compilation of the Hongzhen Chronicle much easier.
During the day, I'd go through the archives and visit residents. At night, I used this magical token to organize the information I'd gathered.
As I was ankle deep in the governing affairs... I couldn't picture what a lousy job I would have done on my official duties without its help.
Hahaha, before I answer your question, let me ask you one.
Guess what I recorded the most with this scale?
At first, I used it solely for important events. But as time passed, I changed the way I handled it.
You're right. After I had stepped down as the Mayor of Hongzhen, I was no longer involved in Hongzhen's affairs.
When I handed over the position to Xinyi, I gave this scale to her as well.
But she was a considerate one and soon returned it to me.
For she saw that I found I needed it more. So rather than using it to archive the nitty-gritty of her work, she allowed me to record the people I cherished.
I watched many kids in Hongzhen grow up and leave.
At first, I thought they’d come back someday, but I realized I'd never see many of them again.
Over the years, I've really missed those young folks who left Mt. Firmament for new lives.
So, I used the scale to create a Chrono Trace for nearly every resident in Hongzhen.
Whenever I missed them, I visited and talked to them in those Chrono Traces.
Alright, enough talk about me. Let's talk about you, 漂泊者?
Something tells me this scale is related to Jué.
Back then, I thought Hongzhen needed Xinyi more than me, just like Jinhsi did Jué.
I've built my life around this town, but you, 漂泊者, you're not restricted to Hongzhen or even Huanglong.

You'll need this scale more than I do... Or, rather, you two fit right together.

What's surprising is, despite the ancient lore painting Hongzhen as an isolated paradise, what I see is a vibrant, bustling community.

How exactly did it protect everyone again... Oh, in your dream it made the time different there?
Hmm... The time in the mountains seemed to have slowed down from the outside, away from the Tacet Discords.
Hmm... The time in the mountains seemed to have slowed down from the outside, away from the Tacet Discords.
The Sentinel must have created a barrier by manipulating the flow of time, keeping those monsters out.
The Sentinel must have created a barrier by manipulating the flow of time, keeping those monsters out.
It was a safe haven from all the disturbances caused by the Tacet Discords, where people lived peacefully...
It was a safe haven from all the disturbances caused by the Tacet Discords, where people lived peacefully...
Also... In my dream, I wasn't affected by the slowed time and could freely move in and out of the barrier.
Also... In my dream, I wasn't affected by the slowed time and could freely move in and out of the barrier.
It's no shock that you have awesome powers, being friends with me.
Hmm... What was that place you dreamed about called?
I'm not entirely sure I heard it correctly, but in my dream, the Sentinel mentioned a place called Mt. Firmament.
I'm not entirely sure I heard it correctly, but in my dream, the Sentinel mentioned a place called Mt. Firmament.
Mt. Firmament? Never heard of it...
You never heard of Mt. Firmament? Then I'm sure you're not from around here.
Hold on! Did you just say Mt. Firmament?!
Oh my! Did that Echo just... talk?
Come on, man, relax. I know you don't hear an Echo talking every day, but it's not that uncommon either!
I heard there's a country called Ri... Rinas... What? Anyway, the Echoes there are next level.
Oh, you're not from around here? Well, that explains why you don't know about Mt. Firmament.
Legends say Mt. Firmament is where the first people of Jinzhou lived. it looks like a giant statue of our Sentinel Jué.
I've never actually heard of anyone going to that place. They say those who try either get lost in the sea mist or never come back.
If you're curious, just head southeast. Mt. Firmament is on the east side of Whining Aix's Mire, and you can see it from a distance.
The southeast...
The past few days, especially this morning, I caught this unique smell from the southeast. From that mountain they just mentioned.
It's like a strong energy pulsing through the air, but I can't quite put my finger on it. It feels kind of weird though, doesn't smell natural...
Could it have anything to do with what you said? A place where time passes slowly?
Hmm... Do you wanna go check it out?
I had a flashback about seeing their Sentinel... Perhaps that happened on Mt. Firmament...
I had a flashback about seeing their Sentinel... Perhaps that happened on Mt. Firmament...
I can feel an unknown force guiding me, urging me to go there and find something...
I can feel an unknown force guiding me, urging me to go there and find something...
Jinhsi said she'll go search for the Sentinel and update me on its whereabouts.
Jinhsi said she'll go search for the Sentinel and update me on its whereabouts.
But so far, I have not heard anything from the City Hall yet...
But so far, I have not heard anything from the City Hall yet...
Then... Shall we go check it out together? It feels really suspicious.
Mt. Firmament glowed with the sun's light, high above the clouds and snow. Then suddenly, they vanished, revealing a distant blue sky.
And amidst it all stood a white-haired maiden, like a goddess descended from the heavens.
With a mere wave of her hand, she brought forth a new season, transforming the streets below.
This maiden was none other than the dead infant, now reborn as Magistrate of Jinzhou.
When thunder roars in spring's embrace, the sun shall shine upon this place.
For only through death and strife, can one truly embrace new life.
Hmm... I see. Doesn’t matter. That’s not important for our goal.
We have the answers we wanted already.
—With the Second Resonance Awakening, we will tap into powers that rival the Sentinels... Complete control of the artificial Resonator Awakening process is within reach.
And lastly, about that Rover...
This trip was worth it. We've collected many wonderful notes, haven't we?
It's about time.
Get moving. Can't let a certain someone wait too long behind bars.
Lady Xinyi, Madam Magistrate has returned.
Greetings, Madam Magistrate.
Honored to be in your presence, Magistrate Jinhsi.
Let me see. This should be where the final step takes place. By the look of it, is this... the place called Loong's Crest?
We need to align the pearl with its mouth… Alright, I've got the hang of it.
Hm... I'll take care of the one on the right side!
The puzzle here seems to require two people to crack.
Anything I can help with?
...The door opened! Be careful.
Thank you! But what on earth is this place?
I will handle this!
You've done it... You defeated him.
But this is not the end. You may choose to go to the deeper layers of this dream, where challenges still await.
In the future, you may encounter more and more people or things you're familiar with in the Somnoire.
But I believe, you'll get to the bottom of what created these bizarre realms.
Until then. See you around.
...Please pardon my rudeness earlier. I... I didn't know you  were here to help Madam Magistrate.
...Thank you for your understanding.
First the Temporal Disruption, and now the Fractsidus. When will we ever get a break... If trouble finds us again, our people won't stand a chance.
Anyway, I still want to make it up to you.
Just give me a call if you need anything at Mt. Firmament.
How are you feeling, Xiangping? Are you hurt? I'll call for help.
My wife...
Don't worry, my dear. No need to trouble the young ones.
We were in a hurry and accidents happen. I'll be fine. I can handle it myself.
But... Are you sure? You've been feeling unwell for years, and now...
Well, we're alive at least. Can't complain. A few scrapes and bruises are nothing compared to what could've happened.
Goodness, that kind young lady saved our lives from the Disruption. If it weren't for her, I wouldn't still be breathing today.
A kind young lady? You mean...
Oh, come on. That's not just any young lady. She's the Magistrate of Jinzhou!
...Oh, my, so she is our Magistrate? She looked so young...
You there, young man. I bet you have more important things to do. Don't let an old man like me hold you back. Go and accomplish your tasks with purpose.
You there, young lady. I bet you have more important things to do. Don't let an old man like me hold you back. Go and accomplish your tasks with purpose.
My eyes may be old and blurry, but my mind is sharp as ever.
I've lived my whole life in Mt. Firmament, but people are all the same no matter where you go. Our actions reveal our true character.
And now, at this crucial turning point for Mt. Firmament, your arrival... Yes... It is no mere coincidence.
In these troubled times, you may hold the key to bring about much-needed change.
How did it go for you?
I saved as many people as possible and directed them to safety. But there were others... I did what I could.
Don't beat yourself up, we acted quickly and saved a lot of lives.
*sigh* It's all thanks to Lady Xinyi...
I was so overwhelmed, my mind went blank. If she hadn't been there to give orders, I wouldn't have even made it out alive, let alone save anyone.
It's rare to hear that from you.
I remember how much you opposed Uncle Fu's decision to let her take the reins back in the day.
...Well... I thought she knew nothing about our town as an outsider...
But it was too late, the decision had been made based on the support she received. In the end, I just accepted the inevitable.
Uh... Have you never heard about Uncle Fu?
...He must be the esteemed guest from Jinzhou Lady Xinyi mentioned.
...She must be the esteemed guest from Jinzhou Lady Xinyi mentioned.
Ah, I see.
That man in the white shirt is Uncle Fu, former leader of Hongzhen. Despite having stepped down from his position, he still commands respect from the townsfolk.
He's said to be over a hundred years old, making him the oldest person in town.
Sigh... It must be tough for him, enduring all this chaos at his age...
